story:
Numberism Art For Bernie Sanders!

Purchase Numberism shirts, prints and original artwork to support Bernie Sander's campaign for Presidency! 90% of profits from shirts and prints, and 50% of sales from originals go to the Bernie Sanders Campaign!


I am a professional artist in Portland, Oregon, and I support Bernie Sanders for President! I draw art entirely with numbers and letters *by hand* (usually with math and science) and I created two Numberism drawings inspired by Bernie Sanders to support his campaign. I have been selling these online and sending his campaign 90% of the profit from the sales. With a large order, we can lower the cost of the shirts so that even more money is going to him from each shirt sale! So far we have raised $429 for him. This campaign aims to raise the rest of the $2,700 that I as an individual can donate to him. (update we have raised $617)

There are two designs to choose from. The Bernie Sanders Portrait is drawn with some of Bernie Sanders' most exciting goals, figures on his impressive public support, and words like "Bernie Sanders 2016", "Feel the Bern" and "Vote!" The new Bird drawing was inspired by Bernie's recent visit to Portland, Oregon where he was endorsed by the local avian population. It is drawn with words that reflect his campaign and character like "Compassion", "Education", "Healthcare", Not For Sale", "Not Me Us", "Democracy", "Equality" and "99%". The word bubble is drawn with "Vote!", "99%" and "For The People".

All items listed here come with a description of the words and numbers used to create them.

Should we go over the $2,700 donation cap, I will look into donating the rest into a like minded charity.

Shirts! $20 = $10.80 -12.60 to Bernie!

I will contact you after the campaign is complete to get your preferred size. Available sizes are Ladies small -2XL and Men's S - 3XL

There are two cost brackets for the shirts. If we sell 100 of them, then $10.80 from each shirt will go to Bernie. At 200 sold, we can lower the cost so that $12.60 will go to Bernie for each shirt. This alone will get us almost to our goal of our contribution cap. 

Bird Shirt - Mens and Ladies 100% cotton Silkscreen

Drawn with words that reflect his campaign and character. Comes with a description of the words used.


Bernie Portrait Shirt Mens and Ladies 100% cotton Silkscreen

Drawn with platform policies, information on his huge public support and words like "Feel The Bern" and "Vote!" Comes with a description fo the numbers and letters used to draw him.

Paper Prints! $15 each = $12.60 to Bernie

8"x10" Paper prints signed by me and includes a description of the numbers used to create the piece. Comes with an acid free white backer board and is in a crystal clear bag.

I make these in my studio, and am just taking our cost of printing them plus 90 cents for each. The rest goes to Bernie.

Below are detail images of the drawings so you can see the words and numbers.

Shirt Printing, Pricing and Contribution:

We get our shirt printing done by ANova Print in Portland, Oregon who is offering us cheaper silkscreen printing services for the cause. If we sell 100 shirts, then $10.80 from each shirt will go to Bernie after cost. However, If we get  200 shirts sold  we will be able to order them for $6 a shirt!!!! That would mean every shirt would generate $12.6 for Bernie Sanders.

Please Share this campaign to get to the 200 shirt goal!! :)

What the rest of the money is doing:

The funds not going to Bernie is to cover cost of printing. We are also taking 10% to offset the cost of paying my assistant to ship these. Other than covering the cost of producing these, if we reach our goal of selling 200 shirts, my company will pull in $305 to cover labor, with the rest of the $2,271 going to Bernie.

Original Numberism Drawings- $500

= $250 to Bernie $250 to Sienna

*The original drawings are special. Buying those will give half to Bernie and half to me the artist for drawing them. As it stands, I cover my printing costs and get a little over a dollar for labor for each shirt. I'm okay with this because it's an investment in our future, but it's still money out for me and running a little arts business can be pricey. This bit is just to support me doing what I do if you are so inclined.

Original Bird Numberism drawing. Pen and Color Pencil on toned paper. Comes signed by me with a description of the numbers and words I used to hand draw this!


Original Bernie Portrait Numberism Drawing #1 $500

= $250 to Bernie $250 to Sienna Morris

Original Bernie Portrait Numberism drawing. Pen and Color Pencil on toned paper. Comes signed by me with a description of the numbers and words I used to hand draw this! ("Feel The Bern" words are not included in the original. I will take a new photo of the original soon.)

Original Bernie Portrait Numberism Drawing 2 $500

= $250 to Bernie $250 to Sienna Morris

I drew two of these. This one features thinner numbers. Original Bernie Portrait Numberism drawing. Pen and Color Pencil on toned paper. Comes signed by me with a description of the numbers and words I used to hand draw this! ("Feel The Bern" words are not included in the original. I will take a new photo of the original soon.)

Shipping Time

Expect one month delivery time after campaign is complete.

Potential Issues

There really aren't any. I make my own prints and am prepared for large paper print orders. The shirts are made by ANova Print. The only potential delay would be if there is any shipping delay from his shirt supplier. If that happens, we would be looking at two week delay at the most. I've been shipping my artwork for 5 years using USPS Click n Ship which I do for my arts business. We know what we're doing, are professional arts businesses and can handle large orders. If we get a HUGE order then those ordering past the 200 shirts would expect them to arrive in 6 weeks, rather than in 4. 

The only real issue is surpassing the $2,271 goal. After that amount, I can no longer donate to Bernie Sanders, given my previous contributions. If we surpass that number, I will donate the remaining contributions to a like minded charity that both Bernie Sanders and I support.

story:
We are a group of non-aligned artist-activists – see We Polter! – engaging with both the #Remain, and the #Brexit campaign. Our goal? To generate debate around issues that actually matter to people, so that, come 23 June, everyone has something to vote FOR – rather than just something to vote AGAINST.

One of these issues is the steel crisis and, linked into that, the future of British manufacturing, if not the future of work itself. #SteelTheReferendum takes these crisis/developments as its starting point and engages with the workers and communities affected by them to bring their struggles to the attention of the wider public through art, utilising social media, as well as traditional media, to get our messages, and our story, out – and, come the referendum, bring the vote in.

This will involve us working with local artist-activists in affected communities in the run-up to the referendum between 26 May and 09 June. Subject to funding, the material these interventions generate – images, sounds and texts – will then be used in billboard displays, posters and the like, thus enabling us to insert ourselves into public discourse at critical moments during the EU Referendum campaign.

To #SteelTheReferendum as planned, we hope to raise £15,000. We need this money to cover travel and accommodation, as well as printing and display costs. We also would like to pay Nicodemus (the project director) a modest fee. If we are more successful than expected, we will cap our core funding at £20,000 and use any excess funding to scale the initiative (increase print runs etc) or to support other artist-activists doing work around the EU Referendum as well.

To realise the full potential of this initiative, we have designed the most wicked perks on offer anywhere in crowdfunding land.

The purpose of these perks is not just to make you part with your money, as much as we would like you to do that, but to encourage you to get involved hands-on in the initiative itself. As a guerrilla, rebel, mutineer, insurgent or indeed revolutionary artist, you will be offered opportunities to directly contribute to the interventions we are planning.

Obviously, the more money we raise, the more opportunities there will be for people to get involved. So, please give generously, tell your friends about us, and engage. Together we can #SteelTheReferendum.

#SteelTheReferendum has been conceived by Nicodemus who is also a co-producer of artsforeu, the UK's only artist-led pro-European campaign. However, #SteelTheReferendum is a non-aligned initiative, inviting input from all sides.

#SteelTheReferendum is supported by the Democracy School, which acts as the initiative's accountable body and delivery partner.

story:
Johanna (or Selina, to you) is a writer, model and longtime comicbook freak.

Marueuge (she is our gorgeous Pamela) is a model, actress and dancer.

And I, Lilia (or Harley), am an actress, singer and cosplayer/cosmaker.

One day I realized that we were a blonde, a redhead and a brunette, which is perfect for a Gotham City Sirens cosplay team!

So I talked to the girls and told them about this crazy idea... they loved it! So we talked

Martin, who’s is Supercharger designer; he also loved the idea and was thrilled by the challenge of designing and making with his own unique style, this iconic comic book villains and portray them with us in character.

story:
Why me and this show?

  • The Artist: http://www.jimgarmhausenart.com/
    I spent many years as a cartoonist, selling to weekly papers with small successes along the way, and my style reflects that background. There is an emphasis on characters, and particularly faces. The theme of my work, if there is one, comes out of the collective expression of these many characters, and the feeling that pours into them as I let them into the world, line by line. ​I create art because it feels absolutely essential to do so, and to hold back on it creates dark shadows and internal disturbances and has me lurking about in ways that worry people. I am drawn to aged, worn surfaces, and display work in cheap antique framing that gives a sense of a rediscovery of something stored away and forgotten.

  • Governor Island Art Fair: http://www.4heads.org/governors-island-art-fair/
    I have been selected to participate in the 9th annual Governors Island Art Fair, organized by 4heads, a New York City nonprofit organization created by artists for artists. Imagine an old army barracks, in which 100 artists have been given rooms to create their own installation. Not only is this an honor, but a unique opportunity to connect my art to the New York art scene. 
  • Why this event: A piece only becomes “complete” when a viewer connects with it, and it is gratifying when a piece finds someone out in the world, and something alchemical happens, and a circle is created. While I have an excellent following in Ithaca and have had pieces in shows throughout the country, I need to step into the wider art world in a tangible way. Getting to this show will help me take this step.

What I Need & What You Get

Breaking it Down:

What I need, in order of importance (IE: if that's what I make, that is what I will use it for).
Item Amount times Total Running total
Gas (I will drive a 1998 Honda Accord from Ithaca and back each weekend) $50 10 500 500
Printing costs (The more I print, the more I can sell, plus you can get some of these) 200 1 200 700
Tolls, parking (It's NYC) 30 5 150 850
Subway (See above) 10 10 100 950
Accommodations (I am trying to work out some couches to crash on, but I'm 6'4") 50 9 450 1400
Food (I can pack PBJs, my wife is pretty good at this, but...) 20 9 180 1580
Coffee (Actually, this should probably go above food) 5 9 45 1625
Beer (If you don't understand why this is a necessity you haven't seen an artist in a high stakes social situation, but my wife says it has to come last on this list) 5 9 45 1670
What you get: Your unique perks!! (Gimme Gimme - not the coffee *See coffee above)
  • Prints! *See picture above for one example.
  • Ceramic heads, stickers, and so much more...
  • These will open up when I've set up the show:
  • A chance to buy original art at a discount (pre-fair)! 
  • A unique gambling opportunity: bet on the piece that will sell and get a free perk if it does! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute $$, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  1. Use the Indiegogo share tools to share this with folks who can.
  2. Find me a bed or a 7' couch in Brooklyn (or other reasonably close locale to Governors Island).
  3. Make the artist a meal (I'm dairy intolerant - TMI?).
  4. Car pool to NYC? (I reserve the right to politely decline, I might not be the best company for 4 hours.)

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Contributing Artists:

Milo Yiannopoulos, Gavin McInnes, and Martin Shkreli among participating artists in first ever pro-Trump gallery exhibition. 

The opening for #DaddyWillSaveUs will be held at 191 North, 14th Street, Brooklyn, New York October 8th starting at 8pm ET. 

Headlining speakers and contributors for the opening include outspoken gay conservative Milo Yiannopoulos and Vice co-founder Gavin McInnes. Additional contributors include Martin Shkreli, James O'Keefe, the Godesky Brothers, Jon Proby, Sebastian Sommer, and more!!

“I think this exhibition will fight the dogma of a single accepted political ideology among artists and the creative class as a whole,” said Wintrich, the New York City resident behind Twinks4Trump. 

Wintrich says, “MAGA (Make AmericaGreat Again) hats have become the new Campbell’s soup cans.”

Full, large format prints of Wintrich’s work will be available at silent auction at the exhibition, with 30% of proceeds doing to American Military Partner Association, the nation's largest organization for the partners, spouses, and families of America's LGBT service members.

Milo Yiannopoulos said of the event, “"Who knew that the way to be on the cutting edge of controversy in the art world would be to support Donald Trump. The LBGT community's response to Lucian and his fellow artists is embarrassing. How can a movement dedicated to expression, pride, and diversity be so dead set against diversity of opinion?”

 

 

Let’s Win the Culture War

After the first public premiere and success of my “#Twinks4Trump” photo series at the RNC, progressives got me fired. Let’s see what they do when we throw a full-scale MASSIVE premiere and art party!

Naturally, I refuse to stop. I can’t. Free speech matters. Not that I mind social attacks, but there’s a problem when those attacks carry over to my ability, or anyone who does not tow the line or fit the code, to earn a living.

Despite the first portion of the show being written up about in everything from Rolling Stone to a vast array of international art publications; unfortunately, art doesn’t pay that well.

Andrew Breitbart always said that “politics is downstream from culture.” #DaddyWillSaveUs is here to beg the question: can we thrust the conservative movement into the center of international art and culture? Can we show that our ‘basket of deplorables’ is better in every way than the ‘basket of pantsuits’ on the left?

 

We can do this:

We need to raise a minimum of $19,500 in a short period of time. These costs will cover everything from the rental of the venue (an immersive 4,500sq foot space) to providing the ingredients that will be crafted into unique Trump-themed appetizers by a former Masterchef finalist (hint: he’s Scottish). This is the opportunity to create an anti-safe space and showcase hypocrisy. That is when art is most powerful.

 

Why $22,500?

The venue we found and materials we need to carry this project out cost $19,500, alone. The additional 3k added to this crowdfund will go toward human resources — including the full-time efforts I will put into this until the event opens in October. While art doesn’t always pay, I am hoping that some economics can trickle down and help all of the artists and organizers involved, myself included. Hopefully, some of this will compensate for the position I was previously evicted from because of my political beliefs.

 

When is it?

The show will be on a weekend in early to mid-October, the exact date will be released after confirmation from two of our VIP speakers.

Updates will follow as funds are allocated, but the actual event is going to blow your mind. It’s a game changer and you can join in on the fun. Please chip in what you can. Even $10 will go a long way to showing the world that we all exist and we’re here to stay. If you can give a bit more, I’ve created some incentives with my team at RABBLE.

It goes without saying that your contribution here is not a contribution to any campaign.

A selection of available prints available through perks:

Note: More prints will be added as campaign continues.

Let’s see what they do when we throw a full-scale MASSIVE premiere and art party!Naturally, I refuse to stop. I can’t. Free speech matters. Not that I mind social attacks, but there’s a problem when those attacks carry over to my ability, or anyone who does not tow the line or fit the code, to earn a living.Despite the first portion of the show being written up about in everything from Rolling Stone to a vast array of international art publications; unfortunately, art doesn’t pay that well.Andrew Breitbart always said that “politics is downstream from culture.” #DaddyWillSaveUs is here to beg the question: can we thrust the conservative movement into the center of international art and culture? Can we show that our ‘basket of deplorables’ is better in every way than the ‘basket of pantsuits’ on the left? We can do this:We need to raise a minimum of $19,500 in a short period of time. These costs will cover everything from the rental of the venue (an immersive 4,500sq foot space) to providing the ingredients that will be crafted into unique Trump-themed appetizers by a former Masterchef finalist (hint: he’s Scottish). This is the opportunity to create an anti-safe space and showcase hypocrisy. That is when art is most powerful. Why $22,500?The venue we found and materials we need to carry this project out cost $19,500, alone. The additional 3k added to this crowdfund will go toward human resources — including the full-time efforts I will put into this until the event opens in October. While art doesn’t always pay, I am hoping that some economics can trickle down and help all of the artists and organizers involved, myself included. Hopefully, some of this will compensate for the position I was previously evicted from because of my political beliefs. When is it?The show will be on a weekend in early to mid-October, the exact date will be released after confirmation from two of our VIP speakers.Updates will follow as funds are allocated, but the actual event is going to blow your mind. It’s a game changer and you can join in on the fun. Please chip in what you can. Even $10 will go a long way to showing the world that we all exist and we’re here to stay. If you can give a bit more, I’ve created some incentives with my team at RABBLE.It goes without saying that your contribution here is not a contribution to any campaign.A selection of available prints available through perks:Note: More prints will be added as campaign continues.

story:
As one of my friends put it, we have to help the people in our own backyard. So with this in mind I endeavour to buy a Compact Modular prefab container style home for a young family in Brazil. Project 1 - Julya is 5 years old and needs a house of her own to grow up in!

The big picture mission

This campaign has unlimited potential so if we can raise enough funds we will purchase and install a home for the needy.

First level objective to reach 60K 

20K will go to the purchase of a container home for the young family in Brazil

 

Second level when we reach 80K 

30K will go to build 2 Sustainable container homes in HAITI

 

Third Level at a 100K

40K will go into acquiring 2 to 3 homes

And so we aim to give back up to 40% of total perks revenue proceeds, so please be generous so we can transmit the message of hope, love and art.

Art affects off of us and for me it is a passion. Creating is a passion. Seeing an audience get moved by it is so rewarding. All artist need support in order for the creation to continue. Yet Art needs to remain accessible so with this in mind I hope to offer rewards that meet this goal. 

In 2015 I came out with my first edition of FASCINASIA, it needs to be updated to a second edition with a couple of improvements. I also want to publish a book of the new work since that was shown during last years' Miami Art Basel week and all my new mixed media paintings to show and share the continual evolution. It is entitled "Love is Eternal".  In addition I have 2 new books I would like to launch based on my travels to special sectors in Brazil: The first being - Sea of Dunes based on the magical, Lençóis Maranhenses National Park. The Second book would be based on my very resent trip to Brasilia - "Geometric City".

 

The small mission

Presently I am seeking funds to complete the Book projects. You can see the completed first edition in the Video. You have the option to choose it and get it quickly or hold out until I reach my finding goals to create a Second edition of the book "FASCINASIA". Having returned to South East Asia in early 2016 and visited Japan Vietnam, Hong Kong, Singapore,Laos, Myanmar & Thailand I am excited to show my new work and continue the FASCINASIA series with a new book" Love is Eternal". I am always delighted to hear such appreciation for my fine art photography so in that spirit I would like to release never published images from the Brazil series in these 2 new books.

My goal is simply to get my vision of reflecting beauty in the world to as many eyes as I can. Extended goals are to bring my next Art show to a city closer to you, so a world tour be a long term goal.  I am always working on new Solo exhibitions and with strong support I can bring my work to major Art fair cites and continue a strong studio practice.

  • REWARDS - Now offering new paintings and photography that in many cases have never been available as limited edition prints are now offered as rewards. Special collector editions of limited print are being made available at special prices that are up to 50% off. 
  • PRINTING - The costs of doing high end books are as high as $70 a piece. So getting a large bulk order can bring the costs down which makes it more accessible.
  • STUDIO - New materials and running an Atelier to create new pieces $3000 / month basic costs.
  •  GOAL - If I reach the goal I will invest in printing as many books as I can so I can do a Book Signing at my next shows. I will also put funds towards the setting up of as many shows as I can pull off in a year. Should I surpass my goal buy a Compact Modular prefab container style home for a young family in Brazil and other countries in need.  I will add other cities to tour my Art, Hong Kong London, Paris, Russia and Dubai could be added to the tour. Should the Goal not be reached I will simply invest in doing the next show and ordering as many books as I can.

The Impact

It can take many years for an Artist to live well from his craft, ultimately this campaign goes a long way to making that dream come true:

  • Art and culture are important to the human fabric. My supporters are often as passionate as I am about the work. So in order to leave lasting legacy behind for generations to enjoy it require an audience that supports it. 
  • Since 2014 I have had successful Solo Shows in the Miami and realized the Design and printing of my Book of my Asian series entitled FASCINASIA in 2015.
  • Miami Art Basel 2016 was also a success at the Shore Club Hotel so this year we raise the bar.

Risks & Challenges

Seeing as I have programmed to do 'Print on demand' there is no risk.

The only challenge is to receive enough pledges to pay the design fees and related cost for the other 3 new books, but as it will be based you your selections. I will start where I see there is more orders. Often in production there can be unforeseen delays so that might factor in.

Other Ways You Can Help

How can you help other then pledging funds? Spread the word on my work.

  • Make some noise share & forward the campaign.
  • Send us Sponsors that want to be Branded during the shows!
  • Get media to notice my work.
  • Volunteer to help out at one of my shows or installing homes
  • Become an Art Ambassador 
  • You can become an editor or a collaborating designer of one of the new books
  • Have connections with Museums? Always needed is the establishment to show the work.

Thank you for your time and energy! Hope to see you at my next show.

First Edition of the FASCINASIA Book vol 1 Edition 1

The format is 8.5" x 11" Horizontal Signed copie sells for $150 (Featured Perk)

 

Love is Eternal FASCINASIA Book new book

The format is 8.5" x 11" Horizontal Signed copie sells for $150

 

Brazil - Sea of Dunes Book

The format is 8.5" x 11" Horizontal Signed copie sells for $150

 

Brasilia - Geometric City

The format is 8.5" x 11" Horizontal Signed copie sells for $150

Art Collector (perk)

"Paradise Buddha" - 13" x 16.75" ($1500)
Mixed media with encaustic wax framed. 

This is for the Art Collector who want an original RARE small / medium studio practice piece from my personal collection. 

 

Liberté (Print Perk)
20" Tall by 45" Long 

 

Patron (m) Perk 12" x 18" Print

Double Buddha

 

24" x 24" Signed Print Perk

Laos Starmont

 

Starmont Singapore

24" x 36" Print Perk for $400

Emily R China

20" x 30" Print Perk for $400

 

Root of all E

32" x 48" Print Perk for $900

 

Celebrity Art Prints 24" x 36" Never before released Celebrity Prints Special edition signed & numbered

Snoop Dogg China or Rihanna Golden Girl

Art Patron Collector (perk)

Fashion Asia Hair Sparkles

48" x 36" Mixed media, archival paper with acrylic paint, gold leaf, raw pigments , resin on wood panel $5000

Active Collector (perk)

Khaliumaa Japan

En Français

Comme l'a dit l'un de mes amis, nous devons aider les gens en arrière. Donc, dans cet esprit, je m'efforce d'acheter une maison de style à conteneur préfabriqué compacte modulaire pour une jeune famille au Brésil. Projet 1 - Julya a 5 ans et a besoin d'une maison pour grandir!

Mes propres mots ici sont au cœur de la raison pour laquelle j'ai lancé un nouveau site Web, StanfordEmporium.com propose des solutions de logement durables.

Comme l'a dit l'un de mes amis, nous devons aider les gens en arrière. Donc, dans cet esprit, je m'efforce d'acheter une maison de style à conteneur préfabriqué compacte modulaire pour une jeune famille au Brésil.

Cette campagne a un potentiel illimité afin que nous puissions recueillir suffisamment de fonds pour acheter et installer une maison pour les nécessiteux.

Objectif de premier niveau d'atteindre 60,000

20,000 ira à l'achat d'une maison à conteneurs pour la jeune famille au Brésil

 

Deuxième niveau lorsque nous atteignons 80,0000

30,000 va construire 2 maisons à conteneurs durables

 

Troisième niveau à 100,000

40,000 va acquérir 2 à 3 maisons

 

Et nous avons donc l'intention de redonner jusqu'à 40% du bénéfice total des bénéfices, alors soyez généreux afin que nous puissions diffuser le message d'espoir et d'amour et que mon art transmet d’avantage ce message.

 

 Livres, imprimés et spectacles d'art. La première édition de FASCINASIA est terminée mais doit être mise à jour pour une deuxième édition.

 Le processus créatif ne finit jamais. Je présente un nouveau livre sur ce qui a été montré lors de la semaine d'Art Basel à Miami "Love is Eternal" ainsi que la série de photos unique sur le Brésil intitulée Sea of ​​Dunes. En plus, je mets The Geometric City Brasilia comme le dernier livre de photographies d'art.

story:
Hey, I'm Surgeryhead.
I'm always working tirelessly to bring you music, comics, books, and movies.
I've got gigs coming up now and I have to use my existing laptop to edit video at work or i'll go hungry.
Go figure. I really need to buy a new laptop so I can actually play proper gigs.

story:
Artists for Education is a project of Brave the Woods, a design and illustration studio run by Brad and Krystal Woodard. With 2 kids of our own, the oldest just about to enter kindergarten, we have vested interest in education. We want to ensure teachers have everything they need to help our child, and all children, succeed and learn. Education and children are a big part of the work we do at Brave the Woods. We have worked on many educational projects for kids such as: children's books, puzzles, stickers, journals, posters, apparel, children's magazines, etc. That carries over into our own home where we feel it is important to fill our space with artwork that can help educate as well as beautify.

To this day we both remember artwork that was up on our classroom walls in school and in our homes. Those visual representations of information help keep those posters cemented in our heads, and we carry that knowledge with us today. That is something we want our kids to experience, and how we want to help inspire them to learn. We hope to use Artists for Education as a vessel to accomplish that goal.

We all remember how uninspiring some of the stock art was in our classrooms growing up. Well it hasn’t become any prettier and is outdated as ever. Why? Because teachers don’t have access to new, well designed art, and it rarely exists in the first place. Not to mention if they do have access, they rarely can afford to get it for their classrooms. The average amount a teacher spends out of pocket for school supplies in their classroom alone is $500.

After that, spending money on quality, educational artwork for the classroom is almost out of the question.

We surveyed teachers, and found out that there is a huge demand for GOOD posters in classrooms. They need art to explain concepts, use as visual aids, and to inspire students. The posters they currently use are either not what they need, outdated, too “young”, not something the students want to look at, or they are stuck making it themselves. Sure, there are sites that allow teachers to download materials and get ideas, but what they need and deserve is well designed, beautiful posters for their classrooms to help educate and inspire their students.

Think of a teacher that has impacted your life. This could be a past teacher of yours, a family member, or a friend. Everyone has a teacher in their life that could use our help!

90% of the brain’s sensory input is from visual sources, and visual memory takes up two thirds of the brain. Researchers have even found that unconscious learning can take place through exposure to information on a poster. This means that students in the back of the room who don’t seem to be paying attention, can actually learn from the posters on the classroom wall.

Currently, art that is in schools is sometimes not as effective at catching the student’s attention as it could be. It may not seem that it matters how good the posters look, as long as the information on them is accurate, but that is not true. Since the 50’s many studies have been done on the effect of visually attractive classrooms on students. These studies have found a direct link in the aesthetics of a room and the feelings the student has towards education. Unattractive rooms led kids to unhappiness, fatigue, and a desire to escape, where beautiful classrooms led to feelings of confidence and happier kids. These emotions have an effect on student’s attendance, behavior, class participation, and relationship with their teachers.

Posters are also been proven to improve comprehension, increase retention, enhance retrieval and even decrease the amount of time it takes a student to learn a concept.

The bottom lIne: Posters are effective learning tools in a classroom!

We currently have a huge group of incredibly talented and generous artists on our team that are creating posters and submitting content. The work that these artists have done so far has blown us away, and we know it is going to be a wonderful asset in classrooms! Here is a sneak peak of just a few of the submissions so far: 

*Artists Top left to right: Josh Lewis, Andrew Kolb, Brave the Woods, Scott Fuller, Ben Stafford, Corey Carbo

By supporting us now in the early stages, you are helping us get Artists for Education off the ground floor. Your financial support will help us create and print posters, market the company so we can get it out to as many educators as possible, run events to raise more funds for education, and will help us fund classroom makeovers. We can revolutionize classroom art together!   

*Artists top left to right: Fred Rodriguez, Lydia Nichols, Shauna Panczyszyn, Brave the Woods, Mary Kate McDevitt

 

If you can’t contribute today, please spread the word to those who can and to the teacher’s in your life that need support!

 

Thank you, from our family and the Artists for Education team!

story:
Limbo's Project:

I started Limbo's Project originally for small business purpose, which I dreamed to be my extra support for school and living cost or either. But after I speak with a couple people about my idea, I thought I can bring more than just a deck of Tarot——delivering a style and a spirit, a brand.

 

As a digital artist and designer, I know how exciting those little "sparks" that come out accidentally from a totally different artwork is. To be honest, Limbo's Deck came from a happy accident which bonded me together with it for the next 10 months. 

Design Progress:

Always try something new:

Apart from working on designs, I started learning materials and modern techs that can help me spread my idea wider and further. I have to say that was a really long and slow progress. Reading references, purchasing materials and running tests...Here's the final test I did on different card boards:

300gm Silver Card Board, Laser Print, 100% Dot

300gm Copper Card board, Laser Print, 100% Dot:

300gm Copper Card board, Ink-Jet, 100% Dot:

300gm Copper Card board, Ink-Jet/Laser Print Compare, 100% Dot:

300gm Kraft Paper, Laser Print, 70% Dot (Final):

"Why not?"

My artworks were deeply inspired by one of the greatest surrealism artist Salvador Dali, spend a couple minutes google him and you will see why. Lobster shaped telephone, lip shaped sofa, heart( not ❤) shaped jewelries... There are surprises every where as long as you started walking into his world, and "why not?" is the best, simplest answer for all your questions.

There are three "why not" in Limbo's Deck.

  1. Art style: Surreal dark fantasy, creepy fairy tale, industrial-gothic character designs;
  2. Characterize each of the Majors: Instead of displaying a scene, I had each of the card possess into a careful designed ball jointed doll, and let them tell their own story;
  3. A Logo of a fly? Just like the lobster shaped telephone in Dali's room.

Full Display of Limbo's Deck:

Majors:

There will be 3 different sizes for the copies of this deck:

Compact: 9 x 5 cm

Regular: 15 x 8.5 cm

Jumbo: 22 x 12.5 cm

Other Materials/Media That Can Be Applied On:

One of the most interesting thing I did was testing my prints on different materials.

1.  Sketch Book:

The book will be in A4 size ( larger than US letter) with printed hard kraft cover, don't forget to let me know your choice. Time to make some crazy art!

 2. Water Tattoo:

Cut them down, put them anywhere on your skin or other waterproof surface, apply some water and wait for 30s, then peel down slowly. Notice that it will take 3-4 days for the tattoo to start fading away, if you really want them to stay, get a real one XD.

 3. PVC Card(Clear and non-clear version):

When I was learning on hard materials, the plastic came to me first. Plastic are flexiable, anti-corrosion, easy to work with, color friendly(displaying)...Perfect material for both collecting and playing. Unfortunately the clear version might be too transparent to print both side, but it makes pertty nice unique collection!

The card will be the same size like your bank card, and will be contained in a wood box with a wax seal on it.

 4. Can Shaped Mug:

I found this mug several months ago, the design is pretty cool, the 350ml is just the same size as the regular cans, and this one is refillable, and keep the temperature for several hours.

 5. T-shirt Printing:

The experience from my last project just inspired me a second time. Modal is a great fabric, when mixed with cotton, it makes way stretcher, higher absorbing, and better dyeing material. The print will be heat-transfered to the t-shirt in B&W.

 6. The Aluminum/Alloy Deck( still testing):

Aluminum alloy is one of the best amoung the matels. It has nice hardness, anti-impact, shining surface...Because of the funding problem, I can only test them by heat printing the image on the matel surface, which really cost me a lot of time and money, and the result was not very satisfying. The final pieces will be way better.

The card will be the same size as Compact version, and will be contained in a wood box with a wax seal on it.

What We Are Trying To Achieve In The Future:

1. Color( WIP):

It's very challengeing to make all 78 fully designed card into colored version, but we are making progress, and I'm very willing to share with you in the updates later. 

2. Liquid transfer( Concept, Testing):

Or low-temp transfering. Paint a special liquid on prints and stick it to wood( or other surfaces) to achieve full image transfering.

3. 3D product and app.( WIP):

Creating 3D model assets for each card, the finished pieces can be easily 3D printed in to sculptures, and farther be scripted into mobil apps.

Dream starts small, ends up great

"Intelligence without ambition is a bird without wings."——Dali

Here's a glance of a corner of my bedroom which had already pilled with empty materials and a transfering machine. I started the project for not only support myself for my collect life, but also as an artist, I dare to show my ambition to the world.

Thanks for your support!

Overview

FaceComm is a completely unique, non-verbal language that has the potential to revolutionize our approach to communication, in every aspect of our lives, all around the globe. An easy to learn method of communication that relies solely on the use of the facial expressions, FaceComm has an enormous range of applications, from Speech Therapy, Education, for use in the Military and Secret Services, and even as a form of entertainment. With your help, we will maximize the full potential of FaceComm, and develop course materials and videos so that this revolutionary language can be taught and learned all around the world.


FaceComm – What Is It?

FaceComm stands for ‘Facial Communication.’ It is a completely unique form of language, developed by Indian Innovator Dr. Sharad Gandhi, and performed by his brother Mr. Bharat Gandhi. Developed and researched intensely over a period of fifteen years, FaceComm is a silent language that is entirely visual in nature, requiring no verbal speech.

To achieve this, it makes use of a diverse range of facial expressions to convey all types of information with depth, meaning, and acuity. Approximately half of the communication is achieved by movement and expression of the eyes alone; the rest involves full usage of the cheeks, lips, ears, eyebrows, and tongue. Because it is a non-verbal language, it can be adapted to suit any native language.

There is nothing arbitrary about FaceComm – there is a very definite logic and algorithm governing its workings; meaning that precise and complex meaning can be conveyed with absolute accuracy. Possessing its own script, grammar, and lexicon, it is a truly universal language.


How Was it Developed?

Dr. Sharad Gandhi first hit upon the impulse for FaceComm at the precocious age of twelve. Gifted with a naturally curious mind, he asked himself the pressing question: “How did people communicate with one another before the origination of the spoken word?” Finding no satisfactory answers from his peers or in the annals of history, Dr. Gandhi began to invent an entirely facial language, free from the constraints of sound or audio transmission. Over time, FaceComm continued to be expanded, refined and improved. Like any other language, FaceComm is a living, dynamic medium, and is being enlarged and fine-tuned every day in its scope of application and practice. The suggestions we will list here regarding its potential use is just scratching the surface. Its full power is limitless.


A Universal Language

Because FaceComm requires no actual physical speech, it has the immense virtue of being one of the world’s few truly silent languages. Not only does this make it a wonderful alternative or adjunct to sign language, but it also makes it a lucrative investment for anyone working in an industry in which secrecy and silence are essential.  This would make FaceComm a potentially invaluable resource to anyone working in the military, police department, secret services, or any governmental agency in which coded information is necessary part of protocol.

Let’s take a look now at a few of the most promising applications of FaceComm:


Sign Language

For those incapable of speech or hearing, whether congenitally, or as a consequence to illness or trauma, sign language provides those without a voice a means by which they can express themselves. However, many sign languages are deficient. There is an element of guesswork to a lot of sign languages, and as a result, precision and clarity in understanding is often found wanting. It is also unavailable to people who may not have full control over their limbs.

Because FaceComm functions on its own logical algorithms, and possesses its own grammar, lexicon, and syntax, many of these deficits can be corrected and repaired. By using FaceComm alone or in conjunction with existing methods, we can dramatically increase the range and depth of communication available to the vocally and auditorily challenged.

It can also be a useful form of speech therapy for anyone suffering from paralysis or debilitation of the limbs, as is seen in various types of motor-neurone disease, paralysis, or as consequence of stroke or other traumas. FaceComm could be the only opportunity for communication available to vulnerable people who may have no other means of expressing themselves.


Education and Speech Therapy

FaceComm has a lot to offer the education establishment. Fun to learn and easy to use, children and adults will both delight in its ability to expand their range of self-expression. By adding motor function and visualization to their understanding of language, it will deepen their understanding of communication, and enrich their ability to relate to other people and make friends. By sharing FaceComm with another person as a secret language, it can deepen the connection and intimacy we feel with others, and refine our sensitivity to the human experience. The subject could be studied by those who wish to specialize in non-verbal communication, or make a career in the medical or care industries. It could also be offered as a form of speech therapy to people who struggle with dyslexia, or lack confidence in expressing themselves verbally.


Military

Warfare and other military operations are by nature extremely sensitive and dangerous procedures. Good communication within military units is essential for maintaining cohesion and order in chaotic scenarios, and for minimizing loss of life on both sides. FaceComm would be a useful means of silent communication between soldiers during situations in which making noise might alert them to nearby enemies and cost them their lives. It could also be used to transmit sensitive vital information over large stretches of land via telescope, binoculars, or smartphone, without any fear of it being intercepted or understood by enemy forces. Teaching soldiers a shared secret language would increase their sense of brotherhood, and hence maximize their togetherness and bravery in strategic operations and battles.

Similar applications could also be adapted to suit the police force and other defense industries.


Secret Services

In the Secret Service sector, the encryption of sensitive information and state secrets is critically important. What better way to keep classified information under wraps than the use of a silent language that no opposing secret agent or enemy of the state will readily be able to interpret or decode? FaceComm provides a means by which secret agents would be able to converse with one another in public without arousing suspicion, as well as in more delicate or dangerous scenarios. The same is true with regards to politicians, FBI agents, or bodyguards, who may need to communicate portentous messages in public or via Skype or other media without seeming unusual to outside parties. Because of FaceComm’s great precision, accuracy, and ever-expanding dictionary, complex and intricate messages can be transmitted without any fear of misinterpretation by the receiving party.  Through the miracle of FaceComm, a secret agent could use their lips to say one thing and their face another.


Space Exploration

Space communication among astronauts is still at the mercy of electronic equipments equipped in space-suits. So in case of any accident or a critical emergency, astronauts are reluctant to communicate through hand signals. Under such circumstances, FaceComm's visual communication could serve as a boon for them. Using just facial expressions, the whole crew would be able to brain-storm through critical situations quickly and act upon solutions rapidly without the need of a single instrument. This is the true potential of FaceComm which we are striving to unleash!


Conclusion

As stated above, we are just scratching the surface of the potential benefits that FaceComm has to offer to the world. But to summarize, here are some of the most salient benefits:

  • An improved means of communication for the deaf, dumb, or vocally-inhibited

  • The potential to save lives in crises, disasters, or war zones in which verbal communication is not always an option

  • Speech therapy for the dyslexic or unconfident

  • The safeguarding and transmission of classified information by those working in the defense or secret service industries

  • Improved communication and minimization of casualties in war zones

  • A conveniently shared secret language for members of the same organization; police, medical professionals, politicians, security guards, lawyers, members of secret organizations, musicians, and people working in noisy atmospheres unconducive to spoken conversations

  • As a beneficial course of study for those specializing in non-verbal languages, cross-cultural communication, and the care and medical and industries

  • And for the simple fun and delight of changing our way of thinking and experiencing the nature of language and the human experience


How You Can Contribute

Truly, FaceComm has the potential to offer a wealth of benefits to this beautiful yet troubled world of ours. But we need your help in order to maximize those benefits, and render them available to people of all societies, social standings, and cultures. The funds you contribute to this campaign will enable to us to deepen our research into FaceComm and its myriad applications, and develop course materials so that this unique language can be taught, learned and propagated all over the world, available in classrooms, universities, workshops, webinars, and the like. Your money will empower us to make 3D videos, lesson plans, online resources, books, materials, and interactive computer programs so that the transformative powers of FaceComm can be spread across the globe, and taught to people of all ages and abilities. With your help, anyone, anywhere, will be able to tap into the raw potency of FaceComm, and use it to bring benefit and delight to the rest of the human race.

Are you ready to be at the forefront of a pioneering revolution in the development of man? If so, contribute what you can, and help us change the world today without making a single sound!


About the Inventors

Dr. Sharad Gandhi is a true polymath and social innovator. Not only is he the ambitious inventor of the unique languages of FaceComm but he is also a renowned writer, performer and social visionary. His unique vision and charisma has touched the lives of many, and will continue to do so in the future.

Mr. Bharat Gandhi has accompanied his brother in every stage of FaceComm’s development. He is unequalled in his mastery of FaceComm’s silent lexicon, and has taken part in thousands of performances demonstrating FaceComm’s genius all across the globe.

story:
“Samira Elagoz weaves together performance and video, fiction and documentary, art and life, gravity and levity in an impressive and very surprising way.”
– Robert Kaltenhäuser, Blooom Award jury

Hi everyone, 

I’m Samira Elagoz, a Finnish/Egyptian artist, based in Amsterdam. I’m very happy to be one of the 66 (out of 1013!) applicants who have been awarded the danceWEB scholarship. Which consists of a 5 week residency in Vienna during Impulstanz. 

In order to attend, each participant is required to fund a third of the scholarship themselves (2150e). I have been lucky enough to find a small amount, but after exhausting my options I am still missing 1500e :(

I’m sure I don’t have to detail the meagre earning and lifestyle art students are well known for. However this does mean I am unable to pursue this amazing opportunity… That is, if I didn’t have you! 

Your help is important to me, I have no doubt participating in danceWEB can enhance my experience and artistic career in varied and immeasurable ways.

ABOUT DANCEWEB

The danceWEB Scholarship Programme takes place every year in July/August within the frame of ImPulsTanz - Vienna, which is the biggest contemporary dance festival in Europe. The residency offers 66 young professional dancers/artists the possibility to experience an intense multinational training program in the field of Contemporary Dance and Performance.

The scholarship includes the following:

• artistic accompaniment by the danceWEB mentor Tino Sehgal & his team

• participation in the Research Projects of ImPulsTanz 2016 

• participation in the technique workshops of ImPulsTanz 2016  

• admission to all productions of ImPulsTanz 2016

• exchange of ideas and contact with international teachers, choreographers and visual artists present at ImPulsTanz 2016

• special projects exclusively offered to the danceWEB scholarship holders 2016 

• lecture demonstrations & talks 

This year will be the first time emphasis has not been placed only on dance, as the focus has shifted to include visual arts. This is the reason I applied this year. I was selected for my abilities and accomplishments in visual art and documentary.

Attending means I will be able to share what I have experimented with and have the great opportunity to meet, interact and network with fellow artists from around the world, who are working with different cultural contexts.

I will have access to more than 50 performances, which are comprised of the best in the field and attend workshops given by some of the greatest teachers from around the world. In addition it will also offer me time and space to develop new work of my own, in close exchange with mentor and well known artist Tino Sehgal. Networking is important in this scene and will provide me with the opportunities I very much require. 

Taking part in this scholarship programme will not only expand my skill set, but allow me to apply what I know in different mediums. It’s an honour to be accepted into danceWEB.

ABOUT ME

I’d call myself obsessive, about my work and all it entails. The process of discovery and creation informs not only how I view the world, but how I know myself.

I started my artistic endeavours with contemporary dance, which I studied in SEAD, Salzburg Experimental Academy of Dance in 2011. I realised quite early on studying only dance was not enough for me, I needed to make my own work.

So I applied to the prestigious SNDO, School for New Dance Development in Amsterdam, and after four years of study I will be graduating this July. 

My first year there was focussed on performance art, initial expressions were dark, mysterious and cinematic performances. In year two I started to create work mainly on video, documentary done in a raw and exposed way. In addition I also create digital art featuring a variety of virtual selves.

My work in documentary has been received well. In October 2014 I won the Blooom Award in Cologne out of 1200 applicants, with my first short documentary film “Four Kings”. It was also selected as official selection of Doc outlook – international market, media library of Visions Du Réel. My subsequent work was featured in my first solo exhibition in Tokyo’s Mitsume gallery In 2015. 



$ BUDGET $

DanceWEB is funded mostly by a number of European cultural organizations. These various funders are able to cover 2/3 of the associated costs for each danceWEB participant. In order to realise my participation I need to secure the co-funding of my scholarship, EUR 2.150.- This amount equals 1/3 of the total scholarship costs (the total amount of one scholarship is approx. EUR 6.450.-). 

Here is where you guys can help! Any amount you are willing to spare would be greatly appreciated. I am so excited to be part of danceWEB, to further develop my work as a maker and visual artist, to get to connect with other talented young makers and professionals. It will truly be an amazing experience and I hope so deeply you can help me make it happen!! 

The selection of gifts has been put together with care and attention. Hope you find one you like :)

Thank you much for taking the time to read this and watch the video. If you are unable to support financially please help by spreading the word, share this link  <3

Sincerely and wholeheartedly, thank you!

Samira

Sincerely and wholeheartedly, thank you!
Samira

story:
Summary 

What is your favorite day of the week?

Where do our days of the week come from?

What do the days mean to you?

My forthcoming book, The Order of the Days, will explore the rich history of our days of the week, and will illustrate that history with the help of seven phenomenal artists.

The week we follow is more than 2,000 years old. It was born in the Hellenistic empire of Alexander the Great, and rooted in the ancient, mystical, and polytheistic cultures of Egypt, Babylon, and Greece. Eventually, the week fused with the Hebrew and Christian traditions, ensuring a cultural stronghold that stands to this day.

Long ago, the days were named after the planets, and in turn, the deities associated with those planets. Although slightly altered through time, those names remain. Why is Wednesday named after Woden, the Anglo-Saxon god of wisdom? How has Saturn maintained a presence in Saturday, despite centuries of assimilation? The Order of the Days will suggest that it could benefit us all, in very practical ways, to consider the source of that naming.

Beyond an interesting nomenclature, and litany of deities, this book will explore ancient memory systems, which developed contemporaneously with the week. Mnemonics (memory tricks) were employed by classical thinkers, such as Cicero, in order to retain vast amounts of knowledge for oration. These mnemonics were then inherited by medieval theologians, like Thomas Aquinas, who used them in order to indoctrinate the masses with complex Church teachings. Finally, the memory tradition was adopted by Renaissance astrologers, alchemists, magicians, and occultists, like Cornelius Agrippa. Agrippa, for example, used the systems in order to convey mystical knowledge about the planets, celestial powers, and intricate associations, which ranged from the stones to the stars.

The Order of the Days will explore the symbiotic relationship between the genesis of our week and these ancient mnemonics. Not only may it be terribly practical to utilize the week as a memory system, but it could also be extremely useful to consider which--if any--of the days' ancient associations still resonate in our own relationships with the week.

This campaign and this book are important to me because I believe that we can all learn something about ourselves, and how to make each day more meaningful, through the examination of a weekly system that most of us take for granted. In fact, each day is worth celebrating.

What We Need & What You Get

In the end, this project will yield an informative, modestly-sized, and functional art book. Descriptions of historical circumstances and mystical characters will fill its pages, but the focus will be on seven pieces of original art. The text will simply put the images into context, and suggest ways to make the striking images useful on a personal level.

In order to make this book a reality, I am collaborating with seven of my favorite artists. Each artist will create one image, inspired by the ancient characters and correspondences associated with each day.

Here is the team:
Saturday - www.SarahZar.com
Sunday - www.AnitaRundles.com
Monday - www.LizEmirzian.com
Tuesday - www.EliseMesnard.com
Wednesday - www.AyaRosen.com
Thursday - www.IgorGnedo.com
Friday - www.JustinNissley.com

Each one of these talented individuals is a professional working artist, and I want to be sure that they are compensated for their contribution to this project. To that end, I have set a campaign goal of $4,000 to be divided among the seven, with $500 left over for production costs (i.e. paying a graphic designer for book layout, promotional materials, and the printing of a small run of the book to be sold at a book release event).

If the entire goal is not met, funds will still be divided those eight ways. However, if you take a moment to investigate the above websites, I think you will agree that these artists are worth every penny of the desired goal.

At the very least, no matter what your level of support, a donation will guarantee you a personal thank you in the book. With a higher level of contribution, you can expect your own autographed copy of the book, signed prints from your days of choice, and other exciting rewards.

Your Impact

By contributing to this campaign, you are helping to excavate and artistically represent a more than 2,000 year old tradition. What does it really mean when you call each day by name? What has it meant to so many people though the centuries? The Order of the Days aims to foster an informed and aesthetically stimulating perspective on a week that is packed with ancient history and mystery.

My first book, Lycaon: The Story of the First Werewolf (a collaboration with artist, Liz Emirzian), has been on sale online via Amazon, Barnes & Noble, and at The Museum of Modern Art in NYC for the past three years. I hope for a similar--if not expanded--course for The Order of the Days.

Rise to the Challenge

In all of my creative endeavors, I take great pleasure in bringing people together. Every collaboration is special, and I am thrilled to join forces with seven exceptional artists. Capturing the essence of hundreds of years of history in one image is certainly a challenge, but I have complete faith that each of my collaborators will rise to the occasion. Their own unique aesthetics and methods will inform the unique character of each day. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I invite you to be a part of this campaign and this book. Whatever amount you can contribute will be greatly appreciated, and rewards will come your way. If you cannot afford to contribute, but still want to help bring this book to life, please make some noise. Share links on your favorite platform, and help spread the word about a project that can have a daily impact on each of us.

Have a wonderful day,

Brendan

Summary 

What is your favorite day of the week?
Where do our days of the week come from?
What do the days mean to you?
My forthcoming book, The Order of the Days, will explore the rich history of our days of the week, and will illustrate that history with the help of seven phenomenal artists.
The week we follow is more than 2,000 years old. It was born in the Hellenistic empire of Alexander the Great, and rooted in the ancient, mystical, and polytheistic cultures of Egypt, Babylon, and Greece. Eventually, the week fused with the Hebrew and Christian traditions, ensuring a cultural stronghold that stands to this day.
Long ago, the days were named after the planets, and in turn, the deities associated with those planets. Although slightly altered through time, those names remain. Why is Wednesday named after Woden, the Anglo-Saxon god of wisdom? How has Saturn maintained a presence in Saturday, despite centuries of assimilation? The Order of the Days will suggest that it could benefit us all, in very practical ways, to consider the source of that naming.


Beyond an interesting nomenclature, and litany of deities, this book will explore ancient memory systems, which developed contemporaneously with the week. Mnemonics (memory tricks) were employed by classical thinkers, such as Cicero, in order to retain vast amounts of knowledge for oration. These mnemonics were then inherited by medieval theologians, like Thomas Aquinas, who used them in order to indoctrinate the masses with complex Church teachings. Finally, the memory tradition was adopted by Renaissance astrologers, alchemists, magicians, and occultists, like Cornelius Agrippa. Agrippa, for example, used the systems in order to convey mystical knowledge about the planets, celestial powers, and intricate associations, which ranged from the stones to the stars.

story:
THIS IS A CROWD-SOURCE’D OPEN CONTRIBUTION PROJECT X PROJECT


Lineup(times subject to shuffling until May):

CLOSE TO CONSIDERATION

ENDLESS TAILE

EARTH//BOUND

THE OK OKs

HAD MATTER [Dropping their new EP]!

CHET DABROWSKI IV

WEATHERHEAD

THE LAST PARIAHS

FUNKBOT

301 HIPHOP COLLECTIVE

SON OF NUN

We're putting together a Bernie PARTY during the DNC Democratic National Convention! FDR Skatepark is booked and we're ready to kick it!

Shout out to Black Lives Matter and all the work they've done in the past few years!


We know this is the dividing day if Bernie or Hillary get the Democratic Party Nomination and my my my what a crazzzy race it has been so far! We wanna make sure we're as loud as we can be when Bernie wins! THIS IS THE BERN BASH!

Recruiting all hands and bands! Vendors! Promoters! Lemme know if you wanna get involved! We’re socialists and we wanna share this everywhere.

Price is FREE! We wanna make admission open access and free to the general public, but to do this we need to raise some serious fundage!!! Help the community out, help the world out--more concrete for the hardworking Do-It-Yourself crew that's been doing .~'amazing~. work throughout the years and tying into their wishlist of building a new concrete bowl in the marvelous skatetopia.


Do yourself a favor and take a few days off for the party. This is a historic moment and you don't wanna miss out! TELL ALL YOUR FRIENDS!


#TheBernBash#500000inphilly

What We Need & What You Get

  • The large majority of all funding will be going to the FDR crew to build a new concrete bowl. Super dope cause am I right? If you don't skate, FDR is the Do-It-Yourself DREAMWORLD of East Coast skateboarding and it's constantly expanding with little donations of concrete and talent, and we wanna make sure that The Bern B(A)SH leaves mad respect for the homies that do the good work and were so kind to let us use their hometurf.


  • We need to raise $4,000 in order to book an amazing Amatuer Pro-Wrestling show, ring and everything. $3,000 to make sure we have an amazing Sound Stage. This people’s party is going to be INSANE.

  • All funds that are remaining will be distributed among bands and performers for their time, travel, and talent and.. if -god forbid- anybody gets arrested at this thing.

╗The Impact

This campaign is about throwing the craziest, biggest party imaginable for Bernie taking the nomination of the Democratic National Convention. We want to be in Philadelphia when it happens, and to be able to link up and network with people from everywhere ushering in an entirely different kind of America. This is about linking struggles of so many different people together and a chance for us to build on what brings us together, and we’re going to have MADDDD fun doing it.

Frontline MCs are former Occupiers and continual activists Chris Siennick (Harrisburg PA represent!) and Max Neely (Unrelenting Frederick MD!)

Risks & Challenges


  • I feel like the obstacles that we’re going to face is that there are so many fans of Bernie that don’t know where to plug-in to campaigns that directly confront and act on issues that they are struggling with. We want to make sure that everybody has an opportunity to share and feel safe when they step up.

  • We want to start opening the playing field to more people, we want to tap into as many talents as possible, what we’re doing with this moment in time is creating the most entertaining mash-up as a carnival of amazing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Make sure to share this around to all your Bernie friends and anyone you know who says they’re a socialist, anarchist, or activist! We’re making this as inclusive as possible and we want to include YOU. Get out there in Philly and kick off the REVOLUTION with a bang!

story:
Short Summary

    My name is Alex Nolan, and I have been creating metal art in the Bay Area for over 16 years. I make large-scale kinetic (or moving) fine art sculptures, robots, and custom architectural designs. This year, my team, including Co - Creator Justin Grant and Jonathan Ferran, is very excited to bring our kinetic sound sculpture, SOL, to summer fine art and technology exhibits across the Bay Area and beyond, including the Maker Faire and The Filoli Gardens: Art in the Garden Exhibit. These fantastic events have limited funding for art exhibits. We want to share our amazing sculpture with you, but we need your help.

    Sol was originally built by Justin Grant and Alex Nolan for the Atlanta Botanical Garden "Sculpture In Motion Exhibit" in 2008. This 100% solar-powered sculpture has since been a feature of many diverse, well-known art events, including the Coachella Valley Music Festival, The Consumer Electronics Show, San Francisco's Decompression Festival, The West Beach Music Festival, Burning Man, and more. It is robotic, and tracks people using optical tracking software. SOL also produces high fidelity audio out of its 3 directional horn speakers. This sculpture stands 27 feet tall.

     After years of travel, SOL is in need of repair. The fixes demanding  immediate attention include: construction of a new base, several electrical and mechanical upgrades, and reconditioning of interior and exterior steel.  The transportation costs associated with moving an 8,000 lb piece of fine art are also considerable. 

     We created SOL from our passion to turn dreams into reality, and we are very excited to share it with everyone who loves unique and innovative expressions of art, music, and the imagination.  We gratefully appreciate your assistance in making exciting fine art available to everyone. 

What We Need & What You Get

     Our funding goal is $7,500. The breakdown below explains these costs in great detail:
  • Budget: 

    • *$3000 - Materials:

      $800- dbx DriveRack VENU360 Loudspeaker Management Processor

      $750- QSC RMX 2450a Power Amplifier (big horn power, 500 w/ch)

      $400- QSC RMX 850a Power Amplifier (little horn power, 200 w/ch)

      $250- rack mount case

      $100- empty rack mount enclosure for circuit breakers, rack mounted pc,    wiring stuff

      $200- good battery charger

      $300- good sealed batteries

      $200- miscellaneous equipment necessities (bolts, small tools, pens, paper,   etc.)

    *$2700 - Moving and Shipping Expenses:

          $1500 - rental fees and insurance for cranes, trucks, and heavy equipment

        $700- heavy equipment operator fees

        $500- fuel costs and travel expenses  

    *$1,800 - Crew Labor Costs

        This figure includes labor costs for a team of 5 to install SOL at 2 festivals.      ($380 per teammate, total.)  

    TOTAL: $7,500.00

    *Donor Perks: We have fun, exciting, and useful incentives for our donors! These include: 

  1. $10:  SOL Playa Sunset sticker.
  2.  $25: OhmDrone printed bandana. (Makes a great dust mask!) )'(
  3.  $50: SOL Playa Sunset t-shirt.
  4.  $100: All of the above, and in addition we will play a sound bite of your choice on SOL at upcoming events!  
  5.  $150: All of the above, plus custom, laser-cut OhmDrone necklace. (Metal, with steel, brass, or gold finish). 
  6. $200: All of the above, plus entry to our exclusive VIP party with major headlining musical artists, top shelf beverages, and catering! 
    The funds we raise will be used productively even if our goal is not met. We will make as many repairs as possible, and work toward making future events a reality. Every donation helps make it possible for SOL to be part of Bay Area art culture for many years to come!

The Impact

        Art is central to the cultural health and advancement of our community. Innovative projects like this are made possible through the generous support of art lovers like you. When art is created with the help of an entire community, it means so much more. We are grateful to be part of Bay Area art culture, and look forward to creating more projects like this to promote community enjoyment, curiosity, and imagination.
       Sol has travelled to many different events over the years, and we love witnessing the fascination it inspires. It is surreal seeing this massive, robotic speaker moving so rapidly, while playing gorgeous sounds high above the heads of the crowd. The mechanics are carefully hidden, and the overall effect is otherworldly, beautiful, and strange. The most remarkable feature of SOL is that it is completely solar-powered, requires no fuel, and produces no pollution. Looking like a technological relic from an ancient time, SOL is a monument to the unusual.   
Join us in bringing SOL to the world in 2016!

Risks & Challenges

    SOL has been successfully transported and displayed many times over the years. We have an impeccable safety record, and will work to keep it that way. We utilize professional engineers and computer modeling to ensure that all upgrades and repairs are thoroughly safe and effective. The challenges we face include: securing sufficient funding to rent heavy moving equipment, meeting time deadlines for that funding, and having financial means to purchase needed repair materials in time to attend these events. We have over 16 years of experience with large-scale sculpture tours, and are able to face any logistical hurdles from that aspect. We have a detailed plan for moving, on-site construction, safety, and exhibition features. The biggest hurdle we now face is funding. Through the help of the Bay Area arts community, crowd-sourcing, and individual donors, we feel we can meet this challenge. 

Other Ways You Can Help

   We appreciate that you invested time in reading about our project, and we thank you! Even if you can't donate right now, there is a way you can still help us: Share this project with your friends, and spread the word! Together we can make SOL  rise again! :)
