story:
Short Summary

My name is Donna Augustin. I am a British actress, writer, and producer who lives and works in Brooklyn, New York. I have successfully produced a critically acclaimed theater play, Shoot 2 Win, and two comedic web series: The Show for the BBC and Dirty Laundry.  My short film, Magpie Sings the Blues, starring Javone Prince and Noma Dumezweni, was selected for the 2014 Black Urban Film Festival in London.  In addition to Bodega! I'm currently workshopping a one-woman show entitled "Mother, New York & Men."

I believe all people want to feel validated regardless of one's income level, race, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, or religious belief. My interest in analyzing this belief via film is to bring about important, meaningful discussions for us to gain a deeper understanding of each other.  

You can be a part of this discussion! Your help, no matter how small, will help us make the best film we can! There’s no doubt that making a good film is costly. I feel it is worth every ounce of hard work because it will be riveting, and will join the ranks of other thought-provoking films within the corridors of film festivals.  My vision includes implementing the film into community organizations throughout the country, allowing the opportunity to underscore problems, enact conversations, and share feelings around the growing social impact of gentrification. The potential to impact people’s lives- to touch and allow them to speak about this issue from all perspectives -- is substantial. With your generous and thoughtful contributions, all of this will be made possible.

What We Need & What You Get

Join me by helping to fund this awesome project-100% of funds raised will go to making this film! Indeed, I have a great script and crew, and will cast talented actors, but I need your help getting this film made and placed in the hands of the right people. It will cost $15,000 to move the film into production. The funds will be allocated according to the following:

1. Cast and crew compensation

2. Rehearsal space for actors, location costs, and permits

3. Make-up, hair, and set design

4. Equipment rental -- Camera package, lighting, location, and sound recording equipment.

5. Post production -- editing, sound design, and grading.

Our creative team is passionate, diverse, connected, and experienced enough to get this project to the finish line: with a little help from you, of course!  However, if I do not reach my $15,000 fundraising goal, I will use whatever funds raised to shoot the film over two days instead of three, or I will find another way to pay for a portion of the production costs. 

As previously stated, Bodega! will be submitted to a number of reputable film festivals around the world and will also be used as a tool for community outreach to embolden discussions regarding gentrification. The costs of festival submissions fees, postal costs, and dvd re-productions of the film will also be covered within the fundraising goal.

In return, we are going to put some swag in your life!

What you get

We see you as a partner in the film and want to make you a part of this experience. In exchange for your help, we are dishing out (1) a walk on-role on the film, (2) a lifestyle photo shoot in your home, (3) and a work of art from contemporary artist Nathaniel Mary Quinn!  Check out all of the cool prizes to the right and join the Bodega! fam!

The Impact

It is somewhat difficult to express the full scope of this conversation. According to the 2015 State of New York City’s Housing and Neighborhoods, the city has seen alarming increases in rent, stagnating incomes, a rise in the number of people paying more for housing than they can afford and other significant demographic shifts in the 21st century. These changes are magnified in the city’s gentrifying neighborhoods.

My contention surrounds the discussion of whether we want New York City to be the home of only the upper middle class and the rich.  Bankers and wealth managers have the right to live in Bedford-Stuyvesant, for example, but their relocation to Brooklyn should not disarm the vitality of artists, singers, performers, educators, and single-parent households. The mix of diverse people living together in New York City and the surrounding boroughs makes the city great; in fact, this diversity actually attracts the bankers and wealth managers. Gentrification seems to impose a lack of respect for diversity. However, there may be opposing views to this position, which happens to be the beauty of Bodega!  Disagreements are welcomed and democracy is upheld.  

This is my second short film. It is the fifth project in which I’ve both produced and acted. Women and people of color have played the leading roles in most of my projects; Bodega! is no different. The theater play I produced, "Shoot 2 Win," garnered positive reviews.  "Magpie Sings the Blues," my last short film, was screened at several venues in England. This will be my directorial debut, and I am both excited and honored to be shooting such a powerful film. 

Risks & Challenges

Shooting films- and any production- can be challenging.  There can be technical problems or issues with post-production. My goal is to face these challenges directly, whatever they are, in a manner equivalent to that of my previous productions: with professionalism, great tact, and a sound plan. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Any donation, of any size, is appreciated. However, if you cannot donate, then I completely understand. I am equally grateful to anyone who can tweet my fundraising campaign, post my campaign on Facebook, Instagram, or Tumblr, or who can spread the word to friends and family members about the campaign.  Remember, using the "share tools" will be just as helpful for my project. In the words of Stevie Wonder, "Teamwork makes the dream work!"

And, of course, there is no greater way to show your support for my project than coming to see the film once it is completed. I hope to see you there!

https://www.facebook.com/Bodegafilm/

Instagram @donnamaugustin 

Twitter @ donnamaugustin
story_txt:
Short Summary
My name is Donna Augustin. I am a British actress, writer, and producer who lives and works in Brooklyn, New York. I have successfully produced a critically acclaimed theater play, Shoot 2 Win, and two comedic web series: The Show for the BBC and Dirty Laundry.  My short film, Magpie Sings the Blues, starring Javone Prince and Noma Dumezweni, was selected for the 2014 Black Urban Film Festival in London.  In addition to Bodega! I'm currently workshopping a one-woman show entitled "Mother, New York & Men."
I believe all people want to feel validated regardless of one's income level, race, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, or religious belief. My interest in analyzing this belief via film is to bring about important, meaningful discussions for us to gain a deeper understanding of each other.  
You can be a part of this discussion! Your help, no matter how small, will help us make the best film we can! There’s no doubt that making a good film is costly. I feel it is worth every ounce of hard work because it will be riveting, and will join the ranks of other thought-provoking films within the corridors of film festivals.  My vision includes implementing the film into community organizations throughout the country, allowing the opportunity to underscore problems, enact conversations, and share feelings around the growing social impact of gentrification. The potential to impact people’s lives- to touch and allow them to speak about this issue from all perspectives -- is substantial. With your generous and thoughtful contributions, all of this will be made possible.

What We Need & What You Get
Join me by helping to fund this awesome project-100% of funds raised will go to making this film! Indeed, I have a great script and crew, and will cast talented actors, but I need your help getting this film made and placed in the hands of the right people. It will cost $15,000 to move the film into production. The funds will be allocated according to the following:
1. Cast and crew compensation
2. Rehearsal space for actors, location costs, and permits
3. Make-up, hair, and set design
4. Equipment rental -- Camera package, lighting, location, and sound recording equipment.
5. Post production -- editing, sound design, and grading.
Our creative team is passionate, diverse, connected, and experienced enough to get this project to the finish line: with a little help from you, of course!  However, if I do not reach my $15,000 fundraising goal, I will use whatever funds raised to shoot the film over two days instead of three, or I will find another way to pay for a portion of the production costs. 
As previously stated, Bodega! will be submitted to a number of reputable film festivals around the world and will also be used as a tool for community outreach to embolden discussions regarding gentrification. The costs of festival submissions fees, postal costs, and dvd re-productions of the film will also be covered within the fundraising goal.
In return, we are going to put some swag in your life!
What you get
We see you as a partner in the film and want to make you a part of this experience. In exchange for your help, we are dishing out (1) a walk on-role on the film, (2) a lifestyle photo shoot in your home, (3) and a work of art from contemporary artist Nathaniel Mary Quinn!  Check out all of the cool prizes to the right and join the Bodega! fam!

story:
English version

Reactante is a catalyst and generator of alternative practices focused on experimentation, research, creation and visualization of processes that interrelate art, science and technology in Colombia. These alternative practices have their origin in an exercise of detection and analysis of national and international transdisciplinary trends, whose avant-garde vision is aimed at fostering collaborative and exchange relationships, based on ties of trust. reactante.blogspot.com.co

Reactante is aimed at a diverse and multigenerational group of artists, creators, projects promoters, institutions and private companies interested in art, science and technology. Team: Andrés Stepanichtchev (Journalist and cultural manager and empirical artist), Lina Pulido Barragán (Visual and experimental artist) and Laura Criollo Carrillo (Visual artist and art director).

Our principle of breaking down boundaries between art, science and technology, leads us to conducting artistic projects that link those three disciplines. Here is how Quanta arises, a curatorial project that explores different appropriations of quantum physics theory from personal experience and study field by each one of artists and scientists that make up four work pairs. The project splits into three phases: In the first one (February 1 to March 31, 2017), artists and scientists will share their knowledge to start a creation process; In the second one (April 1 to May 31, 2017), each collaborative pair will develop a research and creation work along four months based on the five properties of quantum physics: wave particle duality, quantum entanglement, superimposition of states, quantum tunneling and the uncertainty principle, to develop an artistic project. In the third phase (June 8 to July 7, 2017) will be a public exhibition of the processes generated during the second phase in the Colombian art space Estudio 74.

Different Colombian Artists and collectives participate in Quanta: Angélica Piedrahita (lapiedrahita.com), El Desguazadero Colectivo - María Fernanda Mora del Río and Juan José López (bit.ly/2k8SXrE) and Colectivo Reset - Nikolai Rubio and Ginna Velásquez. As an a special guest the project counts with the participation of the Mexican artist Arcángelo Constantini, pionner in the production of art with technology and Net.Art, whose research and development is integrally activated by the link between artistic and technological processes. www.arc-data.net.

Jose Jairo Giraldo, quantum physicist of the Universidad Nacional de Colombia (bit.ly/2k8QUnA), Santiago Vargas, astrophysicist of the National Astronomical Observatory (bit.ly/2k8Mi0I), and Verónica Arias, astrophysicist of the Universidad de Los Andes are part of the Colombian scientists work group. In the international context, the project will count with a scientific representative of the Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México.

With the support of different collaborators we will be able to carry out the creation processes of each work pairs, which will materialize in artistic pieces, installations and other art works of art for their exhibition. Support these creations leads to promote different perspectives and actions that detonate a possibility of innovation in different artistic - scientific processes and national collective thinking (Colombia) for its visibility in an international stage. With the impact generated, Quanta would fulfill its objective of integrating science with art for its application as a social fabric.

Funding

Physical resources (Art work production, museography, communications, assembly, dismantling): 17.334 USD

Human resources (Airplane tickets Mexico - Colombia - Mexico, travel expenses, fees): 2.176 USD

Contingencies: 1.904 USD

Total: 21.414 USD

The economic support we expect to raise through Indiegogo is 6290 USD. Although it is not the entire projected budget, it will be exclusively destinated for the art work production. We believe that without art work the project would not exist, so the artistic-scientific development will always be the economic priority.

Exclusive perks

As a gratefulness for the financial support, we will offer to our collaborators some exclusive perks:

Inmersive tour

We will keep the collaborators abreast of the development of the work pairs (artist - scientist) research and creation processes through videos that record the generated experiences. We will send the videos to the collaborators, also, they will have access to them through our YouTube channel.

Digital project catalogue

We will design a digital catalogue with the photographic records of the work pairs creation processes and artistic pieces, descriptive texts and the Quanta’s curatorial text, including special thanks to the collaborators. The catalogue will be sent to each collaborator in a time no longer than one month, after the conclusion of the exhibition.

Quantum video

We will make a video compilation of the three phases of the project, in which we will present unpublished contents, unique details of the evolution of work pairs research and creation processes, testimonies by artists, scientists and Reactante’s members and exclusive scenes from the exhibition and guided tours. The video will be sent to each collaborator in a time no longer than one month, after the conclusion of the exhibition.

Customized postcards

We will design personalized digital postcards for collaborators (including their name) with unique photographs of the project or the created art works or their process, accompanied by a representative phrase of a work pair or the quantum physics theory. The postcards will be sent to each collaborator in a time no longer than one month, after the conclusion of the exhibition.

In addition to receiving these exclusive perks, the collaborators will be mentioned in all graphic pieces of the project, museographic texts, press releases and Reactante’s digital media (web page and social media).

¡We invite you to promote Colombia’s ART and SCIENCE supporting Quanta!

--------------------------------------------

Versión en español

Reactante es un agente catalizador y generador de prácticas alternativas enfocadas a la experimentación, investigación, creación y visibilización de procesos que interrelacionan el arte, la ciencia y la tecnología en Colombia. Estas prácticas alternativas tienen su origen en un ejercicio de detección y análisis de tendencias transdisciplinares, nacionales e internacionales, cuya visión vanguardista se orienta a impulsar relaciones colaborativas y de intercambio, basadas en lazos de confianza. reactante.blogspot.com.co

Reactante está dirigido a un grupo diverso y multigeneracional de artistas, creadores e impulsores de proyectos, instituciones y empresa privada, interesados en el arte, la ciencia y la tecnología. Sus integrantes son: Andrés Stepanichtchev (Periodista cultural / Gestor cultural/ Artista empírico) y Lina Pulido Barragán (Artista visual y experimental) y Laura Criollo Carrillo (Artista visual / Directora de arte).

Debido a nuestro principio de romper barreras entre el arte, la ciencia y la tecnología, llevamos a cabo proyectos artísticos que enlazan estas tres disciplinas. Es así como surge Quanta, un proyecto curatorial que explora diferentes apropiaciones de la teoría de la física cuántica, desde la experiencia personal y campo de estudio de cada uno de los artistas y científicos que conforman cuatro duplas de trabajo. El proyecto se divide en tres fases: en la primera (1 de febrero al 31 de marzo de 2017), los artistas y científicos compartirán sus conocimientos para iniciar un proceso de creación; en la segunda (1 de abril al 31 de mayo de 2017), cada par colaborativo desarrollará un trabajo de investigación y creación de cuatro meses partiendo de las cinco propiedades de la física cuántica: La dualidad onda - partícula, el entrelazamiento cuántico, la superposición de estados, el tunelamiento cuántico y el principio de incertidumbre, para la realización de un proyecto artístico. En la tercera (8 de junio al 7 de julio de 2017) se presentará una muestra pública - exposición de los procesos generados durante la segunda fase de trabajo en el espacio de arte colombiano Estudio 74.

Quanta cuenta con la participación de los artistas y colectivos colombianos: Angélica Piedrahita (lapiedrahita.com), El Desguazadero Colectivo - María Fernanda Mora del Río y Juan José López (bit.ly/2k8SXrE) y el Colectivo Reset - Nikolai Rubio y Ginna Velásquez, y como invitado especial el artista mexicano Arcángelo Constantini, pionero en la producción de arte con tecnología y Net.Art, cuya investigación y desarrollo está integralmente activada por la vinculación entre los procesos artísticos y tecnológicos. www.arc-data.net

El grupo de científicos colombianos está integrando por el físico cuántico de la Universidad Nacional Jose Jairo Girado (bit.ly/2k8QUnA), el astrofísico del Observatorio Astronómico Nacional Santiago Vargas (bit.ly/2k8Mi0I) y la astrofísica de la Universidad de los Andes Verónica Arias. En el marco internacional, se contará con un representante científico de la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México.

Con el apoyo de distintos colaboradores lograremos llevar a cabo los procesos de creación de cada una de las duplas de trabajo, los cuales se materializarán en piezas artísticas, instalaciones y demás obras de arte para su exposición. Apoyar dichas creaciones conlleva a su vez, a la promoción de distintas miradas y acciones que detonan una posibilidad de innovación en distintos procesos de ejecución artística - científica y pensamiento colectivo a nivel nacional (Colombia) para su visibilización en un ámbito internacional. Con el impacto generado, Quanta cumpliría su objetivo de integrar la ciencia con el arte para su aplicación como tejido social.

Financiamiento

Contemplamos el siguiente presupuesto, en pesos colombianos, para el desarrollo del proyecto:

Recursos físicos (Producción de obra, museografía, comunicaciones, montaje, desmontaje): $49.477.500

Recursos humanos (Tiquetes de avión México - Colombia - México, viáticos, honorarios): $6.210.000

Imprevistos: $5.433.750

Total: $61.121.250

El apoyo económico que esperamos recaudar a través de Indiegogo es de $18.000.000 (6290 USD), y aunque no es la totalidad del presupuesto proyectado, estará destinado exclusivamente a la producción de obra. Consideramos que sin obra realizada el proyecto no existiría, por lo que la prioridad económica siempre será para el desarrollo artístico-científico.

Recompensas exclusivas

A modo de agradecimiento por el apoyo económico obtenido ofreceremos a los colaboradores una serie de recompensas exclusivas:

Recorrido inmersivo

Mantendremos a los colaboradores al tanto del desarrollo de los procesos de investigación y creación de las duplas de trabajo (artista - científico) a través de videos que registren las experiencias generadas. Enviaremos los videos a los colaboradores o éstos tendrán acceso a los mismos mediante nuestro canal de YouTube.

Catálogo digital del proyecto   

Se diseñará un catálogo digital con los registros fotográficos de los procesos de creación y las piezas artísticas de las duplas de trabajo, textos descriptivos y el texto curatorial de Quanta, incluyendo agradecimientos especiales a los colaboradores. El catálogo será enviado a cada colaborador en un tiempo no mayor a un mes, luego de finalizada la muestra de resultados-exposición.

Video cuántico

Realizaremos un video recopilatorio de las tres fases del proyecto, en el cual presentaremos contenidos inéditos como detalles únicos de la evolución en los procesos de investigación y creación de las duplas de trabajo, testimonios de los artistas y científicos, testimonios de los integrantes de Reactante  y escenas exclusivas de la muestra de resultados – exposición y visitas guiadas. El video será enviado a cada colaborador en un tiempo no mayor a un mes, luego de finalizada la muestra de resultados-exposición.

Postales personalizadas

Diseñaremos postales digitales personalizadas para los colaboradores (incluye su nombre) con fotografías únicas del proyecto y/o las obras creadas o en proceso, acompañadas de una frase representativa de alguna dupla de trabajo o de la teoría de la física cuántica. Las postales las enviaremos a cada colaborador en un tiempo no mayor a un mes, luego de finalizada la muestra de resultados-exposición.

Además de recibir estas recompensas exclusivas, los colaboradores serán mencionados en todas las piezas gráficas del proyecto, textos museográficos, comunicados de prensa y medios digitales (página web y redes sociales) de Reactante.

¡Promueve el ARTE y la CIENCIA de Colombia apoyando a Quanta!

Consideramos que sin obra realizada el proyecto no existiría, por lo que la prioridad económica siempre será para el desarrollo artístico-científico.Recompensas exclusivasA modo de agradecimiento por el apoyo económico obtenido ofreceremos a los colaboradores una serie de recompensas exclusivas:Recorrido inmersivoMantendremos a los colaboradores al tanto del desarrollo de los procesos de investigación y creación de las duplas de trabajo (artista - científico) a través de videos que registren las experiencias generadas. Enviaremos los videos a los colaboradores o éstos tendrán acceso a los mismos mediante nuestro canal de YouTube.Catálogo digital del proyecto   Se diseñará un catálogo digital con los registros fotográficos de los procesos de creación y las piezas artísticas de las duplas de trabajo, textos descriptivos y el texto curatorial de Quanta, incluyendo agradecimientos especiales a los colaboradores. El catálogo será enviado a cada colaborador en un tiempo no mayor a un mes, luego de finalizada la muestra de resultados-exposición.Video cuánticoRealizaremos un video recopilatorio de las tres fases del proyecto, en el cual presentaremos contenidos inéditos como detalles únicos de la evolución en los procesos de investigación y creación de las duplas de trabajo, testimonios de los artistas y científicos, testimonios de los integrantes de Reactante  y escenas exclusivas de la muestra de resultados – exposición y visitas guiadas. El video será enviado a cada colaborador en un tiempo no mayor a un mes, luego de finalizada la muestra de resultados-exposición.Postales personalizadasDiseñaremos postales digitales personalizadas para los colaboradores (incluye su nombre) con fotografías únicas del proyecto y/o las obras creadas o en proceso, acompañadas de una frase representativa de alguna dupla de trabajo o de la teoría de la física cuántica. Las postales las enviaremos a cada colaborador en un tiempo no mayor a un mes, luego de finalizada la muestra de resultados-exposición.Además de recibir estas recompensas exclusivas, los colaboradores serán mencionados en todas las piezas gráficas del proyecto, textos museográficos, comunicados de prensa y medios digitales (página web y redes sociales) de Reactante.¡Promueve el ARTE y la CIENCIA de Colombia apoyando a Quanta!

story:
Our Story

 

  My love for glass began as a child watching a glassblower create works of art at a community folk festival. I was intrigued by how a blob of molten glass could be crafted into anything the artist could dream of. As an adult my love for glass magnified. I did hours of extensive research about working with glass and how to build my own work space. One day, by chance, I came across someone selling their entire glass studio and I jumped at the chance to start my flameworking adventures and make my dreams become a reality. With the help of my wife, we turned a small corner of our garage into a place where creative ideas came to life. We spent hundreds of hours creating beautiful pendants, ornaments, and unique pieces of glass art. Almost three years after our adventure began our lives were negatively impacted by some major hardships. We had to make the tough decision to part ways with our studio. After the studio was gone we felt its loss keenly. We realized how vitally important glass working was to us and we made the decision to pursue it again as soon as we were able.  Being without a glass studio I had no creative outlet anymore. It really is true what they say, "You don't know what you have until it's gone."

  With a little under three years of hands-on experience I know exactly what is needed to build and safely outfit a studio for creating unique handcrafted pieces of glass art. Weeks of work went into just the design of our new studio. With my better half, Kristen, we have created a space where Flamekeeper Studios can help us not just to grow as artists but to thrive. Together we have done the hard part of building an entire studio space from the ground up for the last three months. We have the barest of necessities to begin our studio work, such as a torch and kiln. We need your help to finish outfitting our studio with several other important components such as ventilation, fuel tanks, glass, and tools. 

  We are highly motivated to bring Flamekeeper Studios to life. Even if our goal of $6000 is not met, Flamekeeper Studios will still eventually open but it will take at least another long year before it is finally completed. Your support will help turn the dream of opening Flamkeeper Studios into an accelerated reality.

What We Need & What You Get

Fortunately, we own our studio space and some of the major equipment needed to start creating, including a kiln and a torch. Below is a list of what we still need to set up a successful, safe, and productive studio:

  • Professionally installed Ventilation system (draws out the toxic fumes when melting glass)
  • A door and a new window for the studio
  • Fuel/Oxygen tanks, Regulators and Fuel lines (without these we have no flame)
  • Clear/Colored glass (rods, frit, and tubes)
  • Various hand tools for working hot glass
  • Packaging/Shipping Materials

If we are able to meet our goal of $6000, we are more than happy to give back a little something to those who donated to our campaign. Think of it as pre-ordering our art! Check out the incentives on the right-hand margin.

If we are able to surpass our goal, we will be able to purchase extra equipment, such as extra storage cabinets for glass, photo/lighting equipment, and cold-working equipment, among various other things.

(This is what our studio currently looks like. We wanted a creative space to work in so we went with a beehive theme to break up the plain walls.)

The Impact

As up and coming artists, it is crucial to have a space to make our work. Without the essential items above, we would have no way of working safely, let alone a way to produce our glass art. Renting a studio can cost anywhere from $250 (a low estimate) to $600 per month for glass artists in the Lehigh Valley. We would rather save our money and pour it into creating a space to grow on our own terms. A glassblowing studio is a place for us to make our work, and bring our ideas to life. We plan to do live glassblowing demos, and build with our local community of Whitehall PA.

Risks & Challenges

Since we own and are not renting the space, the risks associated with funding our campaign are pretty minimal. One of the biggest risks we face is not gathering enough funding. If the campaign does not raise $6000, then it will take us a lot longer to build our studio. Our goal, with your help, is to have it up and running by the end of this year. However, minus adequate funding, that goal will probably take until the summer of 2018--at minimum.

Once the ventilation is installed, and the fuel lines are in place, the only things left to do are buy the rest of the necessary equipment and get the space "studio ready," which will include organizing glass, installing the new window and door, and performing the necessary safety checks. Other than that, we're good to go!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to our campaign monetarily, please help us spread the word any way you can! Share our story on social media and ask your friends and family to do the same!  If you are interested in purchasing art, keep an eye on our ever evolving stories. You can always see what we are up to and get in touch with us by following us on social media.

                        
Instagram:  flamekeeper_studios
Facebook:  facebook.com/FlamekeeperStudios

 

FAQ

Q. When will I receive my perks?

A. You will receive your gift in March of 2018. We need enough time to set up the studio and settle in before we start making your pieces! Please note that the colors and style of the pieces will vary. Each piece is handmade making them one of a kind!

Q.Why do you need ventilation?

A. Ventilation is one of the most important pieces of equipment in a glass studio. Melting glass creates toxic fumes. There are many metallic elements in colored and clear glass. Running a propane/oxygen torch in a room by itself can create various gaseous forms of nitrogen/oxygen compounds, one of which turns into nitric-acid when in the presence of water (say in your lungs). Prolonged exposure to any of these elements is very bad news (anywhere from heavy metal poisoning to risk of inhaling glass dust, even cancer)

Q. What other things do you make?

A. We make a variety of items including pendants, marbles, magnets, figurines, shot glasses, and so much more. The fact is there are endless options when it comes to what you can create with glass. If you are interested in seeing more of our glass art you can follow us on either Instagram or Facebook. 

www.Instagram.com/flamekeeper_studios

www.Facebook.com/FlamekeeperStudios

Q. How durable are your pendants and icicles?

A. We use borosilicate glass (better known as Pyrex glass)  for everything we make. Borosilicate glass is known for being pretty strong. When it is annealed correctly it is even stronger. We use our kiln to properly anneal each piece we make taking the stress out of the glass and essentially making it stronger but keep in mind it is still glass, and it is not indestructible.

story:
Clare Ferguson-Walker is an international renowned sculptor who has gained a reputation for excellence through a career that has spanned nearly two decades. As well as being a sculptor, Clare is also a performance poet who regularly supports Dr Clarke. They have become firm friends and the idea of a collaboration started gathering momentum last year. Dr John Cooper Clarke needs little introduction, to his fans he is an icon, a poetic tour de force who's unique punk voice spoke to and for a whole generation of disenfranchised youth, a fearless advocate of free speech and a comedic genius, Dr Clarke is as relevant today as he ever was. A regular voice on Radio 6 music, and an ongoing national tour sees his words and vision reach new audiences all the time. 

This is a one off chance to own a truly unique collaboration that not only celebrates Dr Clarke in all his poetic glory but encapsulates a relationship between two extraordinary artists.

story:
What is this campaign about?

This Indiegogo campaign is going to make it possible for me to publish The Akashic Oracle deck. In order to successfully self-publish I need to order in large quantities and this campaign will raise the funds needed for me to pay for the first order! I have selected two vendors to manufacture the product, they are both located in the United States, and I feel good about working with them.

My friends, family and followers have been waiting and waiting to see the finished product, and have been my biggest cheerleaders along the way. It has been years of work already to get to this point. The original watercolor paintings were created between 2011 and 2013. Then the idea for a deck began to percolate, and in April of 2014 I put my first ideas on paper. Since then I have written the oracle text for each card, designed the product packaging and guidebook, created the Photoshop print files, worked with my vendors to produce samples. The process has been monumental...and it is finally TIME! Let’s get this baby printed!

The Impact

The vibrant, visionary images of The Akashic Oracle are paired with affirmations to create a tool that anyone can use to seek inner guidance and get in touch with their own internal knowing. The cards are designed to help you reflect on situations and take appropriate action to move forward in a positive way.

Contributors not only get an amazing tool for themselves, but their generosity will enable me to continue sharing The Akashic Oracle with more people. I have more artwork and additional tools to share, and a successful launch of The Akashic Oracle will make it possible for me to begin the process of bringing these to life too.

I have spoken with a lot of people who are suffering inside and don’t feel like they can afford to work with a one-on-one practitioner. The Akashic Oracle is an inexpensive tool that people can use everyday to promote their own well-being. Having a dialogue with my internal self has been essential to my experience of living and surviving with depression. This deck can help you to get the dialogue started!

Manifesting a Vision

In my day to day, I help my clients bring their visions into reality. A client will have an idea and they’ll need to take registrations, or send out an automated marketing campaign. Or they will need a website to promote their services or new product, and sometimes they need all of it. I take all the parts and pieces, the needs and desires, the budget, timeline, unknown elements, all of it, and develop and execute a strategy to meet the goals. As I begin this new venture of creating The Akashic Oracle deck, I’m really bringing MY OWN vision to reality...and that feels really awesome.

About the Perks!

The Akashic Oracle Deck — Use this deck of 48 cards to gain insights and overcome obstacles. Each card offers guidance for accessing the wisdom of the soul and calls on universal elements to support our personal and collective journeys. I am offering the first 300 decks for only $30. This is a special launch price only for the first 300 decks! Let your friends know!

Akashic Oracle Shining Light — With this perk you get 2 decks at the special launch price, plus FREE shipping to one address in the US! The Shining Light perk is about sharing this healing tool with a friend that needs it. One for you... one for your friend <3

Akashic Oracle Artist Print — The visionary art of the Akashic Oracle deck is available in print format. Prints arrive framed and ready to hang. Metal frame measures just over 11 inches. Once we have shipped your oracle deck, we will contact you by email and you will be able to choose the print that you will receive with this perk.

Akashic Record Reading — You will receive a forty minute Akashic record reading with Mel. During your session Mel will access the Akashic records to obtain the guidance that will most benefit you at this time. You will be able ask questions and seek counsel. Once you select this perk you will be emailed a link where you can book a session. Readings are conducted by phone.

Original Artwork — Receive one of Mel's original mixed media paintings. This is her newest work and it won't be available for long. These pieces are being offered as campaign perks and are a special treat for her friends, family and supporters. Look for new postings throughout the campaign.

The Challenge and the Upside

The most challenging part of this experience has been to step out of the shadows where I have purposely been hiding and present myself as the natural artist and intuitive that I have always been. I’ve been very proud of my identity as a web developer. It’s not something that came easy to me. Creating art comes with ease, but doing the technical side of building a website is something that I had to work for. The upside: I have come to realize, all of the online tools that I have become skilled with, are a huge asset as I launch The Akashic Oracle.

In fifteen years, I see myself in balance and at ease. Right now, things are a little hectic. There’s a lot of work and time behind the computer. As I start out with The Akashic Oracle my desire is to transition into a more healthful flow with my livelihood.

My Story

I can see that what I have to offer through my artistic and intuitive channels can be of great benefit to many people. Recently I have met quite a few people who have had similar struggles to my own. On a call the other day I spoke with someone who is struggling like I was 6 years ago, having reached the bottom and trying to get out from under the grasp of depression. It made me realize how far I have come already, and that I do have quite a few tools for surviving and thriving, and moving through the depression and anxiety. Depression can be so dark and so incredibly lonely. I shine a light for someone and let them know that they are not alone, that I’ve been through this and still go through it. There are bright spots, and there are ways to move towards those bright spots. If I can help others discover how to do that in their own lives, so that they can be more healthful and easeful and at peace, I feel like the circle is complete.

"When I was ten I became depressed. As awful as that is, it started me on a path of self-awareness, personal development, spiritual exploration and healing. Over time I began using affirmations to support my healing. The affirmations turned into artwork as I repeated the words over and over to myself while painting."

In my early twenties I began participating in all night fire ceremonies. It was during these fire events that I learned that healing and transformation could happen rapidly, much more rapidly than through the mainstream channels I had been used to. I saw that working with unseen elemental energies and guides or spirits from the invisible realms could produce profound healing and shift in the physical world. As part of my personal quest for healing I began to explore this phenomenon. It led me to work with a number of different teachers and study a number of different healing modalities. I have incorporated these experiences into my own healing practices and they have certainly influenced my oracle deck.

About the Artist

Mel Shapcott, creator of The Akashic Oracle, draws on ancient wisdom sourced from deep within. At an early age she began using her sixth sense to comprehend and navigate the world around her, and over time has cultivated this gift as a tool for healing. Through her lifelong battle with depression she gained a first-hand understanding of how to thrive despite the most difficult circumstances. As an artist, her visionary work provides an outlet for powerful knowledge embedded in genetic and cellular memory. Each image is captured without thought or analysis in a pure stream from the invisible realm.

Her journey towards well-being has compelled her to explore the world around her, as well as the world within. In 2004 she received a Bachelor’s of Fine Art from Temple University in Philadelphia, and since then has received training in many different areas. She recently achieved the honor of being a Priestess Path graduate, having completed ALisa Starkweather’s intensive apprenticeship in women’s leadership, empowerment and spirituality. Her formal Akashic Records training with urban priestess Vanessa Codorniu honed her skills as an intuitive, allowing her to easily access the invisible in order to facilitate healing and promote wellness in herself and her clients. Mel is a long-time student of ceremonial artist Mz. imani, who initiated her into the lineage of Alchemical Healers.

Photo-credit: © Marsia Shuron Harris

Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't fund the campaign, please help get the word out! I will be promoting in various ways, and it would mean a lot if you shared my promotional posts on Facebook or any other platform you use. Equally as important is to tell those who you think would benefit from this to visit my website: http://akashicoracle.com

"The Akashic Oracle Deck is a wonderfully illustrated wealth of knowledge that will inspire you to live life as rich as the kaleidoscope of color found in each painting. It feels like you could be looking under the microscope or into the galaxies beyond when exploring this deck. So if you are ready for the journey of self-exploration this deck will be both a guide and treasure map...explore more — dive in."
Layla Love

"Each and every card is as stunningly beautiful as it is inspirational. To hold them in your hands is truly a gift. I can read them over and over, finding a new gem each and every time. Thank you for sharing your heart wisdom!"
Elizabeth Heck

Beautiful, joyful imagery! You can get a boost of positive energy gust by shuffling this deck of cards in your hands.
Irina Thomas

"What a gorgeous way to start your morning, take pause in the afternoon or reflect in the evening and whether it be with your eyes, your mind or your entire self. Thank you Mel."
Rachael B.

"Stunning artwork. Inspiring messages. This collection is a much needed contribution to the world!"
Dr. Tom

"Absolutely breathtaking artwork and thought provoking prose put this deck at the top of my desired decks list! Beautiful creator, inspiring story, magick ready to be made!"
River Moonglow

 

Interview with Vanessa Codorniu

How does this deck relate to the Akashic field?

During your session Mel will access the Akashic records to obtain the guidance that will most benefit you at this time. You will be able ask questions and seek counsel. Once you select this perk you will be emailed a link where you can book a session. Readings are conducted by phone.Original Artwork — Receive one of Mel's original mixed media paintings. This is her newest work and it won't be available for long. These pieces are being offered as campaign perks and are a special treat for her friends, family and supporters. Look for new postings throughout the campaign.The Challenge and the UpsideThe most challenging part of this experience has been to step out of the shadows where I have purposely been hiding and present myself as the natural artist and intuitive that I have always been. I’ve been very proud of my identity as a web developer. It’s not something that came easy to me. Creating art comes with ease, but doing the technical side of building a website is something that I had to work for. The upside: I have come to realize, all of the online tools that I have become skilled with, are a huge asset as I launch The Akashic Oracle.In fifteen years, I see myself in balance and at ease. Right now, things are a little hectic. There’s a lot of work and time behind the computer. As I start out with The Akashic Oracle my desire is to transition into a more healthful flow with my livelihood.My StoryI can see that what I have to offer through my artistic and intuitive channels can be of great benefit to many people. Recently I have met quite a few people who have had similar struggles to my own. On a call the other day I spoke with someone who is struggling like I was 6 years ago, having reached the bottom and trying to get out from under the grasp of depression. It made me realize how far I have come already, and that I do have quite a few tools for surviving and thriving, and moving through the depression and anxiety. Depression can be so dark and so incredibly lonely. I shine a light for someone and let them know that they are not alone, that I’ve been through this and still go through it. There are bright spots, and there are ways to move towards those bright spots. If I can help others discover how to do that in their own lives, so that they can be more healthful and easeful and at peace, I feel like the circle is complete."When I was ten I became depressed. As awful as that is, it started me on a path of self-awareness, personal development, spiritual exploration and healing. Over time I began using affirmations to support my healing. The affirmations turned into artwork as I repeated the words over and over to myself while painting."In my early twenties I began participating in all night fire ceremonies. It was during these fire events that I learned that healing and transformation could happen rapidly, much more rapidly than through the mainstream channels I had been used to. I saw that working with unseen elemental energies and guides or spirits from the invisible realms could produce profound healing and shift in the physical world. As part of my personal quest for healing I began to explore this phenomenon. It led me to work with a number of different teachers and study a number of different healing modalities. I have incorporated these experiences into my own healing practices and they have certainly influenced my oracle deck.About the ArtistMel Shapcott, creator of The Akashic Oracle, draws on ancient wisdom sourced from deep within. At an early age she began using her sixth sense to comprehend and navigate the world around her, and over time has cultivated this gift as a tool for healing. Through her lifelong battle with depression she gained a first-hand understanding of how to thrive despite the most difficult circumstances. As an artist, her visionary work provides an outlet for powerful knowledge embedded in genetic and cellular memory. Each image is captured without thought or analysis in a pure stream from the invisible realm.Her journey towards well-being has compelled her to explore the world around her, as well as the world within. In 2004 she received a Bachelor’s of Fine Art from Temple University in Philadelphia, and since then has received training in many different areas. She recently achieved the honor of being a Priestess Path graduate, having completed ALisa Starkweather’s intensive apprenticeship in women’s leadership, empowerment and spirituality. Her formal Akashic Records training with urban priestess Vanessa Codorniu honed her skills as an intuitive, allowing her to easily access the invisible in order to facilitate healing and promote wellness in herself and her clients. Mel is a long-time student of ceremonial artist Mz. imani, who initiated her into the lineage of Alchemical Healers.Photo-credit: © Marsia Shuron HarrisWays You Can HelpEven if you can't fund the campaign, please help get the word out! I will be promoting in various ways, and it would mean a lot if you shared my promotional posts on Facebook or any other platform you use. Equally as important is to tell those who you think would benefit from this to visit my website: http://akashicoracle.com "The Akashic Oracle Deck is a wonderfully illustrated wealth of knowledge that will inspire you to live life as rich as the kaleidoscope of color found in each painting. It feels like you could be looking under the microscope or into the galaxies beyond when exploring this deck. So if you are ready for the journey of self-exploration this deck will be both a guide and treasure map...explore more — dive in."Layla Love"Each and every card is as stunningly beautiful as it is inspirational. To hold them in your hands is truly a gift. I can read them over and over, finding a new gem each and every time. Thank you for sharing your heart wisdom!"Elizabeth HeckBeautiful, joyful imagery! You can get a boost of positive energy gust by shuffling this deck of cards in your hands.Irina Thomas"What a gorgeous way to start your morning, take pause in the afternoon or reflect in the evening and whether it be with your eyes, your mind or your entire self. Thank you Mel."Rachael B."Stunning artwork. Inspiring messages. This collection is a much needed contribution to the world!"Dr. Tom"Absolutely breathtaking artwork and thought provoking prose put this deck at the top of my desired decks list! Beautiful creator, inspiring story, magick ready to be made!"River Moonglow Interview with Vanessa CodorniuHow does this deck relate to the Akashic field?

story:
About

Paza Sauti is the first annual youth poetry festival in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. This two day event, November 17-18, is geared towards creating a safe and free space for youths ages 6-18 to write, perform, and imagine their own narratives! With performance showcases from accomplished East African poets, and workshops that works towards promoting creative forms of advocacy and empowerment, Paza Sauti aims to build a community of brave and critical young artists.  

Where the funds are going

All funds are going to pay for:

  • Travel and accommodation for featured artist.
  • Modest honorarium for workshop leaders.
  • Sound and other equipment for showcases.
  • Stationary for youth participants.
  • Food and water for workshop participants.

The A-Team!

Loyce Gayo, founder + co-director

Tanzanian born performance poet, teaching artist and activist. Gayo was the slam champion of the UT Spitshine poetry slam team who won the 2014 Collegiate Union Poetry Slam Invitational (CUPSI). Her work has been featured on Button Poetry, Write About Now, Badilisha Poetry, and PBS. She also teaches creative writing for Writers in the Schools, Houston.

Lydia Kasese, co-director

Tanzanian writer, poet and media specialist among other things. Her first collec- tion of poetry Paper Dolls was published in 2016 by the African Poetry Book Fund in their chapbook collection. Her poem Things That Were Lost In Our Vaginas was shortlisted by the BNPA poetry prize in 2014 and her short story Inside Outside was long listed by Writivism in the same year. 

Mja Issa, youth outreach coordinator

Tanzanian poet, community organizer, project coordinator and founder of Uzalendo Reading Club, an organization committed to fostering and encouraging a literary culture among Tanzanian youths. He is also the owner of a small clothing enterprise called Africa Kwanza Clothing.

Andrew Stephens, creative coordinator

Andrew Stephen is a Tanzanian born photographer, graphic designer and street artist. His work is inspired by everyday moments in urban African life. Stephen’s work has been featured at various exhibitions, such as, the University of Dar-es-Salaam Talent Fever Exhibition and Sanaa Bookstop “East Africa.” He enjoys traveling, listening to East African rap music and drinking chai.

Unable to support monetarily? No problem!

If you are unable to support with a pledge, your voice is an even greater help! Liking and/or sharing our campaign will be an enormous aid in making our project come to fruition. Feel free to send also shoot us a message of encouragement. We would love to hear from you! :)

story:
Resumen

Somos un grupo joven, que con trabajo, esfuerzo y creatividad hemos logrado ser invitados a participar en el XV Festival Iberoamericano de Teatro de Bogotá 2016, nos hemos posicionado en la esfera teatral de Bogotá y nuestra obra Asylum ha estado en temporada continua desde agosto del 2015. Esperamos que nuestro sueño de viajar a México se haga realidad con tu ayuda. Elige una de las recompensas que tenemos para ti.

........

Asylum is a sensorial theatre play made by Sensósfera and is unique in its genre in Colombia. We are invited to the II International Festival of Sensorial Theatre for Inclussion that is going to make in Mexico City at the end of April. The Festival provides us lodging and feeding. We have almost everything ready, we only need the tickets to travel and this is the main reason we are asking for your help.

We are a young troupe, which with hard work, effort and creativity we have managed to be invited to participate in XV Iberoamerican Theatre Festival of Bogotá, and our play Asylum has been in continuous season since August of 2015. We hope that our dream of traveling to Mexico will come true with your help.

You can choose any reward that we have to you.

story:
My name is Sarah-Anne Winchester and I am starting my first Artist in Residency at Natchez Pottery. I started working in clay during college and earned my BFA in Ceramics from Union University.  For the past year I have been a studio intern at Baltimore Clayworks and working for a local production potter.

I am excited about the new journey with Natchez Pottery, and cannot wait to learn the ropes of managing a studio, teaching classes, applying to shows and galleries; while still creating my own work for craft fairs and competitions. Again, none of this can truly happen without a pottery wheel and your help!

While Natchez Pottery has graciously offered to loan me a wheel, I'll need to purchase one at some point in time. Well, why not today!? A wheel is an essential resource and tool for any inspiring young potter. It allows the freedom to go to any studio in the USA and craft creative pieces of work. Owning a wheel will also provide me the opportunity to have my own studio someday, and will enable me to teach and share my passion for pottery with others.  

After lots of researching I've decided that the Shimpo VL Whisper pottery wheel is the perfect fit for my needs. With shipping, the cost will run around $1,200.  In addition to the wheel, I'll need bats ($50), shelves to hold all the new work ($150), and shipping perks ($100).  That brings the total cost to about $1,500. 

If the campaign exceeds my goal, I will use the extra funds for additional studio cost such as glazes, materials, tools, etc. 

By backing my campaign, you will receive one of my amazing perks! (The photos on the side and through out the campaign story show examples of some of the work you could receive.)

If you're able to share my campaign through Facebook, Instagram, Twitter etc. I'd so appreciate it!  The link to share is: https://igg.me/at/sawpottery

Thank you so much for all the support!  None of this could happen without you!

Be sure to follow this campaign through Instagram and Facebook! Just search for "sawpottery"

 

Special thanks to my family, Sierra Estes, Baltimore Clayworks pals, and all the artists at Brydcliffe :)

story:
IL PROGRAMMA 2017 DEL MAAAC NELL'AMBITO DEL 

Progetto per una galleria civica di arte moderna e contemporanea 

Nonostante le difficoltà a tutti note, in quasi 24 mesi di attività (non continuativi) il museo ha visto la presenza di circa 5000 visitatori tra paganti, omaggio, inaugurazioni, eventi singoli.

Molti artisti e personalità da tutta Italia e non solo hanno soggiornato a Cisternino così ricominciando quel passaparola positivo che ci auguriamo possa aggiungere visitatori e residenti al paese e alla Valle d’Itria non solo per l’enogastronomia o per il mordi e fuggi d’agosto.

Per questo nuovo programma si è pensato di proporre due importanti mostre di arte contemporanea come eventi centrali della stagione ma inframmezzate da incontri con docenti universitari, artisti e personalità di spicco dai mondi delle arti visive antiche, moderne e contemporanee e eventuali incontri con musicisti e letterati

8 APRILE

La prima delle due è "ACCADEMIA INeOUT" a cura del maestro dellAccademia di Bari e professore Pippo Patruno.

Si è pensato di coinvolgere una serie di artisti affermati usciti dalle accademie pugliesi insieme a 2 o 3 emergenti dell'ultimo anno in corso. Così per offrire una visione dell'arte contemporanea migliore in Puglia e dare la possibilità ai giovani artisti di fare esperienza con l'opportunità di esporre ad artisti professionisti. Ciò ci sembra una prima occasione per avvicinare i mondi delle arti più giovani in una prospettiva, amministrazioni permettendo, di residenze e stage tutto l’anno così da animare il paese e innescare quel passaparola turistico virtuoso ed efficace anche fuori stagione.

25 GIUGNO

La seconda mostra centrale della stagione sarà FORMA MENTIS.

FORMA MENTIS vuole raccogliere opere site specific, di almeno 8 artisti di fama nazionale e internazionale ai quali è stato chiesto di realizzare un opera specificatamente per gli spazi museali del MAAAC o rielaborare un lavoro in dialogo con l’idea di mostra proposta.

Abbiamo diviso il museo cistranese in 8 aree di intervento.

La scelta degli artisti è naturalmente eterogenea perché vogliamo offrire una visione ampia e continuativa di ciò che succede nel mondo del contemporaneo anche in una provincia del sud, poco sollecitata da questo punto di vista  anche se molto di moda adesso e desiderosa, credo, di attrarre altre dimensioni turistiche.

Il tema FORMA MENTIS vuole richiamare l’attenzione sulle singolarità dell’approccio personale di ogni artista sia con un luogo cosi denso di storia come il sito medioevale del MAAAC cistranese sia con i reperti archeologici del museo cegliese con i suoi rinnovati spazi. Ma soprattutto tentare di comunicare il processo creativo eterogeneo sia razionale che istintivo e tecnico di chi opera nell’arte contemporanea, oggi nel mondo ipermediatico e impaziente, con il proprio lavoro frutto di accurate ricerche in tutta la gamma dell’espressione tecnica, manualità, distanze dalla quotidianità visiva e tempi. Proporre, anche nei piccoli centri, in modo più divulgativo e in rapporto con la storia dell’arte lo spazio visivo e mentale che misteriosamente porta poche migliaia di persone a creare e vivere di questo con l’ambizione di spostare di quel centimetro il senso dell’estetica e del “bello”, spesso in sordina anticipando fenomeni culturali globali,  e contribuire anche incosapevolmente alla difesa e crescita del nostro patrimonio culturale, sociale ed economico.

La FORMA MENTIS di ogni artista è unica? E’ culturale o innata? Chi inserisce una opera contemporanea nella sua abitazione entra in questa dimensione personale? O è solo emozionale? O solo economica?

La tecnologia ha infine modificato il rapporto psicologico tra arte e pubblico o è solo un nuovo strumento di lavoro?

Tutte domande a cui è difficile rispondere con certezza forse non riusciremo adesso ma è la funzione dell’arte porre dubbi e proporre visioni.

Artisti. Massimo Ruiu (docente, vive e lavora tra Roma e Monopoli), Omar Galliani (docente di Brera a Milano, vive e lavora a Reggio Emilia), Elisa Gallenca (vive e lavora tra Ceglie Messapica e Torino), Maura Banfo (vive e lavora a Torino), Benedetto Marcucci (artista e giornalista, vive e lavora a Roma), Fabrizio Fontana, artista e designer vive a S. Pietro Vernotico, Massimo Kaufmann (artista vive e lavora a Milano), Alberto Vannetti, artista e operatore culturale, vive e lavora tra Cisternino e Roma.

LECTIO MAGISTRALIS

Durante i periodi espositivi abbiamo pensato di inaugurare un ciclo di incontri dal titolo "Lectio Magistralis". Le personalità invitate offriranno le loro competenze e studi sui temi dell'arte, della cultura audio e visiva in generale, in modo chiaro e divulgativo. Queste "lezioni" saranno gratuite e sostenute solo da contributi facoltativi o pubblici.

Abbiamo invitato ad oggi: Lorenzo Canova, docente universitario di Storia dell’arte Università di Campobasso, Massimiliano Morabito, musicista e musicologo, Marco Santarelli, giornalista, scrittore ed esperto in enogastronomia, Fabrizio Cianci, architetto, ambientalista, segretario dell’Ass. Ecoradicali, , Edoardo Dell’Acqua, docente al Centro sperimentale di Cinematografia di Roma, Michele Camporeale, architetto, urbanista, ….. più interventi periodici dei maestri artisti che hanno o stanno esponendo al MAAAC.

MAMAgazine

Tutte le iniziative del MAAAC saranno documentate periodicamente su fascicoli specifici, con interventi critici, storici e progettuali in modo da raccoglierli in seguito in una unica pubblicazione (sempre amministrazioni pubbliche e privati sostenitori permettendo).

Il primo numero ha raccolto immagini e testi della mostra estiva dello scorso anno, mentre il prossimo in lavorazione documeterà progetti e interventi specifici degli artisti a partire dalla mostra “Progetto per una galleria civica di arte moderna e contemporanea” dell’agosto/settembre 2016.

Queste "lezioni" saranno gratuite e sostenute solo da contributi facoltativi o pubblici.Abbiamo invitato ad oggi: Lorenzo Canova, docente universitario di Storia dell’arte Università di Campobasso, Massimiliano Morabito, musicista e musicologo, Marco Santarelli, giornalista, scrittore ed esperto in enogastronomia, Fabrizio Cianci, architetto, ambientalista, segretario dell’Ass. Ecoradicali, , Edoardo Dell’Acqua, docente al Centro sperimentale di Cinematografia di Roma, Michele Camporeale, architetto, urbanista, ….. più interventi periodici dei maestri artisti che hanno o stanno esponendo al MAAAC.MAMAgazineTutte le iniziative del MAAAC saranno documentate periodicamente su fascicoli specifici, con interventi critici, storici e progettuali in modo da raccoglierli in seguito in una unica pubblicazione (sempre amministrazioni pubbliche e privati sostenitori permettendo).Il primo numero ha raccolto immagini e testi della mostra estiva dello scorso anno, mentre il prossimo in lavorazione documeterà progetti e interventi specifici degli artisti a partire dalla mostra “Progetto per una galleria civica di arte moderna e contemporanea” dell’agosto/settembre 2016.

story:
Space Taxi History

The Space Taxi is a community art car that began during the summer of 2009 by Portland, Oregon adventure artists Chris Landon (Doktor Creature), Myriah Day (Norma L. Knott), and Harvey Dayland (their son). Each of the sectioned off squares/spaces on the 1997 Chevy Lumina have been decorated by different people around Portland, Oregon and the Pacific Northwest. 

  • The car is not only a Portland icon, but it is also brings people together from different paths in ways that are unexpected and beautiful.
  • We received an estimate that the transmission needs to be replaced and overhauled, which is to cost approximately $2800 from Columbia Transmission (a well-trusted and respected transmission specialist in Portland).
  • Any contribution will allow us to repair the space taxi, uniting people in unique ways, and allow to travel throughout Portland and beyond.

What We Need & What You Get

We plan to completely overhaul the transmission with the specialists at Columbia Transmission, which will cost $2800.

  • ALL PERKS INCLUDE AN INVITE TO SPACE TAXI DECORATING PARTY ON SUNDAY, JULY 16th FROM 11AM-6PM on the corner of N. Gay and N. Sumner!
  • With a $5 donation, we welcome you to our annual ART CAR DECORATING PARTY on Sunday, July 16th from 11am-6pm (on the corner of N. Gay and N. Sumner). We provide enthusiasm, toys, snacks, glue, paint, guidance, or anything you need! You can also bring your own stuff to glue down!
  • With a $10 donation, we will send you a personalized THANK YOU POSTCARD with a photo of the car and our family! Hang it on your fridge, show your friends, or have it as a keepsake!
  • With a $35 donation, we will be your taxi to OR from ANYWHERE WITHIN PORTLAND CITY LIMITS for 1-4 people. Just let us know via email and we can coordinate with you to be there for you! 
  • With a $80 donation, we will drive 1-3 people across ALL OF THE BRIDGES OF PORTLAND. (10 bridges). We will provide you with a brief bridge history and some fun stories for the ride. Contact via email for available dates and time. 
  • With a $80 donation, we can taxi you on a FOOD CART/RESTAURANT TOUR (of your choice) for a 1.5 hour time block for 1-4 people. Dates Available (contact for availability): Sat. Jul 29th 11am-12:30pm; Sat Jul 29th 11am-12:30pm; Sat, Aug 19th 11am-12:30pm; Sat. Aug 19th 1pm-2:30pm; Sat Sep. 16th 11am-12:30pm Price does not include menu items. 
  • With a $150 donation, we will be your personalized taxi on a Friday or Saturday night from 6pm-2am for 1-4 people. Like a limo, but way weirder!

If we do not reach our goal through our INDIEGOGO, we hope to hold more fundraising art car parties and wait until our savings build up to replace the transmission as soon as we can afford it. 

The Impact

By contributing to get a new tranmission for the Space Taxi, you are adding to a community experience that is ever changing and amazingly unique!

  • The Space Taxi has been not only a way to travel throughout the community, but it has brought people together in unique ways. 
  • When we are traveling the streets, we collect stories from facial expressions of joy and excitement. 
  • Often when we return to the car from being somewhere (grocery store, movie theater, coffee shop), there are frequently people gathered taking pictures and we are always excited to engage in conversation about the Space Taxi story.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are unable to contribute, please share this campaign and make some noise about the SPACE TAXI
  • Wave at the SPACE TAXI when you see it driving around (if we see you wave, we will always wave back)
  • When you see the SPACE TAXI parked places, leave notes on the space taxi

story:
Short Summary

WE are making a show that looks at the future of art and visual engagement. The way people see is changing. The biology, the psychology, these are changing. But there is also this primitive reptilian part of our brain that does not change. The rest of us is just further removed from it, the futuristic always progressing outward from the prehistoric centre.

There will always be people who will say “we’ve gone too far! The centre cannot hold”

The centre has held us forever, the reptile part of us doesn’t know much, but it knows how to HOLD. It knows how to attach to what will keep it alive. As our conscious minds progress further, we cross thresholds and continue forward until where we came from is out of sight. No turning back now. These are days of wonder and reckoning. And the stimulated mystified mind, just freshly landed from a GIANT LEAP is looking to establish contact, to re-establish contact to the primal collective heartbeat, to that bass vibration.

As artists we must translate this. The media is new because they are tools not used before or finished works resolved like none before.  A video becomes a photograph, a photograph becomes a painting, and a painting becomes a hand on a heart, feeling that bass vibration. New media is new in form, new in content, new in the way we see it.

Sometimes, we do not see it. It is in our hands and we are squeezing it so tightly, and still we do not see it. Maybe this happens many times, how can we know for sure? Only looking back will give us that kind of wisdom. And now is not the time for looking back. The place we came from is out of sight for some time now. Now is new. Time is new. Everything we do is new: thrilling, confounding, frustrating, liberating, new!

 

What We Need

Venue 2000$.

Curator 3000$

Catalogues 300$

Opening and vernissage exhibition expenses: 3000$

Stationery 200$

 

 

& What You Get

 

 

Original compositions (acetates, photo prints in translucent plastic etc) individually signed on Cinematic Light Boxes A6 size.

150$ each

 

 

 

Original and individually signed photo prints from the featured film “Formal” to be premiered at DotSandPlastic. 

 

Fuji Crystal Archive Paper Supreme® paper (professional use, 238 gr/m², 226 µ). Develop with Minilab Fuji Frontier® (archival quality).  25$ each plus shipping.

 

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us raise some awareness by sharing the campign with people you know using Indiegogo sharing tools.

story:
Short Summary

If our Heart is a treasure chest of wisdom, solutions, and ideas (and it is), how do we mine the treasure? Especially if our small (and usually scared) human mind holds the key! 

I'm Laurie Morse and I've had a book inside me about this wisdom mining thing for 8yrs. now. Yet, I know in every cell of my being that creativity is healing.

Did you know that 'Creativity' is the #1 thing companies look for now in potential job candidates, it moved into that spot from lower on the list this year. 

It's starting to get a little 'buzzy' this creativity thing. I want to make something really clear and that is: creativity and talent are two different things. Some people cultivate their artistic talent, but creativity is in everyone. And when we tap into that intelligence (which happens to be in all 37.4 trillion cells of every human being), it holds solutions, answers to problems, our personal medicine. 

That's how important it is. Insights might arrive as a creative solution to a family issue, or an excellent business idea that changes the course of your success, or maybe you want to make a change in the world and your creative process lands you smack dab on a brilliant new way of doing something.

What We Need & What You Get

I've been invited to an author experience that I've had my eye on for a while. It's a soup to nuts program. Meaning there is a book coach, editors, a timeline for getting the book written (who among us doesn't need an accountability nudge, especially for birthing something like a book).  Once the book is written there is an entire design for getting the book into readers hands in order to make an impact with the message. The entire program is $15,000 which is what my campaign goal is. 

A little more about the program itself...

This team has helped to publish almost 1000 books (including a book written by Arianna Huffington). They know what they're doing, they work for the right reasons...to spread messages of hope and healing, messages that make a difference in lives.

Here's what they say about the authors they work with..."We create an environment that permits and nurtures the formation and development of author's, who in turn write important books." And by the way, they don't work with everyone, their stats are that they get 1000 applications a month for 25 spots. They say, "No other book program has a completion rate of more than 95% (most book programs have a completion rate of less than 10%) and the process I've built to vet and interview applicants is one of the biggest reasons why we only allow people who truly have what it takes into my program."

I feel honored to be invited in. I really want to do this and I need your help. The timeline for getting the book written is 9 weeks, which is approximately the end of September. How amazing is that! 

Your $20 or more donation

  • A Hot off the Press copy of the e-Book

Your $100 or more donation

  • A Hot off the Press copy of the e-Book
  • 3 updates on the whole creative book writing process between now and October. The updates will include either a blog post, a video, or an audio (or all 3). These will include stories from the book on how incredible it is to activate our creative cellular intelligence.

Your $500 or more donation

  • All of the above PLUS...
  • Live virtual experience of taking something that isn't working in your life, or something that needs healing, and creating a powerful transformation. You'll identify and claim what is more serving (i.e. what your heart desires), and together we'll intentionally cause that to come forth into your life via the alchemy of a creative healing process.  

 

The Impact

If you feel moved and inspired by this project and my burning desire to make this happen now, if you have a secret (or maybe not so secret) desire to tap more of your own Creative Life Force, remember that doesn't mean talent, it means the Creative Life Force that's beating your heart, pumping your blood, and digesting your last meal right now as you read this, then I whole-heartedly invite you to be one who supports me and this project. Be one who is part of the solutions so needed in the world now (awakening creativity in a person means they contribute to Life rather than leaving their treasure buried).

Even if you don't want to explore creativity for yourself, if you know that tapping creativity is vital for humanity's future, then I invite you to support this project!

When we connect with the Creative Life Force, there is access to new and different ways of doing things. Ways that work better. It seems like at this point in humanity, we could sure use some creative outpouring! By the way, the Creative Life Force is Love.

I'm devoted to unearthing that for us all, how about you?

Risks & Challenges

What I love is that the success rate for this program is 95%, of course that's if the participant does the work. I'm one who will hit the ground running and do my part no question. My biggest 'challenge' is time to write, and the program even teaches that part, how to weave writing into a busy life. The way I'm looking at that is I can carve out whatever time needed for 2 months, especially since it's been 10yrs now!

Whether I make the total goal or not, this book is getting written.  Thank you for being a part of the process!

story:
Cats and Tea: An Oasis in the Desert

After a long day on the playa, biking from one sound system to another, what most Burners long for is an oasis in the desert, a shady little place to chill and rehydrate with old and new friends. And while Black Rock City is full of bustling bars, what it lacks is enough quiet places for introverts (and exhausted extraverts too) to enjoy tea and talk about their love of cats.

At the Camp Church of the Ceiling Cat tea room, we will offer a quiet, welcoming environment for like-minded people who would like to sit, drink tea, talk about cats: the cats you know or would like to meet. Our goal is to promote goodwill between all people, because around the world, cats and tea bring people together!

We are fundraising because grant for cat themed performance art projects are as rare as uncorn cats. While we have campers who support our camp structures, we need additional funds for public infrastructure, cat arts and tea. All of the donations raised will be used for public amenities, art, and tea!

 

The Ceiling Cat Prophet: Your Hostess

The Idea for Camp Church of The Ceiling Cat started 10 years ago when The Ceiling Cat Prophet began proselytizing on the playa the gospel of the Ceiling Cat: a mythical deity that lives in your ceiling and always watches you, so you know you are never alone. She met thousands of people who wanted to share stories about their cats. Some stories were funny, and some were sad, but The Ceiling Cat Prophet was always there to hear them.

The Prophet is easy to spot with her flowing dresses, cat ears, and dozens of stuffed cats pinned to her dresses. She spreads words of love, “Your cat is the best cat, my cat is the best cat, and every cat is the best cat,” and she gives away “Ceiling Cat Loves You!” pins so her followers can recognize each other. 

For a decade now The Prophet has been supporting Burning Man’s 10 Principles. Today she is one of the longest-running performing arts projects on the playa, according to the podcast Accuracy Third.

Off the playa, The Prophet keeps connected with over 1,400 Burners and other followers throughout the year via a lively Facebook group of fellow cat lovers. Each year she collects photos from group members whose cats have passed away and creates a memorial board to display at the Temple.

 

Church of The Ceiling Camp Amenities

This year, The Prophet has brought together a leadership team with over 40 years of combined Burning Man experience to build the new Camp Church of The Ceiling Cat. Members from Russia, India, and the United States, have come together from around the world to spread a message of peace and goodwill to all on the playa. 

The Tea With The Ceiling Cat Prophet will be a Tuesday through Saturday afternoon tea for cat lovers of all ages. We will drink tea, look at cat pictures, and share stories about cats. At the end of the tea party, every participant will receive a pin to remember the Ceiling Cat. 

Arts and crafts workshops for children of all ages will including instructions on how to construct your own kitten ears.  

The camp will also host evening Kitty Yarn Workshops, introductory-level classes for people over 18 who are curious about Shibari ropes because we all know how much cats love playing with yarn! 

Additional camp features include a solar-powered infrastructure, complete kitchen, collaborative dinners, private shower area, and gray water service for our 20 camp members. 

 

Camp Costs

 

Remember, Ceiling Cat loves you! 

SHARING IS CARING: Thank you for sharing this campaign with your fellow lovers of cats and tea!

Interested in camping with us on the playa?  Submit your application here:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdrNY5...
