I'm supposed to talk about myself in this part, but I'll try and keep it brief. I'm an artist, maker, author, costumer, actor, cosplayer, chef, and world traveler with a passionate need to learn and expand my own (and others') horizons. I also occasionally manage to make things that people like to buy. Lately, that has included a bunch of items that have to be cut on a laser. An opportunity to get a fully-functional, self-contained laser has arisen, and I did a dumb thing. Like, I talked to one of these guys...


... got a personal loan, and at the time of writing this I am packing up to go pick up a laser. Because I tend to get excited about things, consequences be damned.

I Get A Laser... What's In It For YOU? The total amount listed above covers the cost of the laser, the computer dedicated to it, the cooling and ventilation system, the trip to retrieve all of this concentrated awesome (including the trailer, gas, hotel, etc), repaying the loan, and of course the fees gathered by our friends here at Indie-Go-Go. 
So what do you get? AWESOME STUFF! The perks will have prizes at almost every level, including my extremely popular lamps, like this one...


...bookmarks and key-chains, holsters, custom leather work, cosplay props, foam armor (think Iron Man), or just hours of my dedicated time to work on YOUR projects.
    Why This Is A Big Deal The lasers at any shared shop are exactly that... shared. I have to book time at the TechShop in 2 hour intervals per day, which is barely enough time to cut ONE of my Hellraiser lamps.  (seen here - two hours of cutting, several more of sanding, staining and gluing, and.. oh yeah, a lifetime in the Pain Dimension.)

Even with the extremely lenient shop hours, there are times that I need to be able to work overnight. Having a laser at the house will both free up an enormous block of drive time as well as remove all scheduling limitations. It means more products in more people's hands sooner. It also means that experimentation with new materials and the development of new projects won't have to be scheduled and limited to a time slot. This is an 80 watt laser with all the trimmings, which is the perfect power range for the wood and leather that I use most often. It's also powerful enough to really get into some interesting additional choices for materials, but it's still short of cutting metal. In short, reduced costs in time, travel, and materials can be passed on to you.
    What Happens If This Fails?
To you guys? Nothing much. I will honor all orders and donations even if it means making them on TechShop lasers and within their time-frame, so if you're concerned about getting your stuff - don't be. Worst case scenario on your end is not very worst case - it just means waiting a while for me to make it through the orders. To me? Ummmmm...

Remember this guy?
If you just throw a couple of bucks at this in order to support me, it will do exactly that and you will have my heartfelt gratitude. If this succeeds? As soon as the laser is up and running down here, all prize support goes out FIRST. Finally, if you 'buy' my time (one of the perks is exactly that), you have it - on a TechShop laser, at a workshop, or at your place. This laser is a huge step for me, and will change my lamp making from a hobby to a business. Paying back the loan means that I get to keep my teeth.
    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:  I'm using the Indie-Go-Go template directly here. If you aren't able to contribute, please just get the word out and make some noise about my campaign by sharing this thing EVERYWHERE! They even have share tools embedded right into the listing.

story: Hello! I am Corrina Ranae Morris, otherwise known as Mama Bear and I am a pyrographic artist. I create images on wood or paper by burning it. I have been doing this for 3 years now and I am self taught. I have been working with the cheapest available tools from walmart and craft store, but I am now ready to take my work to the next level and go with professional tools. I was recently accepted in to the RAW organization for natural born artists, and had my first showcase. It was a wonderful experience, and I now have to get ready for the my big out of state showcase. I would love to go somewhere exotic (who wouldn't) but realistically I will probably go somewhere close to home and more in my budget.. like Reno, or Vegas as apposed to New Orleans or Paris. :) So, I am asking your help to raise the money to achieve my dream. It's not a big one, just better tools to help me along my artistic journey. I am not looking to get the most expensive pyrography set out there, but a decent one. And the rest will go toward wood and sand paper and maybe gas to get me to my next show. If you can donate to the cause please do, or at least share my story to friends and family who may be able to help. Thank you so much for your time. To see more of my work visit https://www.facebook.com/Mamamoonbear?ref=bookmarks       Quote from Mama Bear at RAW Artist interview... "What are your future goals in your artistic field?" "When someone looks up the top pyrographic artists in the world, I hope that my name will be among them."

story:
On October 9-10, 2015, Cadillac will celebrate the 40th Anniversary of the KISS Homecoming at Cadillac High School. A big celebration is being planned. This will be a collaborative event with Cadillac Area Festival & Events, Cadillac Area Public Schools, Cadillac Athletics Boosters, Cadillac Band Boosters. All NET proceeds from the event will benefit the two Booster clubs.

An exciting part of this 40th anniversary celebration will include the unveiling and dedication of a permanent KISS monument as well as the establishment of KISStorical markers at significant spots around town to facilitate KISStorical tours. We anticipate this event will garner international attention and not only attract many visitors to Cadillac for this special weekend, but also establish Cadillac as a permanent KISS tourism destination. Fans from the KISS Army all over the world will be able to contribute to this monument fund and become a part of this historical event.

The 6 foot tall granite monument will cost $20,000. We are relying on this fundraising campaign to account for only a fraction of the total cost!

(See Gallery above for proposed monument renderings)

Other events that weekend will include: A re-creation of the original concert in the gym (featuring the World's Best KISS Tribute Band – Mr. Speed), KISS-themed additions to the homecoming parade, special promotions by local businesses, and much more. We're excited to host many new visitors as well as CHS alumni back to Cadillac for this special weekend.

A committee of local citizens and many volunteers are working hard to make this event a success. We have the total backing of KISS and their management at McGhee Entertainment.

To become an event sponsor, click here.

For more information on this special weekend, head to www.kisscadillac.com!

story:
A Quick Update

Since you devoured the last ones, we've just added 3 cool new perks to our Indiegogo campaign!

  1. Get your ticket for the mainstage A Tribe Called Red + Rich Aucoin + The Almighty Rhombus show on Durham Street  + a You Are Beautiful silkscreened 18"x24" poster for only $50.
  2. We sold out of weekend passes, but worry not! We've just added 50 passports. Snag one while you can for $100!
  3. We'll make a Sudburians.com video of the person of your choice. We've met with dozens of passionate Sudburians from barbers to beer brewers to waitresses and architects. Your friend could be next!

We need your help to make Up Fest a success. Spread the word. Give what you can. High five!

For the past decade, it has been whispered around 2 AM beers and hungover Sunday morning coffees. Sudbury deserves an art festival that completely embraces its downtown core. Sudbury is finally ready for it. Tired of waiting, we’ve gathered an experienced team and have hit the ground running.

We’re calling it Up Fest. It’s happening August 13-15 2015 in Downtown Sudbury and we need your help to make it happen.

Up Fest is a public art festival that culminates in an emerging music festival and is topped off by an all-night art crawl.  Up Fest is 8 muralists working on 8 new murals the week before the festival. It’s over 35 musicians in over 7 venues for 3 jam packed days. It’s an all-night art crawl where the weird and wonderful collide under city lights.

Public Art Is At The Core

8 muralists will arrive in Sudbury on Wednesday August 5th to start working on 8 new murals that will go up around Sudbury’s downtown core. Local artists and muralists from across the country will have the opportunity to work together for a week on transforming blank walls into beautiful public art pieces.

Up Fest is a 3 day event that will radically transform the face of downtown Sudbury and leave a permanent mark on our cultural landscape for decades to come.

Emerging Music Is The Heartbeat

After a week of mural painting, we introduce musicians into the mix for a three-day festival. The Northern Series concerts will be strategically paired with the completion of murals. These “vernissage” concerts by up-and-coming musicians from Sioux Lookout to North Bay via Manitoulin Island will take place in venues that are close to the new murals.

Aside from the Northern series, music from incredible up-and-coming artists will be presented in a variety of venues around the downtown core. Up Fest is about discovery and creating a culture of curiosity. When we announce the lineup over the new few days and weeks, you might not recognize some of the names, but we can guarantee that they will blow your mind. Get ready to pick your jaw up off the floor and discover some of the hottest talent from across the country. Artists like...

Beat Market, who supplied the music to our pitch video above, will electrify the Townehouse Tavern during Up Fest. "This danceable electronic is the perfect soundtrack for the Space Invaders-style shooter game" Don't just take Exclaim's word for it, have a listen for yourself!


A Tribe Called Red. That's right, they'll be at Up Fest to help us shut down and transform Durham Street. We couldn't be more exciting to present these guys in Sudbury for the very first time. Bursting forth from Ottawa, native Producer and DJ crew A Tribe Called Red is making an impact on the global electronic scene with a truly unique sound mixing traditional pow wow vocals and drumming with cutting-edge electronic music. We can't wait.


The 35+ other artists will be unveiled very soon. Follow us on Facebook and Twitter to know all the details before anyone else.

Downtown Sudbury Is Our Canvas

We will be transforming Durham Street in downtown Sudbury into a beautiful art park with temporary streetscaping, interactive art installations and live music. This central playground will be at the heart of the festival. Grass will be laid to cover portions of the street, projections will transform the facades of historic buildings at night, and people will conglomerate here to participate in the urban art experience.

Up Fest is a people-powered festival. It is a unique festival experience in the sense that it is a participatory festival that tightly knits street art, emerging music, interactive exhibits and people together. Our mission is to inspire participants through active involvement, rather than the passive enjoyment of traditional festivals.

Up Fest is a playground where artists and the public equally take part in playfully reshaping their city.

Help Us Make It Happen

  • Spread the good word.
  • Volunteer your time.
  • Donate to the project.

    • We’ve worked really hard to get grants, local sponsorships and to find alternate ways of funding this project, but we can really use your help. Festivals cost a lot of money. Most of this is because we want to pay artists what they’re worth. We’re asking you to help us raise $25 000 to help make this crazy ambitious project happen. Your contribution will help us pay artists, paint, supplies, technical equipment, decor, temporary streetscaping, interactive art and whatever else we think up.

    We've set up some cool perks and rewards that we'll give you in exchange for your contribution. Get some festival passes, pins, books, custom Up Fest Freakers (thanks Freaker, you're awesome), handmade silkscreen You Are Beautiful posters and so much more!


    If you believe in art, the power of community and that art can change a community, please pitch in what you can. If you're are part of a really cool company that wants to sponsor Up Fest, check this out and get in touch with Maggie.

    Who Are We?

    We’re a non-profit collaborative arts group in Sudbury called We Live Up Here. Since 2012, we’ve created books, public art and cultural happenings that have engaged hundreds and impacted thousands. 

    "A group of young professionals have created a kind of DIY tourism campaign aimed at celebrating everything that is just so awesome about Sudbury." - The Toronto Star

    "Their public art inspires self confidence." - BuzzFeed

    "A cultural renaissance in Sudbury" - The Sudbury Star

    What is a “Sudbury”?

    A “Sudbury” is the happiest city in Canada, located 4 hours North of Toronto in Ontario.

    I’m not from Sudbury. Why should I support this?

    Because you’ll be supporting art, cultural growth, small(ish) towns. Because this means when you take the TransCanada highway and stop in Sudbury (which is a stop you’d make), you can visit downtown, point at one of your murals, and say “Hey, I made that happen. Actually, my name is on this one!”

    You Are Awesome

    Thank you Sudbury. You inspire us. You encourage us to stick around and to help transform this city into a place we are excited to call home. We can't thank you enough for the love and support you've given us and continue giving us. 

    Special round of high fives for Downtown Sudbury and their unconditional love and support, Paul Los who cut that sharp video above, the City of Greater Sudbury for believing in cultural innovation and letting us use our city as a canvas, the Ontario Arts Council for supporting artists from Northern Ontario, and the Sudbury Community Foundation for helping us bring art to children, and finally to our ever expanding team of brilliant minds who are going to help throw one heck of a party this summer.

    Don't stop there! Tell me more!

    Here's another tasty little video of us talking too much.

    Thanks for listening.

story:
Project Description

The Biophilia residency in Gatineau, Quebec is a unique opportunity for me to meet, work with and learn from fellow artists interested in natural materials and bio art, as well as botanists, entomologists, ornithologists and bioengineers. The goal of this residency is to foster partnership between artists, biologists and nature observers. Some activities that will specifically impact my work are:

o  Studying bees and moths, their hives and cocoons

o  Learning about wild bird rehabilitation at a sanctuary

o  Spending time with ostritches, emu, peacocks, turkeys, ducks and geese at a local farm

o  Visiting the Andrew Pelling Laboratory for Biophysical Manipulation where we will work with human HeLa cells.

Participants in the residency will contribute to a catalogue and possibly produce collaborative national and international shows.

I am currently researching and developing a new body of work which centers on speciation and the impact cross-species imprinting can have on subverting strict genus boundaries in the animal world. Expanding my well of knowledge and network of professional contacts is crucial at this pivotal stage in my career as I establish myself as an artist and educator. Attending the Biophilia residency will afford me the opportunity to do both. I believe the experiences and information I will gain from this week will fuel my work for years to come.  
 Here is a link to the residency's website: http://www.artayatana.com/biophilia%20ottawa.html

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am trying to raise enough money to cover the $1356 this residency costs. This fee covers:
  • Accommodation in the Ayatana Residency House.

  • Indoor and outdoor workspaces

  • Participation in residency catalogue

  • Introductions to sites and contexts

  • Workshops by members of local community

  • All activities

  • Ground travel to all activities
    Most meals

  • Perks

I greatly value any assistance that helps me participate in this residency, so I am offering unique art at every donation level!

  • $20 get a thank you postcard featuring artwork produced through the residency!
  • $50 get a thank you postcard and your choice of a 8x10 ink jet print from my current body of work. 
  • $100 get a thank you postcard and your choice of a 8x10 fibre-based silver print from my current body of work. 
  • $250 get a thank you postcard and your choice of a 16x20 fibre-based silver print from my current body of work!
  • $350 get a thank you postcard and your choice of a 16x20 fibre-based silver print from my current body of work, in a custom wooden frame built by me!
  • $500 get a thank you postcard, a 16x20 fibre-based silver print from my current body of work, in a custom wooden frame built by me AND a your choice of one of my wax fetal sculptures
  • $1000 a thank you postcard and your choice from three LARGE ceramic sculptures.

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are tough all over, so if you can't help out I totally understand, but maybe you can help me get the word out and share this campaign with your friends and family? Thanks so much for taking the time to read this!

story:
Recently I was invited to the prestigious Gobelins Summer Program in Paris to collaborate with other animators on a movie. Gobelins is a film school with an international reputation of producing numerous talented teams hired by the world's leading animation studios, such as Disney, Universal, Hanna Barbera, Pixar, Dreamworks and Warner Bros. Other attendees and I will be working under the direction of Kyle Balda, co-director of The Lorax and John Coven. This trip is a big step for me, professionally. Unfortunately, my family and I cannot afford the cost of the program + travel/living expenses, so I've decided to draw my way to Paris, one portrait at a time.  

I wanna draw you, yes YOU.  I want your beautiful face. So far I've drawn 85 portraits of people on the internet and by the end of this campaign, I'll have drawn:


I'm an animator, I make films and commercials. Some of my clients include: FOX, Chemical Heritage Foundation, Camp Nashoba, and Orange County Medical. My latest film "Atelamise" won the CUFF Award.

Recently I got into Disney's Animation school  CalArts  in California for their Character Animation Program but drawing or even expressing myself wasn't always very easy

When I was younger I had a hard time finding a voice for myself. My family is Haitian and I was born in American. Growing up as a Haitian-Amercian I was constantly juggling two cultures and languages and it was hard for me.

So my mother got me a Sketchbook 

I haven't stop drawing since. I found my voice though animation. It's my calling. 

My perks are dope for days! Check it out! 

Portrait (Digital Delivery): Custom portrait of any photo you send to me. 40$


Portrait (Delivered on Paper) : Signed 11x17 print of your portrait sent to whatever shipping address you choose. 60$ (I send little xo notes <3 )


Animated Film : You get to have your own one of a kind 2 minute animated film. Produced by you and animated by me. Together we can make something special for that birthday,wedding,anniversary or any other event you can come up with. 6000$


Sketches from France : You get printed copies of my travel sketches from Gobelins. SALE 10$!!!

Video Request : On my Youtube channel I talk about animation, make tutorials and other art stuff. Request a video about portfolios,animation, tutorials and anything else art related you can think of and I'll make it. 10$

Limited Edition Prints : Only making 21 of these  Original Signed Prints exclusively for this page. 10-20$ SALE
story_txt:
Recently I was invited to the prestigious Gobelins Summer Program in Paris to collaborate with other animators on a movie. Gobelins is a film school with an international reputation of producing numerous talented teams hired by the world's leading animation studios, such as Disney, Universal, Hanna Barbera, Pixar, Dreamworks and Warner Bros. Other attendees and I will be working under the direction of Kyle Balda, co-director of The Lorax and John Coven. This trip is a big step for me, professionally. Unfortunately, my family and I cannot afford the cost of the program + travel/living expenses, so I've decided to draw my way to Paris, one portrait at a time.  I wanna draw you, yes YOU.  I want your beautiful face. So far I've drawn 85 portraits of people on the internet and by the end of this campaign, I'll have drawn:I'm an animator, I make films and commercials. Some of my clients include: FOX, Chemical Heritage Foundation, Camp Nashoba, and Orange County Medical. My latest film "Atelamise" won the CUFF Award.Recently I got into Disney's Animation school  CalArts  in California for their Character Animation Program but drawing or even expressing myself wasn't always very easyWhen I was younger I had a hard time finding a voice for myself. My family is Haitian and I was born in American. Growing up as a Haitian-Amercian I was constantly juggling two cultures and languages and it was hard for me.So my mother got me a Sketchbook I haven't stop drawing since. I found my voice though animation. It's my calling. 


My perks are dope for days! Check it out! 
Portrait (Digital Delivery): Custom portrait of any photo you send to me. 40$



Portrait (Delivered on Paper) : Signed 11x17 print of your portrait sent to whatever shipping address you choose. 60$ (I send little xo notes <3 )



Animated Film : You get to have your own one of a kind 2 minute animated film. Produced by you and animated by me. Together we can make something special for that birthday,wedding,anniversary or any other event you can come up with. 6000$



Sketches from France : You get printed copies of my travel sketches from Gobelins. SALE 10$!!!




Video Request : On my Youtube channel I talk about animation, make tutorials and other art stuff. Request a video about portfolios,animation, tutorials and anything else art related you can think of and I'll make it. 10$
Limited Edition Prints : Only making 21 of these  Original Signed Prints exclusively for this page. 10-20$ SALE

story:
About the Project:

TRAFO is a contemporary art space located in a former power station in downtown Szczecin, Poland. We invite international artists to exhibit in our space, including our main 15 m high turbine hall. Because we have a unique space, we are always on the lookout for unique projects. 

In January, we presented an exhibition from the Italian artist NICOLA SAMORI, a master of painting and sculpture whose works are beautiful contemporary interpretations of Baroque and Renaissance aesthetics. 

After 6 months of work we were able to bring together 50 paintings and sculptures from collections around Europe. The exhibition was curated around the idea of RELIGO, which comes from the latin word re-ligare meaning to re-tie or re-connect to history. Within the scope of this exhibition we also asked Nicola to create a site-specific installation for the main hall and even extended the exhibition space to include the Church of St. John the Evangelist across the street. In a collaboration completely unheard of in contemporary art in Poland, the priest agreed to show a work which was especially created by Samori for that purpose. 

The exhibition was a critical and popular success.

Now, we want to print the exhibition catalogue.

The layout is finished, the critical texts are written, and the cover designed. Now, we need your help!

If you contribute, your funds will go towards:

- Paying the artist 

- Printing the catalogue

- Paying the designers

- Presenting the catalogue in an official event 

Update!

On March 27th it was announced that Nicola will be one of the artists representing Italy in the national pavilion at the Venice Biennale, the most important event in the contemporary art world. It takes place every two years in Venice, Italy. 
Therefore, TRAFO has decided to present the RELIGO catalogue in an official event on the opening evening of the Biennale. 
The private presentation will be held in the beautiful Palazzo Loredan, the current home of the Institute of Science and Letters in Venice. We are making 8 invitations to the presentation available to donors. http://www.istitutoveneto.it/visiteguidate


-----------------------------------------------------------------------

Perks:

4 Euro: Name Added to List of Donors

Thank you very much! Your name will be added to list the list of donors in the "Religo" exhibition catalogue. We appreciate your support, however small.

10 Euro: Thank You!
You will receive a heartfelt email from the curator and Nicola thanking you for your support. Your name will also go on the list of donors at the presentation. 


20 Euro: Postcards
You will receive a set of 24 selected postcards from the exhibition RELIGO and your name will be added to the list of donors in the "RELIGO" catalogue. 


35 Euro: Signed "La Pittura” Catalogue + Postcards

You will receive a SIGNED copy of the catalogue “La Pittura è cosa mortale” published on the occasion of Nicola's solo exhibition at Palazzo Chiericati in Vicenza in 2014. Included are critical texts from Achille Bonito Oliva and Alberto Zanchetta. You will also receive a set of 24 selected postcards from the exhibition RELIGO and your name will be added to the list of donors in the "RELIGO" Catalogue. 


60 Euro: Handwritten Letter + Catalogues + Postcards

You will receive a handwritten letter from the artist and curator thanking you for your contribution, 2 copies of the catalogues "La Pitture and "Solo" published by the AmC Coppola Collection, and 24 selected postcards from the exhibition RELIGO. Your name will also be added to the list of donors in the "RELIGO" catalogue.


85 Euro: Signed "Fegefeuer" Catalogue

You will receive the SIGNED limited edition "Fegefeuer" catalogue published on the occasion of the solo exhibition at the Stiftung Kunsthalle Tuebingen in 2012. Your name will also be added to the list of donors in the RELIGO catalogue. The catalogue is 144 pages with 20 color plates, 1000 editions, published by Strzelecki Books


130 Euro: Signed "RELIGO" Catalogue

You will receive a signed RELIGO catalogue publication and a handwritten note from the curator and artist thanking you for your support. The catalogue will include installation shots as well as previously unpublished works in a rich large-scale visual layout.

158 pages with 90 colour plates, 27 x 27cm, 1000 editions, published by Baltic Contemporary.

Sneak peak:


500 Euro: Invitation to presentation in Venice +  "RELIGO" Catalogue!

You will receive one of only 10 invitations to the official catalogue presentation at the Palazzo Loredan on the opening evening of the Venice Biennial! At the presentation the artist and curator will thank you personally for your support. You will also receive a signed RELIGO catalogue and your name will appear in the list of donors. 


750 Euro: Samori Artwork "Irene Scopre L'informale" (2012) Etching

You will receive the original artwork "Irene Scopre L'informale" (2012) by Nicola Samori. Printed limited edition etching of 30 copies. Aquaforte, 52 x 36 cm.

Your name will also appear on the list of donors in the "RELIGO" catalogue.


1200 Euro: Samori "Reverso" Lithograph

Limited edition Samori "Reverso" lithograph, signed and numbered. Handmade in by six layer process. 70 x 50 cm. Edition of 50.

Your name will also appear on the list of donors in the "RELIGO" catalogue.


More information:

The 56th Venice Biennale:

La Biennale di Venezia is a major contemporary art exhibition existing since 1895. 
It takes place from May to November 2015 this year and consists of Contemporary Visual Arts, Music, Theatre, Film, Dance, and Architecture. http://www.labiennale.org/en/news/05-03.html

The Artist:

Nicola Samori born in Forli in 1977), lives and works in Bagnacavallo near Ravenna, Italy. His work examines forms derived from the history of Western aesthetic culture, taking inspiration from the recurring and dense expressions which live, sometimes involuntarily, inside our unconscious. www.nicolasamori.com

Trafo Center for Contemporary Art:

TRAFO Center for Contemporary Art was founded in 2013. Located in a former power station, its galleries spread over several floors and one impressive main hall. The center exhibits contemporary Polish and international artists in a rotating program of temporary exhibitions. www.trafo.org

story:
Short Summary

Born and raised on the mountainsides of Ireland, my cousin Steven(Stiofán) and I want to pass on from generation to generation the magical myths and legends our grandparents told us. We have started to record and produce to the highest of quality a compilation of the most fascinating stories from our culture, stories which really shape the beautiful land we live in today. 

However we have ran out of our own money as studio time,hiring a producer are very costly. 

We have added traditional Irish music and sound effects to our tracks to make them even more authentic, something other audio books don't do. We hope you have as much fun listening to this tales as we had hearing them off our grandparents. 

Go raibh maith agat agús slán leat, 

              David and Steven Murphy (Daithí agús Stiofán Ó Murchú)

What We Need 

1. Studio Time - They say that for every 4 hours of audio you record only 1 hour gets used. Yikes! We reckon we will need 2-3 days in the studio with a cost of anywhere from €80-€200 per hour!

2. Producer - On top of studio time we need to pay the producer per hour as well, he/she will also get paid for mixing and mastering the album long after we've left the studio

3. Start Up Costs - A lot of distribution/ publishing website have a "new members" charge for their new customers, they charge this fee and take a % of the profits as well :( Not to mention getting hard copy CD's made.

4.Rewards - The most exciting thing we get to spend money on and luckily the cheapest as well. Rewards should only cost us a few €100

WE HAVE PUT €100'S OF OUR OWN MONEY INTO THIS BUT YOUR DONATIONS CAN HELP US TO MAKE THE FULL 10 TRACK AUDIO BOOK.

The Impact

A project such as this firstly helps Irish traditions to be kept alive and be passed down from generation to generation. Why should our kids and your kids have to miss out on this? Secondly, it opens up new doors for people of all ages who may never have heard of this tales before.

Risks & Challenges

Researching hours, Studio time and costs, production cost, publishing costs, on-line distribution and CD production costs.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our video and project in anyway you can, through all social media and by word of mouth.  


WE HAVE PUT €100'S OF OUR OWN MONEY INTO THIS BUT YOUR DONATIONS CAN HELP US TO MAKE THE FULL 10 TRACK AUDIO BOOK.

You can be part of saving Irish culture!

story:
Short Summary

Hiya! My name is Danielle Brensinger and I am currently a glass artist who lives and works in Brooklyn, New York. I have a passion for glass blowing and have been fortunate enough to be able to make a career out of it.

I am extremely excited and honored to have been given a full scholarship to attend a goblet glass blowing class with two esteemed professionals in my craft at the Penland School of Crafts this summer in North Carolina. Immediately following this two week workshop, I was offered the opportunity to assist another professional colleague with his demonstration for the annual Glass Art Society Conference which is held in San Jose, California this summer. 

As amazing as these opportunities are, unfortunately none of it will be possible without your help. With your support I will be able to dedicate this time solely to my craft and my development as an artist. I will learn a completely new set of techniques in glass blowing applicable to goblet making as well as creating lasting contacts in my field. The entire experience would be nothing short of incredible and could only help to hone and strengthen my skills and artistic development. 


What We Need & What You Get

My aspirations are to raise $2,500 to cover the costs of travel; including flights from New York to North Carolina to California and back again, as well as the shuttles, trains, hotels, and the studio fees required for the class. A small amount is also dedicated to shipping the perks available!

If I am unable to reach my entire goal, the funds will go to transportation to and from one of the aforementioned opportunities. 

Any support generated through this campaign is enormously appreciated and will be profound in helping me to advance artistically as well as personally. For this I wish to express my deepest gratitude. This will help me to fully realize my dreams and create lasting contacts to further my career. 


The Impact

These opportunities would present huge artistic and career breakthroughs in many ways. The exposure to so many other creative souls, as well as the combined experience both events present will lend themselves to massive inspiration and exposure.
I have had the previous opportunity to attend a one week intensive class at the Pittsburgh Glass Center last summer. It allowed me to make connections within my artwork as well as with colleagues and other professionals in glass craft. The instructor of that course is the demonstrator I will be assisting as the Glass Conference in California. I also was awarded an apprenticeship to rebuild the glass studio at the Penland School of Crafts this past January, which is where the goblet class is being held this upcoming summer. It will be incredible to see all the hard work myself and the studio rebuild team put in come to life in the two week workshop. 
Without those previous experiences I would not have been offered the incredible opportunities for this summer. The ability to attend this summer class and conference will only help to further create more amazing advances with my craft.


Risks & Challenges

As a glass blower, life is met with many unique, interesting and sometimes vexing challenges. Glass is a hot, temperamental medium that requires skill and dedication to the craft. This practice is all about being open to change and meeting the jobs and opportunities head on. Any challenge faced is part of the journey and is met with as much determination and willingness to learn and overcome as any other day on the job. 
Funding is the largest challenge that has been presented this far. Any other challenges met along the way will be evaluated and resolved to the most desired outcome with determination and confidence. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are as excited as I am, are unable to contribute yourself, or just wish to spread the word about my campaign, I would be super grateful for any and all help provided!
Please take use of the Indiegogo share tools!
Many, many thanks to you all.

story:
Welcome to the world of Mirror of Desire!

This book is bringing the essence of ancient mysticism and spirituality into the format of a fantasy novel. Mirror of Desire release consists of a deluxe hardbound printed art book, media-rich ipad app, music album and a fulldome immersive experience.

This collaboration of evolutionary artists spent over a decade researching wisdom books from many ancient traditions and created maps, references and imaginary devices that will help you visualize and understand the deeper meaning of the ancients and their urgent message to the residents of today.

         Story by Ananta Govinda,  Artwork by Android Jones and Vedic Renaissance  Collective: Cameron Gray, Justin Totemical, Abhi Thati, 

Music by Ananta Govinda, Indubious, John Wubbenhorst, Alex Liapin, Alan Tower, Anders Wasserfall and others.

Based on an opening book in a fantasy sequel, this fantasy saga will take you on a journey of self-discovery, where deep philosophical concepts will shine through amazing artwork and creative visual presentations! This thought provoking saga will not only expand the imagination with a dynamic plot and stunning visuals, but will also reflect onto the guidance from the ancients to the modern man.

Weaving an intricate storyline of two companions - Kastuba and Adi - on their descent from the Timeless Realm into the world of Blu Arth, the reader will follow the pilgrims on their quest to the Pyramid, Self-Writing Book and then ultimately face their reflections by understanding innermost desire of the heart in the Mirror of Desire!

This action plot with a multidimensional philosophy storyline will surprise you with logic puzzles, obscure and poetic references and incredible illustrations that will help you visualize the science of magic!

 Here is some samples of how we can convert the artwork into a media experience that invites you on a personal journey:


    

                                                 ALBUM RELEASE
The Mirror of Desire album release consists of 11 original tracks unique in its beauty and sonic quality and will be available as eco-friendly hard-copy or digital download. This production will take us back to the times when music was not created and sold by an individual track, but was structured as a musical journey of an album.
Music will become part of the Ipad app, where parts of the story narrated by the author will offer optional background music. Preview some of the demo mixes below.


     

                                         MULTI - MEDIA DOME EXPERIENCE

Currently we are collaborating with the leading developer in 360' dome experience to create a live media show using the story, music and visuals of the Mirror of Desire. Below you can see a rough preview of what this can look like. Not intended for external use, this iphone video went viral in just a few days and proved the right direction of this production. All participants of this campaign will be notified about all further developments of this part of the projects as well as live dates for the tour.


     



                                                 FUNDING GOALS

 Dear friends, we require your help in funding this project! Currently we have a written story, some artwork, character sketches, concept drawings for locations and landscapes. This is a great deal but now we need to churn this beauty into a timeless classic!

                 We will use YOUR money to complete following milestones:

  • editing the book and converting to digital format for publishing:    $ 5 000
  • original book cover artwork:   $ 5 000 
  • release of a limited edition hardbound book: $ 10 000 USD
  • additional original illustrations: $ 25 000
  • processing for animation:  $ 20 000 USD
  • conversion to media enhanced  Ipad app:   $ 25 000 USD
  • conversion for E-book readers $ 10 000 USD
  • perks manufacturing: T-shirts, posters, postcards, mugs: $ 10 000 USD
  • audio production of the Mirror of Desire music album:  $ 10 000 USD
  • manufacturing of a limited edition hard copy album release:  $ 10 000 USD

  • concept development of Mirror of Desire as a Role Playing Game: $ 5 000 USD
  • organize the launch party for all the residents of Blu Arth: $ 10 000 USD
  • Animated video in 360" fulldome.pro experience 7 min long  $ 20 000 USD

Dear patrons, please note that we will be fulfilling our production goals as we fill the milestones with sufficient funding in the order of priority listed above. As we choose flexible funding, we depend on your help on making these buckets full:  for example, we will all enjoy the pleasure of seeing hardbound release if we raise 20K, etc.,


"DESKTOP BACKGROUND IMAGE" : Pledge $5

You get to download hi res desktop background image of Mirror Of Desire,
and get on list of give-aways. 

      ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

                                "WELL- WISHER OF BLU-ARTH" : Pledge $15

1."Mirror of Desire" Fantasy Novel in Digital:
Bundle iPad app, PDF and Ebook format.
2. Official "Mirror of Desire" contributor certificate.
by download   First 1008 backers get "Tibet: Cosmology of a Tanka",
PDF or E-book format.
Available immediately by download

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"JUST THE MUG" : Pledge $20

1. Official Mirror of Desire Tea Mug.
Original artwork and special signature indicating limited edition of the mug. Available only through IndieGoGo campaign.
Add 5$ for domestic, 15$ for international shipping

2. Official "Mirror of Desire" contributor certificate.
by download

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"JUST THE POSTER" : Pledge $25

1. Official Mirror of Desire POSTER.

story_txt:
Welcome to the world of Mirror of Desire!
This book is
bringing the essence of ancient mysticism and spirituality into the format of a
fantasy novel. Mirror of Desire release consists of a deluxe hardbound printed art
book, media-rich ipad app, music album and a fulldome immersive experience.

This collaboration of
evolutionary artists spent over a decade researching wisdom books from many
ancient traditions and created maps, references and imaginary devices that will
help you visualize and understand the deeper meaning of the ancients and their
urgent message to the residents of today.

         Story by Ananta Govinda,  Artwork by Android Jones
and Vedic Renaissance  Collective: Cameron Gray, Justin Totemical,  Abhi Thati, Music by Ananta Govinda, Indubious, John
Wubbenhorst, Alex Liapin, Alan Tower, Anders Wasserfall and others.
Based on an opening book in a fantasy sequel, this fantasy saga
will take you on a journey of self-discovery, where deep philosophical concepts
will shine through amazing artwork and creative visual presentations! This
thought provoking saga will not only expand the imagination with a dynamic plot
and stunning visuals, but will also reflect onto the guidance from the ancients
to the modern man.

Weaving an intricate storyline of two companions - Kastuba and Adi - on their descent from the Timeless Realm into the world of Blu Arth, the reader will follow the
pilgrims on their quest to the Pyramid,
Self-Writing Book and then
ultimately face their reflections by understanding innermost desire of the
heart in the Mirror of Desire! 
This action plot with a multidimensional philosophy storyline
will surprise you with logic puzzles, obscure and poetic references and
incredible illustrations that will help you visualize the science of magic!
 Here is some samples of how we can convert the artwork into a media experience that invites you on a personal journey:                                                     
ALBUM RELEASEThe Mirror of Desire album release consists
of 11 original tracks unique in its
beauty and sonic quality and will be available as eco-friendly hard-copy or
digital download. 
 This production will take us back to the times when music was not created and sold by an individual track, but was structured as a musical journey of an album.Music will become part of the Ipad app, where parts of the story 
narrated by the author will offer optional background music. Preview some of the demo mixes below.                                               MULTI - MEDIA DOME EXPERIENCECurrently we are collaborating with the leading developer in 360' dome experience to create a live media show using the story, music and visuals of the Mirror of Desire. Below
 you can see a rough preview of what this can look like. Not 
intended for external use, this iphone video went viral in just a few 
days and proved the right direction of this production. All 
participants of this campaign will be notified about all further 
developments of this part of the projects as well as live dates for the 
tour.                                                       FUNDING GOALS Dear friends, we require your help in funding this project!
 Currently we have a written story, some artwork, character sketches, 
concept drawings for locations and landscapes. This is a great 
deal but now we need to churn this beauty into a timeless classic!                  We will use YOUR money to complete following milestones:
editing the book and converting to digital format for publishing:    $ 5 000 

original book cover artwork:   $ 5 000 
release of a limited edition hardbound book: $ 10 000 USD

additional original illustrations: $ 25 000 

processing for animation:  $ 20 000 USD
conversion to media enhanced  Ipad app:   $ 25 000 USD
conversion for E-book readers $ 10 000 USD
perks manufacturing: T-shirts, posters, postcards, mugs:  $ 10 000 USD

audio production of the Mirror of Desire music album:  $ 10 000 USD
manufacturing of a limited edition hard copy album release:  $ 10 000 USD

concept development of Mirror of Desire as a Role Playing Game: $ 5 000 USD

organize the launch party for all the residents of Blu Arth: $ 10 000 USD
Animated video in 360" fulldome.pro experience 7 min long   $ 20 000 USD
Dear patrons, please note that we will be fulfilling our production goals as we fill the milestones with sufficient funding in the order of priority listed above. As we choose flexible funding, we depend on your help on making these buckets full:  for example, we will all enjoy the pleasure of seeing hardbound release if we raise 20K, etc.,

story:
Those who know me are aware that I recently moved from New York City to Los Angeles. In New York I had a large studio and plenty of storage for my paintings. This is my garage/studio/storage space in Los Angeles. As you can see, most of the usable space is taken up with boxes filled with my artwork.

Although I have shown my paintings in a gallery on the Island of Martha's Vineyard for many years; an opportunity has come up for me to be included in several new galleries on the Island.  I'm excited to have so many shows this summer. And when I get back to LA, I'll have  room in my new studio to create more art work.

So here's how the money will be spent: on shipping and  framing. And the least sexy part, insurance for the art as it makes it's long journey across the country. And then on advertising, which includes;  websites,  announcement cards and local press.

Any pledge, no matter how small will be greatly appreciated. Anyone who gives 25$ or more will receive a set of six of my note-cards, which feature images of my artwork, as a thank you.

Help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools.

My sincerest thanks for reading about my artwork and my goal.

Sharon Rosenfeld Scott

story:
River of Freedom is an arts-integrated work, written for narrator, solo voice and chamber ensemble. The story, written by Caitlyn Kamminga with music composed by Adam Walters and featuring original artwork by Trinidadian artist Che Lovelace, is intended to educate audiences as it brings history to life with a book to be read along with music and narration.

This is a tale of the journey of the African American slaves who fought with the British in the War of 1812 in exchange for freedom and land. Following the war the ex-soldiers were given 16 acres of land in the south of Trinidad. According to their ancestors, who still reside in the south of Trinidad, these men were proud of being American and were known from then on as the ‘Merikins’.


The work has been created . . .

Matching grants from the US Embassy in Trinidad & Tobago and Vincent Wilkinson Foundation have funded the creation of the work. This final request for funding will allow for the work to be widely distributed in e-book format with accompanying music and prepared for publication as a coffee-table type hardcover book.

It is an arts-integrated work, written for narrator, solo voice and chamber ensemble, 

  • River of Freedom  tells a story through music and paintings
  • The story is told from the point of view of a single slave/soldier.

  • River of Freedom provides the opportunity to invest in a focussed, high-profile arts project seeking to improve mutual understanding between the United States and Trinidad and Tobago about an important piece of shared history.

  • The work will be seen and heard in its entirety on May 15th and 16th, 2015 in Trinidad and Tobago. The next step is getting the book published and distributed!

                       


So where does your pledge go?

While the work has been created it still has to be recorded, laid out, printed and distributed.

     


We will entertain and educate 
The story of these slaves who become soldiers and eventually free men in the Caribbean remains under-reported and we are working towards integrating the story into history curricula in the US, the UK and Trinidad and Tobago.
  • River of Freedom is an original work which will endure long after its premiere performances. Due to the nature of the production and the subject matter, it will continue to be performed in diverse spaces from large concert halls to school halls. As an e-book the work will offer classroom teachers an affordable opportunity to raise awareness of the plight of a tenacious people.

Our track record?

Our first collaboration was "Little Red Riding Hood". The story is retold against a Caribbean backdrop with music composed by Adam Walters and art created by Che Lovelace, inspired by the location. The combined book with CD sold out rapidly and is now played in schools far and wide.


There are always some risks . . .

Always, our biggest impending risk, is that the artists and craftsmen are not paid for their work. And for that we say, in advance, thank you team!


Help us spread the word!

story:
click for THE 200+ ALCHEMIST A R T G A L L E R Y & WEBSHOP


WHO AM I? 

'I Am The Alchemist' ofcourse, says it all...  

          Or not? 

                          I am Naomi Hadarian


                                         Inspirational Artist 


  They called me a 'Wunderkind' 


          I drew, painted, wrote, sung, played my

 
                   Old piano and my dear German flute 


            Then life happened! 

                                                 Then I woke up!


This is me at age five:-)

I've started this project, deeply inspired by the world famous novel The Alchemist by Paulo Coelho... and the incredible unfolding of my own Alchemist life-story.


SO WHAT'S THE DREAM?

Step 1: Creating a +200 Art Pieces Storyboard inspired by The Alchemist..

Step 2: Meet Paolo Coelho to present him this unique Art Project/Storyboard and ask him a burning question I have had for a very long time: 'Shall we turn the book in a movie?'.

Step 3 - In the near future: start - together with (please:-)) Paolo Coelho - the first big budget Hollywood movie crowdfunding campaign to actually turn The Alchemist novel into a beautiful inspiring movie that touches hearts all over the world.

For those who never read the novel: read it! Do yourself a favour:-)... It's a heart warming, soulfiring, dreamchasing tale about finding yourself, loving yourself unconditionally, manifesting dreams and following your heart as a guide on the journey of life. 

Yes I do love this book! Thank you Paolo Coelho!

The Alchemist has changed my LIFE!




               

                This is me now:-)


MY STORY

The first time I've read The Alchemist, I finished it in one day. I was 21 and just moved to the big city of Amsterdam in the Netherlands. I used to paint, sing, write play instruments as a kid, but somehow I had quit everything. When I read the novel by Paolo Coelho something slowly woke up. Inspiration came in... 

The visions of poems, photos, colors are emerging. When I read The Alchemist I got clear visions of art. But not only that, I saw images of a real storyboard for a movie. I remember saying to myself: I wish for this novel to be adapted into a film. 

Then..........................................


    

Some first sketches - My heART!

Life happened; I forgot about my dreams, my visions, my idea's, my plans, my heART... But throughout the many years to follow I bought the novel as a gift for many of my dear friends. 

When I was 27 I got into an accident in Spain, where I was drugged at a beach party. I ended up having a near death experience being unconscious for 4 hours, taken to the hospital in an ambulance. During my near death experience, I was somewhere else, not in my body anymore... 

Voices and vague entities were surrounding me. I felt so much love. I felt back home. But I was given a choice: stay or return. Then they told me that it was worthwhile to return because I was destined to meet my twin soul and experience unconditional love. Like in The Alchemist... 

"Buy this book and give to your twin soul, you will know who it is.",

I heard... 

I obviously decided to return.

So I bought a hardcover, special edition of The Alchemist and kept it in my bookshelf for many many many years. Never felt compelled to give the book to anyone... 

Then one day in October 2104... 

I was brokenhearted and desperate and I decided to make a wishlist for my twin soul.  I wrote it all down in a real oldfashioned letter. And made the promise to myself I would only pursue a relationship with my twin soul and NOTHING less. 

I was ready. "Bring it on", I wrote.



Bring it on...

One night out with a dear friend let me end up on Tinder. Tinder? Really? Yes! Not my cup of tea, but in desperate times, desperate deeds. The following morning I woke up and saw a couple of messages on my phone. I opened the app to remove it. I thought this was just a typical result of me being tipsy that night before. Quite reluctantly I started flipping through the pictures. I swiped 4 times yes and a whole lot of 'no way' until a picture of a beautiful, blond haired, blue eyed man with a lot of charisma showed up I thought: wow, he looks interesting! Not knowing that at the same time there was him - who also had written a wishlist-letter so we found out later - looking at my picture saying: "Yes, you are it!".

We matched in the moment. I remember my heart made a little jump and I felt excitement.Len and I chatted briefly on Tinder, I decided I still wanted to delete Tinder from my phone. So we connected on Whatsapp and Facebook. From that moment on we were chatting - not talking - for hours. Len was in Bali at the time.  

We felt in instant, deep, loving connectionand decided pretty soon we had to meet in real life sometime when he had returned to Amsterdam. 

But...

I took a leap of faith; on December 3rd at 5 AM in the morning I went to Schiphol Airport... With The Alchemist in my hands! I've never met him... but somehow I was 100% sure! I was listening to my heart. 

There at Starbucks, Schiphol, I gave him the novel, The Alchemist that was kept in my closet for so long, because I knew he was the soulmate I have been looking for all my life. 

We sat down and exchanged our letter with the wishlist for eachother... and we could just smile...

Magical stuff, really:-)! An Alchemist Love Story!  


    

                                                      Yes, it did happen:-)


These amazing happenings in life and love inspired me so much. I bursted almost. And the artist in me finally awoke. My creativity has been hidden for so long. I decided to create - in gratitude for all of what The Alchemist has brought me - an Alchemist inspired art project: an inspirational storyboard for the movie adaptation. So as a result +200 beautiful art pieces to share with the world.

When all of the artwork is finished, I want to get together with Paulo Coelho and ask him if he would like to join me in a unique crowfunding Hollywood project to get this incredible and inspiring story about unconditional love in all theatres around the world. 


Yes, I do need a little help from my friends...

 

HOW CAN YOU HELP ME TO GET STARTED?

Basicly it comes down to:

  1. your support - this means the world to me

  2. your inspiration - to fuel me on this quest

  3. your (social) word of mouth- please be part of the butterfly effect and share the inspiration with your friends... 

  4. your financial support: 30.000 dollar - so I can fund this +200 Art Pieces Project and present it to the author Paolo Coelho. Ofcourse there are some tempting perks:-)...

Did you know that there are more than 60 million readers of the novel The Alchemist? Together we could be a great force. So far nobody has been able to bring the resources together to finish The Alchemist - The Movie. I believe that co-creating together with all of us could make a difference... and kickstart something amazing!! Are you in? Wanna join?Are you an Alchemist yourself?


Since the beginning of 2016 I am dedicating myself full time to I am The Alchemist - The Art Project. I would love for you to tag along and follow me on this journey. I hope to get inspired by your, feedback, comments and input.

So please do connect with me on social media.  

Thankyou so much for your support,

Love, Naomi

p.s. I am also very keen on reading your own Alchemist story. Please feel free to shoot me an email and share the LOVE you have experienced: naomi@naomihadarian.com

Check my website for more merchandise to back me and my art project.

http://www.naomihadarian.com
story_txt:
click for THE 200+ ALCHEMIST A R T G A L L E R Y & WEBSHOP

WHO AM I? 
'I Am The Alchemist' ofcourse, says it all...  
          Or not? 
                          I am Naomi Hadarian
                                         Inspirational Artist 
  They called me a 'Wunderkind' 
          I drew, painted, wrote, sung, played my
                    Old piano and my dear German flute 
            Then life happened! 
                                                 Then I woke up!



This is me at age five:-)I've started this project, deeply inspired by the world famous novel The Alchemist by Paulo Coelho... and the incredible unfolding of my own Alchemist life-story. 
SO WHAT'S THE DREAM?
Step 1: Creating a +200 Art Pieces Storyboard inspired by The Alchemist..
Step 2: Meet Paolo Coelho to present him this unique Art Project/Storyboard and ask him a burning question I have had for a very long time: 'Shall we turn the book in a movie?'.
Step 3 - In the near future: start - together with (please:-)) Paolo Coelho - the first big budget Hollywood movie crowdfunding campaign to actually turn The Alchemist novel into a beautiful inspiring movie that touches hearts all over the world.
For those who never read the novel: read it! Do yourself a favour:-)... It's a heart warming, soulfiring, dreamchasing tale about finding yourself, loving yourself unconditionally, manifesting dreams and following your heart as a guide on the journey of life. Yes I do love this book! Thank you Paolo Coelho!The Alchemist has changed my LIFE!
                               
This is me now:-)

story:
Manoeuvred Matter is the first solo show of paintings by contemporary artist Aidan Myers planned to be exhibited at Cardiff MADE, Wales, UK in March 2016.


Aims include: showcasing a selection of my paintings from recent and past to celebrate the powerful, dominating and emotional impacts of painting.

It's really important to exhibit solo to bring together the strongest and most powerful paintings to date & push past everything that I've done to date and enter into the next stage of my artistic life.  

With this show, it's a chance to really demonstrate to the art world, public and all viewers why painting is so extremely prolific, overwhelming and meaningful for me.

It's a time to make my own statement within the art world, branch out, make my voice heard and show everyone how serious, dedicated and passionate I am about painting.

Events throughout the exhibition duration will include an artist talk/in conversations with Zoe Gingell from Cardiff MADE, Private evening event - dates to be confirmed.

Aidan Myers - Explains about his paintings in Video


Impact

The exhibition will allow me to powerfully express my creativity and contribute towards the wider arts communities with intentions of bringing more creative investments to Wales,  specifically this comes at a time of proposed arts/culture cuts to our city by the Welsh council.

It will celebrate my beliefs in the fact that art is alive, active and the soul of this city.

 It will demonstrate that young artists can noticed, believed in, invested in and be as integrated within the arts scene as much as other established artists.



Funding

To raise £1,500 will allow this show goes ahead. It will make sure that the exhibition is really well publicised and that it reaches the widest possible audience. Funding goes towards producing flyers, posters, online publications, show setup, space hire, gallery costs and running the events throughout this exhibition duration.


In return for contributions and generosity, I'm making a number of perks available within this funding bid.


Challenges

Always one of the biggest challenges is gaining sufficient funds to ensure that exhibitions are well setup.

Time is always a problem. With thorough strategic planning to cover all aspects of the show setup, this exhibition can really be successful. 

The space at MADE is already booked and planning is in progress for the 6 week show, I still need your support, contributions and inclusion to make this show a reality.


Other Ways to help

Contributions towards funding is vital, though it is equally as important to gain as much exposure as possible by getting this show out there, seen by as many people interested in painting as possible! So please share this to your friends! 


www.aidanmyers.co.uk

story:
WIN WIN Earth Friendly Footwear made with  Paper. Every pair is unique and not just a single color. The shoe-line is operated by Local Emerging Artists. Each shoe is accompanied by a catalog of the artist with an overview of their life's work. It will also be delivered in a bag-basket, hand-woven by recovering citizens working from Puente Grande prison. We will achieve this with your support!!

GANAR – GANAR Calzado de Papel  con cualidades ecológicas, que además de tener una línea de calzado pintado en 1 tono, cuenta con una línea de calzado que es intervenida por Artistas Emergentes Locales, cada calzado es acompañado de un catalogo de artista con el curriculum y obra de los artistas para hacer más eficiente su proyección. Además será entregada dentro de una bolsa-canasta tejida por reos que trabajan para su rehabilitación en el penal de Puente Grande. Lo llevaremos al mundo con tu apoyo!!

story:
Plug Lamps – it’s an opportunity to become a designer for a while!

Story.

Wood – it is a classic design value that has been admired and extoled in all ages for its sorcery and elegance from one hand and its simplicity from another. We also admire, respect and love wood.

Therefore, Plug Lamps are handmade, made of oak and treated with linseed oil.


These lamps are made of plug modules , the base and the bulb holder. Modular connections of a plug and socket are used to connect the base and the bulb holder. The coupling system is designed specifically for Plug Lamps needs. With this system it is possible to simply, quickly and easily change the height and shape of the lamp stem – combine the lamp stem modules you will get a stem shape that will appeal to you.


We offer nine different models of lamp stem forms that allow to combine more than 100 variants, this however makes possible to get more than hundred forms of lamp stem. Plug Lamps brings the functionality in the classic forms.


Plug Lamps operate with a large 12-volt DC power provided by the power supply. Any type of lightbulbs that work with 12-volt DC and fit E27 standard socket can be used in the lamp. 12-volt in lightbulbs and lamps are used for security reasons in order to reduce electric shock to zero, if misfortune happens. Normally a power supply are used that provides a maximum current of 1A and the LED bulb with the power of 12W.


Specification:

Stem module can be produced in numerous configurations that do not exceed the maximum and minimum diameters. Stem module length is fixed and is 200 millimeters. Stem module a maximum diameter of 70 mm, the minimum diameter of the stem ends of the module 38 millimeters and 20 millimeters from the ends of 20 millimeters.


Power Supply

LED bulb

Plug: EU/US

Wattage: 12W

Connector: 5.5 x 2.1mm

Socket: E27

Output voltage: DC 12V

Lumen: 990 lm

Input voltage: 100/110 ~ 240V (AC)(50-60HZ)

Input voltage: 12 V

Output current: Maximum 1A

Color: Warm White 3200-3500k

Maximum output power: 12 W

Led chip: 5730
ON/OFF switch built-in cord

Angle: 130 Degree

Dimmensions: lenght 150 mm ; max diam. 95 mm



Why Plug Lamps ?

Wooden tube, indoors, creates a sense of well-being and warmth. Even more satisfaction from it that it is your created lamp.

Often we face a problem: If you break the lamp, you do not throw away all the lamp, you can change only the broken link and lamp will be as good as new. Where to put a lamp, for example, during the repairs in our place of residence, as there is no place for it in the corner between all the furniture. How to transport the lamp when moving, as it’s possible to damage it while transporting? How to put together a lamp that you have just bought, as it has many complex structures, wires, screws and the manual might cause a certain puzzlement. Plug Lamps will allow you to forget these problems. Plug Lamp can be dismantled and this is how it becomes compact and space-saving. Thus it can be easily put in a box or in a shelf next to the books. Every module of base and lamp has been connected with a plug-in type connector, and the installation for it is as easy as…


(We put the connector in to the socket and turn it clockwise few times until it stops and it can’t be rotated manually. We put a Plug Lamp stem module on the plugin and turn it clockwise until it stops and it can’t be rotated manually.)

…And that’s it.


 


Why we need support?

We have high ambitions and plans, but in order to realize our plans, we have the necessity for financial resources. Therefore we are appealing to you for support.

The financial resources we need:

-To get more extensive workshop facilities, professional equipment and tools for purchase. That`s will allows us work more faster and better.  With better equipment, we can creat more interesting and complicated stem moduls.

-We have completed the connection system prototypes. Now we need to start producing.

-We need to create the website / online shop. That`s will allow people to quickly, comprehensively and accurately navigate our proposed product.

We respect any kind of your support. Be it financial support or sharing of our campaign. We love each of you.

Big thanks!!!


Perks


Only during the Indiegogo campaign

1 Module Plug Lamp

Any one ++++=

60 EUR + shipping. (Price after will be 75 EUR)



2 Module Plug Lamp

Any one + Any one++++=

85 EUR + shipping. (Price after will be 105 EUR)


3 Module Plug Lamp

Any one+ Any one+Any one+ +++=


90 EUR + shipping. (Price after will be  135 EUR)



Our Life tree!

story:
Aloha!

My name is Shannon but you may know me better by my pseudonym, Mango Island! I've been creating handmade stitched goods since 2008.

In 2012 I added an embroidery machine to my team and I've never looked back. However, it is about time to upgrade to a more powerful machine so that I can serve my customers and my passion for thread art more efficiently.



My current machine is struggling to keep up with my growing number of clients, and as a single needle machine, it simply isn't designed for the the tasks I ask of it. It has been deteriorating despite constant care, and all too frequently needs to be brought in for service, which cuts into production time.



With your help, I can upgrade to a multi-needle embroidery machine, speed up my output of client-based projects, and offer new types of embroidered items like hats and jackets. A new machine would take the pressure off my single needle machine and allow for higher quality embroidery.

 

What We Need

For a multi-needle embroidery machine I'm looking at a price tag of $5,000 to $10,000. With this campaign, I'm asking for $10,000, since that is the ideal machine for my situation. I have some money set aside already, and have decided to run this campaign as flexible funding. That means that even if it falls short, I can still upgrade to a better machine.


The $5,000 machine sports 6 needles, so that I only need to change thread every six colours, as well as a hat frame so I will be able to make custom hats! All that said, the frame size on this machine isn't any larger than what I currently have.


The $10,000 machine has 10 needles, meaning I will only need to pause to rethread every 10 colours and it also includes a hat frame. This machine also has a larger bed than my current machine, allowing me to make designs up to 14”x14". My current machine can go up to 8”x12". The artwork I currently create can have from 12-30 different thread colours, meaning I need to rethread my needle for every colour. Either of these machines would be a massive improvement on that front.


What You Get

For the campaign, I will be offering a variety of embroidered patches in a few different sizes ranging from 3" to 8". In addition, I am offering bandanas with smaller artwork. Also on offer is a custom drawing of just about anything (within reason) made into a embroidered patch or bandana! My current machine behaves within these parameters, so the perks will exist even if funding falls short.


If we hit the $5,000 mark, I will add some perks, including the ability to get some patch options embroidered onto a snapback or even a custom artwork snapback just for you! If this campaign is fully-funded at $10,000, I can add the perk of hoodies with the larger scale artwork across the back with a monogram on the front. You guessed it, this means hoodies with custom artwork as well!


Now, if neither of these goals is met, I will still be delivering the patch and bandana perks. The money raised will be added to my current savings, and I will personally keep working toward the upgrade.  This campaign is to help get a jump on my busy summer convention season. If I can get an upgraded machine sooner, I'll have more cool merch at upcoming cons.

Here's some of the rad patches you can get your paws on through this campaign!


All the small patches, they measure in at around 2.5" each.  You can pick from Burger, Hot Dog, Sushi, Pizza and Bushmeat, or get all 5 in one of the package deals!

All the medium patches, they measure in at around 4" each.  You can pick from Terrarium, Enigma, The Truth, Canis, and Shiba Scream!, or get all 5 in one of the package deals!

All the large patches, they measure in at around 8" each.  You can pick from Rude Cat, Swear, Pie in the Sky, Ghost, and Dead Dogs, or get all 5 in one of the package deals!

These patches are even BLACKLIGHT REACTIVE!

Please note; all patches shown are prototypes, and while the artwork will remain the same there may be some variance in fabric and thread colours in the final product due to dye lots.


The Stretch

Its a little early to be talking stretch goals, but I have some wonderful pals who are very excited to help out should we exceed our goal. If we do exceed our goal, this mean I can consider an even larger industrial size machine, or even multiple machines that can be linked together to speed up production even more, wow!

You can look forward to seeing unique patch designs from the wonderful artists known as Boobun, Skulldog, Jill0r, Gorehund, Matuska, Buff, Shaggi, Kookiemutt, and Denali Lobita.  They are all incredibly skilled artists and have some great stuff up their sleeves, more will be revealed if we near the goal.


The Impact

Let's be real for a minute here. I fell in love with embroidery four years ago, and have been working hard as an artist to use this unique medium to express my voice. I am best known for my pajamas, but my passion will always be in my art. This machine will help me and my business jump to the next level. I'm ready to step it up another notch and it would mean the world to me if you would give me a hand. And you'll get some cool stuff in return!


Risks & Challenges

I've never used a multi-needle machine. That said, I’ve been researching their operation for over 2 years, and I can say with confidence that it won’t be much of a jump from my single needle to a multi-needle; I  have the technical skill and knowledge. Typically, the challenge is in the machine’s desire to cooperate with me. I don't foresee a major issue with the new machine, but my current machine remains prone to breaking down and operates at its slowest speed setting, making trips to the repairman frequent if a goal is not met.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please tweet or tell your friends about my campaign. Every little bit helps a ton! Thank you for your support and your continued interest in everything that Mango Island has to offer.
story_txt:
Aloha!My name is Shannon but you may know me better by my pseudonym, Mango Island! I've been creating handmade stitched goods since 2008. In 2012 I added an embroidery machine to my team and I've never looked back. However, it is about time to upgrade to a more powerful machine so that I can serve my customers and my passion for thread art more efficiently.My current machine is struggling to keep up with my growing number of clients, and as a single needle machine, it simply isn't designed for the the tasks I ask of it. It has been deteriorating despite constant care, and all too frequently needs to be brought in for service, which cuts into production time.With your help, I can upgrade to a multi-needle embroidery machine, speed up my output of client-based projects, and offer new types of embroidered items like hats and jackets. A new machine would take the pressure off my single needle machine and allow for higher quality embroidery. What We Need 
For a multi-needle embroidery machine I'm looking at a price tag of $5,000 to $10,000. With this campaign, I'm asking for $10,000, since that is the ideal machine for my situation. I have some money set aside already, and have decided to run this campaign as flexible funding. That means that even if it falls short, I can still upgrade to a better machine.The $5,000 machine sports 6 needles, so that I only need to change thread every six colours, as well as a hat frame so I will be able to make custom hats! All that said, the frame size on this machine isn't any larger than what I currently have.The $10,000 machine has 10 needles, meaning I will only need to pause to rethread every 10 colours and it also includes a hat frame. This machine also has a larger bed than my current machine, allowing me to make designs up to 14”x14". My current machine can go up to 8”x12". The artwork I currently create can have from 12-30 different thread colours, meaning I need to rethread my needle for every colour. Either of these machines would be a massive improvement on that front. from Rude Cat, Swear, Pie in the Sky, Ghost, and Dead Dogs, or get all 5 in one 
of the package deals!These patches are even BLACKLIGHT REACTIVE!Please note; all patches shown are prototypes, and while the artwork will remain the same there may be some variance in fabric and thread colours in the final product due to dye lots.
