story:
Framing the Common is am independent collective project focusing on the modern home and its conditions. It is a collaboration between young studios in four different cities with different modern histories. We look specifically at the shared spaces of the modern apartment, as paradigm to dive into modern socio-political issues such as ownership, domesticity, etc.

As an independent project that we have been running since 2014, the opportunity to show our work at the Venice Biennale of Architecture is a great event to expose the material we have been exploring in four different cities. This is the first time we can show the project in full length.

This project, for us, is the first in a series. So this is the best occasion to extensively show the work, share the content, expand our community community, and start our second project of the series in near future.

- -

We are invited to show the project as part of the TIME-SPACE-EXISTENCE Exhibition organized by the Global Art Affairs Foundation as a collateral event at the 2016 Venice Architecture Biennale (28 May to 27 November 2016).

  • With the support of two local sponsors (in Bogota and Kuala Lumpur) we have gathered half of the funding needed. We have to be able to pay  for the space we show our work in, and for our production costs. The production would be making of books showing the works of each city, showing the videos in small screens, and printing panels.
  • We will send and share the research and projects we have produced in various forms of booklets, books, and dossiers including texts and drawings, collection of drawings and photographs produced by the team, and expand our community.
- -

"The Common as interpreted within this collective research has a multi-fold position. It refers to the commonly–owned shared spaces of the modern project of housing, globally; but also to their condition of sameness, of repetition, and standardization, while also to processes of collectivity and commoning, and to what we have in common as human-subjects. 

The deliberate aim of this research is to shift the discussion of collective housing away from the private living units towards the sphere of the Commoning; perhaps the true spatial manifestations of collective living. Freed from the individual idiosyncrasies that would sooner or later embellish—and even redefine—the living units, the Common is subjected to rules, regulations and enforcement beyond the control of any individual homeowners, becoming a strange in–between zone which is clearly no longer private, but is not fully public either. If we understand Commonness as a condition of sameness for all collective housing projects, how could they somehow still generate difference? How can the Common be framed different globally?

The four projects—in Bogota, Tehran, Mumbai and Kuala Lumpur—carried out under the banner of Framing the Common, are similar in that each are investigations of the Common in the context of the political project of Modernism and Globalization, through the lens of the most basic units of the modern society: housing. Yet, the projects are also different in the way the cases of the Common are framed in each context. Each city has a specific modern—and pre-modern—history in relation to the West, colonialism, and global relations; as well as specific experiences of modernism. How these different experiences—and their respective political implications—are translated spatially are the areas of interest explored in this collective research; an inventory of sameness and difference."
- -

Send it around and spread the word. 

Come see us in Venice at Palazzo Bembo.


- -

We are:

CAMPO (Bogotá)
WORKNOT!, Project Mosha (Tehran)
ROOM For Architecture (Mumbai)
Normal Architecture (Kuala Lumpur)

List of team members:

Tehran: WORKNOT!, Project Mosha. Participants: Monireh Askari, Dadbeh Mohebbi, Niloufar Emamifar, Amir Pourmoghaddam, Molood Jaberi Najafabadi, Collaborator: Mobasher Niqui.

Bogota: CAMPO. Participants: Antonio Bermúdez, Paulina Escobar, Juan Pablo Gaviria, Pablo Lorenzana & Paola Macia, Collaborator: Santiago Buendia.

Mumbai: Shreyank Khemalapure.

Kuala Lumpur: Nazmi Anuar / Normal Architecture. Participants: Abdul Hakim Abdullah, Nazmi Anuar, Ashran Bahari, Bryan Chee, Foo Hui Ping, Liyana Hasnan, Noorul Fadzlee Khamis.

story:
As the mighty Alan Moore says in the video above, on July 22-24 we will be putting on Festival 23, a celebration of Discordian counter-culture set in South Yorkshire woodland, tickets here. 

This intimate 500-capacity meet features Discordian-inspired music, games, DJs, talks, poetry, films, playshops and activities including contributions from Alan Moore, Greg Wilson, Knifeworld, Richard Norris, John Higgs, Milk the Cow, the Cosmic Trigger Cabaret and so much more.

Equally as important to Festival 23 however is our visual art programming. This will be based around an old stable block on site, which we will transform into DeSTABLise; an inspirational, interactive art space featuring a range of specially created work that will reflect the radical, experimental and challenging themes that Festival 23 embraces. We intend a major feature of the DeSTABLise programme to be Jimmy Cauty's Aftermath Dislocation Principle (ADP): a ground-breaking installation that re-imagines the traditional British model village as a dystopian police state, all housed within a 40x10ft shipping container.

But for all this to happen we need your help. To get ADP on site alone will cost us in the vicinity of £2000. We also need money to get electricity connected in the stable block and to help fund the overall visual, kinetic and multi-media art we want to have in the space. We applied for Arts Council funding in order to meet these costs, but unfortunately we could not secure funding. We have been invited to reapply but won't know if we're successful until a week before the Festival begins, meaning we're unable to take the possibility of funding into account when budgeting the event.

The Notwork

That budget by the way is about 90% goodwill and only 10% actual money at best. Festival 23 receives no outside funding and no sponsorship. None of us have money in the bank to put into this thing. This Festival is the creation of Notwork 23, a world-wide grass roots cooperative of equal members. This includes a hardcore veering group of eight people and a small team of dedicated helpers, all of whom are juggling day jobs and families along with the full-time workload of putting the Festival on. Our artists are appearing for free, for minimal expenses or for a fraction of the fee they would expect as world-class performers. We have kept ticket prices as low as possible so as to be an inclusive event, and we are not in this to make a profit. We are in this to do something heroic!

Rewards for Pledgers

Please help us to make this happen. We don't want to just say give us your money, but GIVE US YOUR MONEY. In return, not only will you earn our eternal gratitude and the blessing of Eris, goddess of chaos (which siriusly is worth much more than mere money), but we are also offering some amazing perks to our pledgers, some of which are utterly exclusive and very limited. Also this campaign is running for just nine days, so please, PLEDGE NOW, and then tell all of your friends to do the same!

        Notes: Festival 23 is primarily inspired by the work of the visionary writer Robert Anton Wilson and the Discordian movement. We are also inspired by the great British maverick, writer, actor and theatre director Ken Campbell, who produced a stage play of Wilson's Illuminatus in 1976. The carpenter on this production was Bill Drummond, who went on to form the Discordian-inspired chart-topping dance act the KLF with artist and musician Jimmy Cauty. Cauty was also a founder member of The Orb and is now an acclaimed visual and conceptual artist. In 2014, Ken Campbell's daughter Daisy Campbell produced a theatrical adaptation of Wilson's Cosmic Trigger at the 'Find The Others' Festival in Liverpool. In many ways Festival 23 grew out of this happening, and Daisy will be bringing the Cosmic Trigger cast and crew down to F23 ahead of a hoped-for revival of the play in London and Santa Cruz in 2017.

We also love Alan Moore, Alan Watts, Timothy Leary and William Burroughs. We love dancing, talking, connecting with others, wild ideas and making them real. We love conflicting points of view and embrace chance, synchronicity, paradox and chaos. We like to have a great party and we also like to feed our heads. We believe in magic, free thinking, fun and games and love over fear.

Hail Eris!

All Hail Discordia!

story:
ARTIST LYNN HERRING'S HEART-HEALING WORK TOUCHED HER FACEBOOK COMMUNITY. NOW IT WILL BE SHOWN AT THE WOODSTOCK ARTISTS ASSOCIATION MUSEUM, A 100-YEAR-OLD HISTORIC ART MUSEUM IN WOODSTOCK, NY. 


HOW LYNN'S WORK WENT FROM FACEBOOK TO A MUSEUM SHOW AND HOW YOU CAN HELP GET THE WORK FRAMED.

I have been creating a series of paintings that began a year ago as my heart was recovering from the painful ending of a relationship. I gave myself a project to help me get through the grief — make a painting a day and put it up on Facebook. The paintings were small so that I could keep up the one-a-day pace and I called it the "Winter Shut-in Show." The “exhibit” lasted for a month— from March 1 to April 1, 2014—and I was surprised to see that people followed and cheered me on with this work. It felt so good to be able to connect and I was astounded that healing myself actually helped others! Since then I've continued with a series of larger paintings (like the one pictured above) and I have been posting nearly a painting a week. The work is on fine printmaking paper using gouache, graphite, and water-soluble crayons.

As I was deep in this process of making paintings and showing them on my Facebook page, an artist friend suggested that I apply for a show at The Woodstock Artists Association Museum, a historic museum in the heart of Woodstock, NY. For nearly 100 years, artists have been exhibiting in the museum's beautiful galleries. When I got phone call from the museum director telling me that I was chosen for a solo show, I can't tell you how elated I felt! How rewarding it was for me to go from a broken heart to my own virtual Facebook gallery to a show in a beautiful and historic museum!  My desire is to show this work in the most beautiful way with professional framing — AND YOU CAN HELP!


WHAT IT'S GOING TO TAKE:  10-16 CUSTOM FRAMES

It's always quite shocking to see the price tag on custom framing; yet this process is crucial to presenting the work in the best light and protecting it. A skilled custom framer knows the materials for archival preservation, and the costs of the wood (ash), archival papers, and glazing are significant. 


WINTER SHUT-IN SHOW: 2014 - ONE OF THE  PERKS. 


DONATE TO THE CAMPAIGN, GET PERKS,
FEEL HAPPY!


PICS OF THE PERKS

$5OO LEVEL - 9 Original Paintings

14"X 20" Watercolor paintings done with gouache and other materials.

$100 LEVEL - 50 Signed archival prints of any one of these paintings 

14" x 20" Signed archival print - you choose the image.


$250 LEVEL - 22 Original paintings

6.5" X 11.5" or 7" x 10"  Watercolor paintings done with gouache and other materials.

$50 LEVEL - 100 Signed archival prints of any of these paintings

6.5" X 11.5" or 7" x 10"  Signed archival print. You choose the image.

$25 LEVEL - 200 Signed archival prints of any of these paintings

3.5" x 5" Signed archival print. You choose the image.

$10 LEVEL - Postcard with image of new work 



HERE'S THE BREAKDOWN OF THE BUDGET FOR THE CAMPAIGN.

FRAMING $2,748 
My budget reflects framing 

• 10 large pieces $2,400 
• 2 smaller pieces $162

PERKS - PRINTS AND POSTCARDS $245

• Archival prints $175
• Postcards $70

PACKING AND SHIPPING FROM  $400 TO $1,614
(The range depends on the number of contributions and delivery from large to smaller pieces. The high number is if all contributions are made and all perks are sent - should I ever be so fortunate!)

• Postage/mailers for shipping  Nine  14" x 20" paintings: $40 each. Up to $360.
• Postage/ mailers for shipping Twenty  7" x 11" paintings: $6 each. Up to $120. 
• Postage for shipping 150 archival prints at $6 each. Up to $900.
• Postage for shipping 200 small archival prints at .49 each. Up to $98
• Postage for shipping 200 postcards at .49 each. Up to $96

INDIEGOGO FEES - UP TO 9% of donations: $357

CREDIT CARD FEES - UP TO 5% of donations: $232


Help Lynn's work reach a wider audience 

and donate to the campaign!

tell you how elated I felt! How rewarding it was for me to go from a broken
heart to my own virtual Facebook gallery to a show in a
beautiful and historic museum!  My desire is to show this work in the most beautiful way with professional framing — AND YOU CAN HELP!WHAT IT'S GOING TO TAKE:  10-16 CUSTOM FRAMES
It's always
quite shocking to see the price tag on custom framing; yet this process is crucial to presenting the work in the best light and protecting it. A skilled custom framer knows the
materials for archival preservation, and the costs
of the wood (ash), archival papers, and glazing
are significant. 
WINTER SHUT-IN SHOW: 2014 - ONE OF THE  PERKS. 

DONATE TO THE CAMPAIGN, GET PERKS, FEEL HAPPY!

PICS OF THE PERKS$5OO LEVEL - 9 Original Paintings14"X 20" Watercolor paintings done with gouache and other materials.$100 LEVEL - 50 Signed archival prints of any one of these paintings 14" x 20" Signed archival print - you choose the image.


$250 LEVEL - 22 Original paintings
6.5" X 11.5" or 7" x 10"  Watercolor paintings done with gouache and other materials.
$50 LEVEL - 100 Signed archival prints of any of these paintings
6.5" X 11.5" or 7" x 10"  Signed archival print. You choose the image.


$25 LEVEL - 200 Signed archival prints of any of these paintings
3.5" x 5" Signed archival print. You choose the image.

$10 LEVEL - Postcard with image of new work 

HERE'S THE BREAKDOWN OF THE BUDGET FOR THE CAMPAIGN.FRAMING  $2,748 My budget reflects framing • 10 large pieces $2,400 • 2 smaller pieces $162PERKS - PRINTS AND POSTCARDS $245• Archival prints $175• Postcards $70PACKING AND SHIPPING FROM  $400 TO $1,614 (The range depends on the number of contributions and delivery from large to smaller pieces. The high number is if all contributions are made and all perks are sent - should I ever be so fortunate!)• Postage/mailers for shipping  Nine  14" x 20" paintings: $40 each. Up to $360.• Postage/ mailers for shipping Twenty  7" x 11" paintings: $6 each. Up to $120. • Postage for shipping 150 archival prints at $6 each. Up to $900.• Postage for shipping 200 small archival prints at .49 each. Up to $98• Postage for shipping 200 postcards at .49 each. Up to $96INDIEGOGO FEES - UP TO 9% of donations: $357CREDIT CARD FEES - UP TO 5% of donations: $232Help Lynn's work reach a wider audience and donate to the campaign!

story:
Since Alfred Hitchcock's "Rear Window," we have all loved to watch our neighbors.  I have turned this voyeuristic idea into a friendly one, that builds communities, and makes art.  I inspire neighbors to meet neighbors, in order to create a photograph looking from one window into the other.  However, with the help of new online technology, I am able to direct and shoot the picture from my desk in New York City.  It is art made through instant global collaboration!  

On tap are photographs that I will take in Holland and Bhutan.   But I need your help to make 50 more photographs around the world.  Please support this project which will enable me to hire scouts, get cameras in the hands of locals, and publish a book of the work.

Please check out my perks - prints!  (shipping outside US will have a postage fee)

story:
STATEMENT:

Tras la intención de un trabajo de fin de carrera nace este proyecto, algo que pululaba por mi mente y  que ha tomado forma después de unir todas las ideas, porque el amor al arte es lo que tiene, compartir eso que te hace sentir y darle sentido junto a los que te rodean. Un proyecto sin ánimo de lucro, formado por y para nosotros, lo que sería arte procesual, disfrutar la experiencia sin protagonizar el resultado.

La curiosidad por la pintura flúor y ese mundo de color al que te transporta es lo que quiero que experimentéis en este festival, que en su segunda edición ya nos demuestra que es un claro ejemplo de comunidad. No desvelaré todo ahora, sólo decir que aquel que desee participar de una forma u otra será bien recibido. Tras ver la envergadura del proyecto me veo en el compromiso de pedir ayuda, ayuda que tendrá su enorme agradecimiento y que conseguirá que entre todos pasemos una noche mágica protagonizada por la ultraviolet moonlight. Desde gente que le guste pintar, dibujar, bodypainting,… a amantes de la fotografía, vídeo, imagen,… o que aporte ayuda en la organización y desarrollo del mismo. Además he decido probar el Crowfunding y así destinar todo el dinero que recaude en adquirir más material (pinturas, tela) del que yo pueda financiar para llenar la noche de color.

Se recomienda ropa oscura o tu cuerpo como lienzo (también puedes adquirir tu camiseta del Konfussion y así llevarte un bonito recuerdo), ganas de descalzarte y pringarte los pies con pintura, y energía para bailar! Eso sí, cuidado no manches el resto de decoración que aporta el festival  ; )

Cualquier voluntario que quiera colaborar con el proyecto que se ponga en contacto conmigo, vía Facebook (Eva Gaupp), email (evagaupp@gmail.com), o el propio evento KONFUSSION 2015. Así como económicamente a través de esta plataforma de Crowfunding de Indiegogo.

story:
WANT TO BE A PART OF SOMETHING TRANSFORMATIONAL THAT WILL INSPIRE CREATION?

IT WONT BE THE SAME WITHOUT YOU!

We are collaborating artists, healers and other unique minds whom would like to create not only a new way of doing festivals, but a more vibrant way of living life and interacting with one another.

Over years of traveling to art based events we have noticed that artist & vendors are always stuck under boring square plastic tents. Though we frequent these events to retreat from the norm, we seem to just be getting lost in the crowd.

We believe our communtiy is in desperate need of accessible creative spaces and that beautiful structures are a key factor in our creative potential.

By reaching our funding goal we will obtain a 16ft geodesic dome & 13ft souldpad teepee & create a unique inviting multi-use space that brings together like minded people for creative interaction!

OUR GOALS:

- To display local arts & crafts and give enteprenuers a chance to reach their potential & be successful

-  To hold space for live art performance, dance, movement expression & communal art projects

- To create a tea, kava, tarot & coffee lounge

- To provide a mobile library of knowledge based and spiritual books

- To host foodshares, educational workshops & discussions

-To create a giant shadow puppet show, & other large installations

- To create a healing center complete with massage therapists & yoga teachers 

- To hold space for spoken word open mic & jam sessions


We need to raise $3000 to obtain a geodesic dome and a soulpad teepee. 
If we do not reach our entire goal, we will start with one of the structures mentioned above, instead of both, and continue to grow the village over time.
If we raise more than our goal we will put the funds towards:
Solar Panels, Speakers, a microphone, books for the library, inviting relaxing decorations, and additional or larger structures!

We invite all interested persons to participate as well as donate!
We are currently collaborating with:
Cooperative Creations (www.facebook.com/groups/397868933713747/) 
Yogulu Yoga & Bellydancing (www.facebook.com/Yogulu)
Grateful Gemini Designs (www.facebook.com/gratefulgeminidesigns)
T.O.C.O. Tapestries of Community Offerings NFP (www.tocofamily.org)
Conscious Creations Massage Therapy
Eternity in a Box (www.facebook.com/EternityinaBox)
Straight Up Magazine (www.straightupmagazine.net)
The Psychedelic Society of STL www.facebook.com/groups/ThePsychedelicsocietystl/
Body/Art/Photo/Squad (www.facebook.com/pages/BodyArt-PhotoSquad/13746...)
Earth Rhythms Healing (www.facebook.com/pages/Earth-Rhythms-Healing/13...)

story:
My name is Asifa Lahore and I am a singer, DJ, club host, LGBT activist and media personality. In 2014, I made the top 100 on The Rainbow List conducted by The Independent UK as the most visible face of the South Asian & Muslim LGBT communities in the UK.

I am proud to be a ‘Gaysian’ in a world where there are next to no role models from my community. This is despite there being a thriving UK South Asian Gay Club scene, support organisations and a new generation of girls, boys and queens coming out.

I use social media to advocate LGBT activism and push the boundaries through my music videos. I am seeking funding for my next music video. ‘Love Is The Only Cure’ is a uptempo Bollywood House track co-written with British Asian producer Naamless. It is an uplifting club anthem sung in English with empowering lyrics, Bollywood influences and powerhouse vocals.

I want to live in a world where everyone can be fully self-expressed in whatever environment without the fear of judgment, persecution and discrimination. The common factor that ties us together is our humanity, which takes us beyond boundaries of race, creed, gender, sexual orientation etc.

I would like to create a lyric video that will include at least 100 South Asian & Muslim LGBT people and our allies. 100 Gaysians have not appeared together on screen in living history therefore this is my most ambitious music video to date. I want to create the opportunity and platform for a marginalized to be to visible and challenge the notion that we either don’t exist or are ashamed of who we are. We simply don’t want to hide anymore.

As always this is my tireless attempt at bringing light to an issue that means everything to me and one I will fight for till my last breath. This lyric video will give people the chance to have a voice and cause change in the world simply by being present and visible..

All funds raised for the video will go towards production and technical costs only. This includes venue hire, camera hire, editing, lighting etc. I like to make my videos cost-effective therefore make up, styling and transport costs will be handled by myself.

Despite challenges and prejudices, I sincerely believe we can make a difference together and this is where I need your help.

There are many incentives on the right of this page for you to contribute to and gain something as well. Please donate any amount you can and if you are not in the position to then spread the word to those you think can.

“Somewhere between right and wrong, there is a garden. You will find me there”. - Rumi

story:
It's About the Journey

Hello, RockStar (aka Jana Mckinny) from Sacramento CA, it’s good to meet you.  I was inspired to build an art car last year, but I didn’t just want to get from point A to point B.  It had to be an epic experience, a ride unto itself….. it had to be a rotating stellated dodecahedron.

Wait a what?  A 3D five pointed star, or exoskeleton, on caster wheels that rotates independently from the drive vehicle.  The drive vehicle (an ATV) pushes on a race inside of the exoskeleton with three horizontal "bumper"wheels.  Think of it like riding a 12ft in diameter ball bearing that looks like a star.   Still confused?  Check out the proof of concept video - staring myself of course.

Turns out that’s a tall order for a one (wo)man show. I am proud to say that in 2014 I completed the exoskeleton - 80% of the way to epic awesomeness.  StarDust was born: a 3D spinning star. From the ground up the entire build took just over four months.  Now I am asking for your help to take it to the next level, and turn last years “wow that is such a cool idea” art car into “holey rusted metal Batman - that shooting star we rode on blew my mind!” 


Enough Hippie Mumbo Jumbo - Whats the Plan?

Repairs - ‘gasp’ it Broke!  There are just a few things that failed the field test....

  • $65 - replacement LED screen for battery charger/inverter
  • $300 – real paint job (spray paint just didn’t hold up to playa alkaline)
  • $250 – ATV maintenance (brakes, front tires, oil change, air filter)
  • $150 – poofer (1lb accumulator, propane hose connectors, top mount)
  • $40 – propane tank holder (2)
  • $480 – trailer repairs (tires, ramp holders, paint)
  • $20 – ‘S’ hooks for spandex skin

Improvements - Here is the fun stuff - oh yeah Baby, yeah!

  •   $200 – driving flood lights (5)
  •   $80 – blower or fan to prevent quad overheating
  •   $300 – electrical (fuse block, control panel for lights, sound)
  •   $850 – SMD LEDs (250’ LEDS, aluminum track, wiring, connectors)
  •   $200 – disco Balls for upper points (5)
  •   $300 - wireless caster wheel brakes (5)
  •   $120 – seat Cushions (5)


Operations Costs (I'm sure not expecting to raise these but a little help would be really, really nice)

  •   $60 – Gas for quad/generator
  •   $160 – propane
  •   $45 – OHV registration
  •   $350 – transportation costs
  •   $1800 – storage fees/workspace

Repairs take top priority, then safety (things like driving lights, so I can see all those darling, unlit, special people wandering around in the middle of night with no lights on).   After addressing repairs and safety issues the biggest project I would like to accomplish is adding color changing SMD LED strip lights to outline the star.   Christmas icicle lights were what I used last year (2014 Lights) but they just didn't scream "StarPower!". 

What do YOU get?

I'm glad you asked!  Keep you eyes pealed for StarDust at Northern California Events.  Wave me down and say hi; check out the awesome improvements YOU helped fund.  If there is an open seat lets go for a spin - that's the whole point!  Ideally your donations to be used directly StarDust but I understand you may want some 'thing" in your hot hands where your hard earned cashed used to be, so check out the perks to your right ------->

Risks & Challenges

My biggest hurdle from last year by far was the lighting/electrical system - it drove me insane!  I've been lucky enough to enlist the help of an electrical engineer to help me do it right this time: fuses, switches, appropriate gauge wire and connectors are all on the improvements list.  Boy oh boy, am I expecting to learn a lot.    


    Other Ways You Can Help

    No dinerio?

    • Are you local to Sacramento and might light to help with the actual repairs and improvements?  You made my day!  Nothing beats soldering electrical connections on a Friday night with a friend. Send me an email and lets chat. 
    • Is electricity and power tools not your thing?  Make some noise and share my fundraiser!
    • The best way, other than donating of course, is to look for me on playa.  Lets go on an adventure to the (you fill in the blank) and beyond!

story:
Attention:  If you have found this campaign, please note that our current InDemand campaign for 2017 can be found here:

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/mystic-flyer-mobile-art-car-at-burning-man-2017#/   

Thank you very much for your consideration.

Sincerely,
C-Rex . . . aka Timothy Johnson                           

The Mystics

 

 

We have a 15+ year history as a theme camp at Burning Man. We are a medley of creative talent & energy. Inspired by a sense of mystery & wonder, we perceive the consciousness of "We Are All One".  Camp Mystic is an ongoing experiment in the power of friendship, love, artistic expression, transformational dialogues, commitment, and exploration into the farthest reaches of human development and beyond.

We bring together an incredible showcase of visionary art, sculpture, live dancers, singers and performers and celebrate creativity in all its forms from some of the best artists at Burning Man and we are wanting to expand contact with the citizens of Black Rock City with our offerings by making them mobile.

 

 

 

 

New Mystic Flyer Art Project 

 

 

 

For the past several years we've sponsored art projects in camp and on the Playa and this year we are bringing it even bigger and better than ever by converting our 1985 school bus, formerly known as Festibus, into a mutant vehicle that can carry dozens of us around the playa to revel and enjoy the shenanigans at Burning Man and to bring our human essence of truth and beauty to the participants of Black Rock City.  The Mystic Flyer will become an incredible moving canvas for visionary artist Android Jones (androidjones.com) to fill people's eyes and hearts with his transformational art.  It will also be a traveling showcase for the many talented Mystic musicians and performers that have contributed to the legacy of our Wednesday Night Chillax Lounge parties bringing those vibes wider and deeper into the Playa than ever before possible.

Now, we are coming together to build our most challenging project ever that captures some of our essence and provides an incredible experience of visionary art, performance, music, community, cuddle pile connections, and more....all on wheels to travel the Playa and possibly to other festivals taking people on a journey of beauty, connection, and radical creative expression.

To bring this vision to life, we need your contribution.  

Proposed Roof Deck Merkabah Concept for personal out-of-body consciousness ascension and time travel plus a Level 2 Sound System DJ Setup!

 


Inspiration for shaped frames with dye-sublimated printed fabric to mutate the exterior bus-shape.

 Inspired by the cool, social interactivity of rail car lounges, participants will be able to relax in chilled comfort on the hottest days and be dazzled by illuminated visionary art on cool nights.   Comfy and inviting, Mystic-style!

 

 


Our Mystic Flyer Team

This year we're putting together an epic team of engineers, builders, creators and artists along with an advisor on the project who built and designed from the ground level up the infamous 'Great Sammich Ride' art car. 

 

  • Cyberius Rex (a.k.a. Timothy Johnson), Our Leader and Visionary
  • Mike Cline, Engineering Consult and creator of The Great Sammich Ride (https://www.facebook.com/thegreatsammichride/ph...)
  • Joel Otto, Chief Engineer and Fabricator
  • Genevieve (a.k.a Jennifer Russell), Decor & Fundraising Campaign
  • Erik Flint, 3D Rendering and Image Preparation for Android Jones Art
  • Nimitae (a.k.a Bryan Franklin), Sound Engineer & DJ
  • Corazon (a.k.a. Cory Glazier), T-Shirts
  • Bamboo (a.k.a. Kevin Contreras), Bamboo Canvas Kite Designer
  • Android Jones, Visionary Artist
  • Julia Maryanska, Videographer + Build Crew
  • John Taylor, Build Crew
  • Greg Schneider,  Build Crew
  • Scott Schroder, Build Crew



What We Need

 

All the design, creativity, logistics, engineering, and on the ground build work is being volunteered by our amazing crew.  This project has received $3500 from Camp Mystic funds to begin the process and already owns the Festibus.  We're looking to raise an additional $20,000 for phase I of this project to help us purchase the materials we'll need to create.  In phase II we might need an additional $10,000:


Use Of Funds

The proceeds will go towards each of the following areas: ($23,990)

 

  • Power steering repairs ($200)
  • A stable and sound roof deck and stairs up to the top of the Flyer ($2,750)
  • Interior Decor for Plush Lounge ($1,450)
  • Exterior  Lighting, Art, and Fabrication ($11,620)
  • Decorative multi-colored LED Lighting ($3,500)
  • A Level 2 sound system and DJ setup for musical performance ($3,700)
  • A bamboo and multi-colored fabric transformit-style shade cover ($1,370)
  • Some logistics - insurance, moving permits, gas, crew meals ($2,400)
  • Bus insurance and moving permits ($400)
Our itemized budget for the above can be found here.
If we reach our stretch goal of $35,860 this will fund:
  • AC for the Interior of the Plush Zone ($5,000)
  • Awesome Additional Lighting  to light up our Flyer at night ($2,000)
  • Additional Sound - 2xSubWoofers ($1,490)
  • Additional Logistics & Labor to get our crew there ($3,480)
For 2016 we are hoping to raise additional funds to put Lumilor Paint which is an Electroluminescent Coating System on lighted panels all over the bus which we might have custom art created for!!!....For that effect we'd need additional funds  but it's INCREDIBLE....check it out.  
Lumilor Electroluminescent Paint 


What You Get

Incredible Android Jones 'Galactavangel' T-Shirt for Camp Mystic

 

 

 

     

    Risks & Challenges

    If we don't reach out goal in 2015 and can't get enough work time to build it we will continue this project into 2016 and debut it next year.  Either way this project IS HAPPENING no matter what and your funds will help us make it happen faster so we can all enjoy it on the Playa this year in 2015.

    There is always a chance that we are not given our Mutant Vehicle License from Black Rock City.  There are now more art cars seeking licenses then BRC has licenses.  We understand fully the requirements to receive one of these licenses and are creating our Flyer to meet everyone of those requirements and also know the leadership at BMORG who organizes the event.  

    We have a stellar reputation for the other art car associated with our theme camp - The Great Sammich Ride, created by Mike Cline who has been a Mystic for 5 years.  All of these things should help mitigate this risk and once we receive our funding we     will begin creating the necessary relationships in order to further ensure our receipt of the necessary license.

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    In addition to funding we are looking for your ecstatic volunteerism in bringing this beautiful project to the Playa.  If that lights you up and turns you on, check out some additional ways you can help support this project.   Reach out to us at registration@campmystic.org and we'll connect you to this team.

    • Perk Fulfillment Coordinator - Most (we expect 80-90%)of the Tank Tops and T-Shirts and Art Pieces will be fulfilled on playa but for those that ordered and are not on playa we will need to ship them their perks and need someone willing to send them out the second or third week of September for any remaining unfilled orders.
       
    • Chief Lighting Technician - We have a good idea of what we want to accomplish with our lighting and would love a tech-savvy leader to help us figure out the best ways to install it.  We've got some great multi-colored sound activated LED lights, and want to do amazing things with LED ribbon and Electroluminescent materials or other illumination that you might suggest to make this beautiful 
       
    • Power/Generator Engineer - We will need to specify how we plan on powering the sound and lighting on the Mystic flyer that is not directly tied into the bus's battery.  Any consultation and advice on how to create that power and how to run the appropriate cords to the various devices that need it would be awesome.
       
    • Fabrication Engineer / Metal Worker - We could use additional consultation and design on fabricating the structure that will be covering the Chasis on the bus so that it is adequately mutantified (is that a word?).  Someone who might advise the project on what materials to use, what equipment we need, and how best to fashion and contract the shapes we are wanting to create ontop of the frame and how to affix them to the bus
       
    • Crowdsourcer / Resource Provider - If any of the items listed in our itemized budget are items you'd like to donate or help us crowdsource we'd happily accept.  There are things like electric cords, lighting, xmas lights, speakers, dj mixers, pillows, fabric, spray paint, generator, tools, wood, bamboo, bendable pipe, etc that we'll need to make this happen. If you have any of these things that are just collecting dust...and not because they are being used thoroughly on the playa then reach out to us at registration@campmystic.org and we'll put them to good use and channel funds towards things we have to buy!
    • Build Crew  - We could always use more hands onsite to help build during our week onsite on Joel Otto's ranch in Wyoming where the project is currently being housed.  We tend to make it a very fun party of a time knocking out 60-70% of the work of construction before leaving for the playa.
       
    • BRC Licensing Coordinator - C-Rex completed an application in 2014 with our initial concept art and received great feedback from the DMV Hotties, but he sure could use another brain on our Team to help make the May 14th deadline with the most complete plans to ensure we get an approved Mutant Vehicle License for 2015 and have permission to drive it around.
       
    • BRC Drivers - We'll need a team of people taking shifts to take this puppy out for a spin at various times during Burning Man the week of August 30th - September 6th.  You'll pick up BRC citizens and take art tours, music tours, and drive around the playa adding delight and beauty to the streets of Black Rock City.  LOTS of Mystics had an amazing time doing this on the Great Sammich Ride and that Ride might be at another camp this year so if you had fun with making people smile last year....come have fun with us again this year! We'll do a Mystic night out on at least one evening and likely a Burn Night soiree with a bunch of us...so come join the fun.
       

    Thank you for your support

     

    Our tribe contains a plethora of extraordinary artists, musicians, healers, teachers, families and thought leaders who value contribution.  Your incredible generosity in supporting truth and beauty and art and radical creative expression has been so inspiring throughout the years. Thank you for making this incredible project possible by participating in all the ways that you do...through helping to fund it and support it with your time, energy, and efforts.

    We love you all!

     

    The Mystic Flyer Crew
story_txt:
Attention:  If you have found this campaign, please note that our current InDemand campaign for 2017 can be found here:
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/mystic-flyer-mobile-art-car-at-burning-man-2017#/   
Thank you very much for your consideration.Sincerely,C-Rex . . . aka Timothy Johnson                           
The Mystics

 
 We have a 15+ year history as a theme camp at Burning Man. We are a medley of creative talent & energy. Inspired by a sense of mystery & wonder, we perceive the consciousness of "We Are All One".  Camp Mystic is an ongoing experiment in the power of friendship, love, artistic expression, transformational dialogues, commitment, and exploration into the farthest reaches of human development and beyond.
We bring together an incredible showcase of visionary art, sculpture, live dancers, singers and performers and celebrate creativity in all its forms from some of the best artists at Burning Man and we are wanting to expand contact with the citizens of Black Rock City with our offerings by making them mobile.

 

 
 
 
New Mystic Flyer Art Project 

 
  
For the past several years we've sponsored art projects in camp and on the Playa and this year we are bringing it even bigger and better than ever by converting our 1985 school bus, formerly known as Festibus, into a mutant vehicle that can carry dozens of us around the playa to revel and enjoy the shenanigans at Burning Man and to bring our human essence of truth and beauty to the participants of Black Rock City.  The Mystic Flyer will become an incredible moving canvas for visionary artist Android Jones (androidjones.com) to fill people's eyes and hearts with his transformational art.  It will also be a traveling showcase for the many talented Mystic musicians and performers that have contributed to the legacy of our Wednesday Night Chillax Lounge parties bringing those vibes wider and deeper into the Playa than ever before possible.
Now, we are coming together to build our most challenging project ever that captures some of our essence and provides an incredible experience of visionary art, performance, music, community, cuddle pile connections, and more....all on wheels to travel the Playa and possibly to other festivals taking people on a journey of beauty, connection, and radical creative expression.
To bring this vision to life, we need your contribution.  
Proposed Roof Deck Merkabah Concept for personal out-of-body consciousness ascension and time travel plus a Level 2 Sound System DJ Setup!
 

Inspiration for shaped frames with dye-sublimated printed fabric to mutate the exterior bus-shape.   Inspired by the cool, social interactivity of rail car lounges, participants will be able to relax in chilled comfort on the hottest days and be dazzled by illuminated visionary art on cool nights.   Comfy and inviting, Mystic-style!  
  Our Mystic Flyer Team

This year we're putting together an epic team of engineers, builders, creators and artists along with an advisor on the project who built and designed from the ground level up the infamous 'Great Sammich Ride' art car. 
 

Cyberius Rex (a.k.a. Timothy Johnson), Our Leader and Visionary
Mike Cline, Engineering Consult and creator of The Great Sammich Ride (https://www.facebook.com/thegreatsammichride/ph...)

Joel Otto, Chief Engineer and Fabricator

Genevieve (a.k.a Jennifer Russell), Decor & Fundraising Campaign
Erik Flint, 3D Rendering and Image Preparation for Android Jones Art
Nimitae (a.k.a Bryan Franklin), Sound Engineer & DJ
Corazon (a.k.a. Cory Glazier), T-Shirts
Bamboo (a.k.a. Kevin Contreras), Bamboo Canvas Kite Designer
Android Jones, Visionary Artist
Julia Maryanska, Videographer + Build Crew
John Taylor, Build Crew
Greg Schneider,  Build Crew
Scott Schroder, Build Crew

story:
We're cookin' with gas!

Thanks for coming to PLAY WITH YOUR DINNER at Coogan's. The response has been an overwhelming "Yes!" to this reading series and we are so grateful for your participation.

  • Maggie Low here! It's been thrilling to bring together some of the most talented professional writers, actors and directors I know for this exciting play reading series that started February 25th and runs through April 1st.
  • Thanks to our generous donors, the first campaign raised $1,325 of a $3,000 goal.
  • Now that the reading series is up and running, people are wanting to further support this wonderful event! We are re-launching here to "pass the basket" in order to try and reach our original goal.


What We Need & What You Get

  • Our first Indygogo fundraiser looked like this https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/play-with-yo...
  • Right now we have $196 per reading which will be divided among 7-14 actors and the playwright.
  • If you liked what you saw at Play With Your Dinner, please consider making a contribution to support these wonderful artists. For your donation we'll give a special "thanks" in the program.

People are talking...

  • We've gotten great press at DNAinfo http://www.dnainfo.com/new-york/20150224/washin... and The Manhattan Times http://www.manhattantimesnews.com/dinner-with-a...
  • By attending these readings at Coogan's, you are an integral part of the creative process. You are helping writers to be heard, enjoying local actors, and directors from the community, and bringing new ones to the Heights!
  • Our first night was a sold out success of Jason Furlani's LONG HARD RAIN and the second week was a community event bringing the staff of Coogan's together in Mel Nieves' LOS EMBRUJADOS & WAC IRAQ. 
  • Repeat customers are making reservations in advance!

Risks & Challenges

  Because of you the audience, the ensemble of artists, and our hosts at Coogan's, we will have a very successful 6 week series. People are coming and they want more.

  • We are reaching out to other artists, theater companies and community organizations in the neighborhood. We look forward to collaborating with them and bringing more wonderful work to life.
  • Our goal is to find funding (grants and the likes) that will subsidize a long term program.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a donation, come back to our next reading and please spread the word!

  • Tell us what you think! We'd love to hear from you at playwithyourdinner@yahoo.com or Coogan's Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/coogans.nyc
  • It costs about $90 to print 6 scripts. Could you be a printer patron and donate the scripts?

Thanks again for being a part of Play With Your Dinner at Coogan's ♥

story:
WHAT IS "ELECTROLUMINESCENCE"?

On World Peace Day a group of artists will assemble 2,400 cups in Washington Square park. Each cup represents a person killed by a drone in Somalia, Pakistan, or Yemen, (according to reports issued by Bureau of Investigative Journalism). We will use the water from the fountain as a symbol for life. Each cup represents a vessel, a body. The piece will begin at sunrise, and end a little while after sunset.

The purpose of this installation is to create a disruption of space. We hope that this disruption will start a conversation about the disconnect between technology and reality, drone violence, peace and space. Drawing our inspiration from the bombed out buildings still standing from WWI and WWII in Berlin, and the work of the dissident Chinese artist Ai WeiWei, we invite you to help us “transform reality into a tangible experience”("Evidence"). We are not seeking to memorialize the dead, rather we are attempting to create a living representation lost life. 

In order to make “Electroluminescence” happen, we need your help. Over the next few weeks we need to raise $1,250 to pay for supplies, a film crew, and producer. We hope you can join us in building this experience in any way you can.

WHO WE ARE:

Director/Producer:

Sonia Mena is a Californian theater artist living in New York.  She recently graduated from Sarah Lawrence College and is passionate about creating work that challenges the world around her.

Producer:

Magdalen Zinky is a theatre artist and writer living in New York City. She is a co-artistic director of the Junkyard. She holds a BA in Acting from the College of Santa Fe and an MFA in Theatre from Sarah Lawrence College. 

Filmmaker:

Charlie Cole is a Brooklyn based filmmaker who’s work has played in venues such as Brooklyn Academy of Music (BAM), TEDMED stage, Art Basel, and the Slamdance Film Festival. You can view his work at www.drawingthefilm.com .

We are a group of artists, friends, and long time collaborators who have been working to create this interactive piece for the city of New York.

WHAT WE NEED:

We need money to purchase supplies, as well as pay our producer and film crew. 

THE IMPACT:

Our ultimate goal is to start a conversation. Your donations will go towards helping us pay our film crew, producer and buy supplies to begin this conversation. We hope this project will be a catalyst for new ideas and new ways of thinking about “The War on Terror” and drone warfare. Your donation, in short, brings awareness to a topic which is seldom addressed, and which, any information that is available, is highly censored and incomplete.  

RISKS AND CHALLENGES:

This is a public art installation and there are a number of things that could potentially happen in a live, interactive installation: we expect for cups to get knocked over, for dogs to drink out of them, and who knows what else! We view these things as inevitabilities that add to the piece, rather than detract from it. We will have a team of volunteers setting up, monitoring, and breaking down the piece throughout the day.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

Help us spread the word! Share this campaign on social media, send it to your grandmama, our goal is to reach as many people as possible. 

If you’re in NYC come check out the event! It will be happening from sunup to sundown in Washington Square Park, in the Garibaldi Plaza. 

Finally, if you’re interested in the project and want to get involved, contact us! We’re still gathering volunteers to help set up, manage, and break down the exhibit all day. Email us at smena@gm.slc.edu or mzinky@gm.slc.edu 

Thank you so much!

story:
Siamo l’associazione culturale no profit Dimensione Fumetto di Ascoli Piceno: amiamo i fumetti e tutto il mondo meraviglioso che gli gira intorno, siamo convinti che non sia solo una forma d’arte tra le più complesse, ma che racchiude in sé poesia, letteratura, etica e sogno.

Abbiamo creato un Concorso di Illustrazione per giovani non professionisti, che coinvolge il fumetto ma anche la cultura artistica del nostro Paese: “C’è un Lupin in città” prevede infatti la creazione di una tavola illustrata che abbia come protagonista i personaggi del manga/anime Lupin the Third, e come co-protagonista le bellezze architettoniche, archeologiche, artistiche delle città italiane.

Abbiamo scelto questo tema per sensibilizzare i giovani a riscoprire gli scorci meno conosciuti della propria realtà urbana, riqualificandoli e donandogli nuova vita. La nostra città, Ascoli Piceno, ha una storia millenaria ma è poco conosciuta, così sarà per molte altre realtà urbane: vorremmo che i ragazzi se ne rendano conto e riscoprano tutta la potenzialità del nostro patrimonio artistico, tanto maltrattato.

I lavori partecipanti saranno esposti in mostra per due settimane e una giuria di esperti premierà i migliori tre lavori: per allestire una cornice adeguata, che metta in evidenza la bellezza dei lavori e il loro contenuto abbiamo bisogno del vostro aiuto.

La somma che vorremmo raggiungere è di mille euro: verranno impiegati per acquistare cornici dove inserire i lavori, pannelli o altre strutture per esporli,  per l’organizzazione della premiazione, con il rimborso spese per la Giuria che assegnerà i premi, a cui presiederà il famoso fumettista Andrea Accardi.

Se non raggiungeremo il pieno obiettivo utilizzeremo la somma raggiunta per coprire alcune delle spese sopra elencate.

Vorremmo poter mostrare al massimo splendore i lavori partecipanti, realizzare o stimolare il sogno dei ragazzi che li realizzeranno rendendo omaggio al loro impegno e alla città che avranno scelto di rappresentare.

Il Concorso di Illustrazione è nato nel 2014, con la Prima Edizione dal tema “Reinterpreta lo studio Ghibli”: è stata un successo enorme ed inaspettato, con più di 70 tavole partecipanti (qui ce ne sono solo alcuni), inviate da quasi tutte le province italiane, da Trento a Palermo. Questa calorosa accoglienza ci ha reso dispiaciuti di non poter offrire alle tavole lo giusto spazio e la giusta pubblicità, e ci ha anche fatto riflettere su come il fumetto unisca i giovani, anche se appartenenti a realtà diverse, stimolando la voglia di conoscere meglio queste realtà, anche solo esteriormente, proprio attraverso le immagini dei luoghi che abitano.

Se riusciremo ad allestire un contesto adeguato, potremo dare maggiore visibilità non solo agli autori delle opere, ma soprattutto, ed è quello che auspichiamo, ai particolari urbanistici meno conosciuti, da riscoprire e da presentare ai turisti come gioielli artistici da visitare.

Se questo progetto vi piace, vi preghiamo di condividerlo e farlo conoscere a quanta più gente possibile, grazie, ogni contributo sarà apprezzato.

Gallery

Nella galleria di immagini potete trovare i vincitori della scorsa edizione e le foto della conferenza di premiazione con i giurati (Kappa Boys, Daw,Eleonora Sarti, Claudia Cocci, Maurizio Meldolesi, Fabrizio Faina) e le foto dell'esposizione presso la Cartoleria Cartarius di Ascoli Piceno curata da Silvia Forcina.


Perks

  • 300€ (di cui di cui 50 a DF il resto all'artista) verrà inviata l’illustrazione originale A3 del manifesto della nuova edizione realizzata da Marco Lorenzetti 

  • 10€ la stampa in A3 del manifesto dell’evento
  • 5€ il segnalibro ufficiale del concorso basato sul manifesto dell'evento


  • 100€ (di cui di cui 50 a DF il resto all'artista) Originale A3 dell'illustrazione fuori concorso di Silvia Forcina Gina's Toy

  • 100€ (di cui di cui 50 a DF il resto all'artista) Originale dell'illustrazione del manifesto della scorsa edizione di Claudia Cocci

  • 30€ la felpa originale di Dimensione Fumetto

  • 20€ la polo della nostra associazione

  • 15€ la t-shirt della nostra associazione

  • Miyazaki omaggio, formato A3,  Euro 250 di cui 50 a DF     

  • Le mille bolle blu, cm 62,2 x 31,1,  Euro 300 di cui 50 a DF

  • Pan, cm 21 x 29,5,  Euro 250 di cui 50 a DF         

  • L’altalena, cm 21 x 29,5,  Euro 200 di cui 50 a DF

  • Notturno in maschera, cm 22,4 x 23,  Euro 200 di cui 50 a DF 

  • Ricordi in un frame, cm 21 x 25,  Euro 200 di cui 50 a DF   

  • Bartleby lo scrivano (il narratore), cm 18,6 x 26,  Euro 200 di cui 50 a DF

  • Contrabbasso, cm 22,4 x 30,2,  Euro 200 di cui 50 a DF   

  • Il riposo di Mastro Muratore, cm 34 b x 22 h,  Euro 200 di cui 50 a DF

  • KFO (Killing Fuck Off), cm 18,5 x 25,  Euro 150 di cui 50 a DF


  • Ulisse 1, cm 23,5 x 25,5,  Euro 200 di cui 50 a DF

  • Ulisse 2, cm 23,5 x 25,5,  Euro 200 di cui 50 a DF

  • Ulisse 3, cm 23,5 x 25,5,  Euro 200 di cui 50 a DF

  • Se Ulisse 1,2,3 vengono venduti insieme ad una stessa persona il prezzo sarà Euro 550 di cui 150 a DF

Siamo l’associazione culturale no profit Dimensione Fumetto
di Ascoli Piceno: amiamo i fumetti e tutto il mondo meraviglioso che gli gira
intorno, siamo convinti che non sia solo una forma d’arte tra le più complesse,
ma che racchiude in sé poesia, letteratura, etica e sogno.
Abbiamo creato un Concorso di Illustrazione per giovani non
professionisti, che coinvolge il fumetto ma anche la cultura artistica del
nostro Paese: “C’è un Lupin in città”
prevede infatti la creazione di una tavola illustrata che abbia come
protagonista i personaggi del manga/anime Lupin the Third, e come
co-protagonista le bellezze architettoniche, archeologiche, artistiche delle
città italiane. Abbiamo scelto questo tema per sensibilizzare i giovani a
riscoprire gli scorci meno conosciuti della propria realtà urbana,
riqualificandoli e donandogli nuova vita. La nostra città, Ascoli Piceno, ha
una storia millenaria ma è poco conosciuta, così sarà per molte altre realtà
urbane: vorremmo che i ragazzi se ne rendano conto e riscoprano tutta la

story:
THE CAMPAIGN

On the 13th of May 2014 the owners of the Horse Hospital announced that the building was going to be put up for sale for the sum of £2.5 million. This untimely decision has caused serious repercussions, and although as tenants we are protected by the terms of the original lease, the last 18 months have proved to be an extremely testing time, both physically and emotionally with aborted attempts to negotiate and secure a future for the Horse Hospital and its activities, but one thing is certain with your support we shall fight to the last for what we have created here.

So far the response to our plight has been incredible, offers of help, advice and support have come from far and wide, and earlier this year we were successfully listed as a Community Asset with Camden Council. This astounding result had the positive effect of forming an indefinite halt to any future sale of the building.

However, this stressful journey has also been financially crippling, with hefty lawyers fees and a series of on going mandatory building works, and as a 100% independent, unfunded organisation now in its 21st year, we have been left with virtually no budget to put towards the programming in 2016.

So after much thought and careful planning we have devised a scheme to put all this offered kindness and generosity to its best possible use, and now we are proud to announce ‘The 2016 Horse Hospital Fighting Fund and Support Program’. This unique crowd-funding plan offers everyone the opportunity to help continue our fight, and also fund an ambitious program that actually celebrates independent & community forming culture. 

This recurring narrative is destroying huge sections of life in London, which is devolving rapidly into a culturally bereft corporate wasteland. It is being systematically cleansed of its cultural vitality, diversity and energy.

We define ourselves by the culture we produce, we all participate in different ways and are all ultimately accountable and responsible to protect it and protect the right of having physical spaces where cultural exchanges and community forming experiences can happen. Transformation of all kinds relies on the possibility for the most coherent and powerful radical ideas to become tradition, there needs to be room for those ideas to have a chance to be played out. 

We believe the only way to respond to all of this uncertainty and threat, is put together an exciting and ambitious program of exhibitions and events that joyously celebrates an ethos of cultural multiplicity and rejects a homogenous, thin layer of sanctioned and carefully monitored culture as a defining engine, we want to address the seismic changes London and independent culture as a whole are undergoing, and what is being lost in this violent transformation. 

 We are aiming to try and raise £30,000 to help cover our program of contributing artists shipping, fees, travel, accommodation and build a fighting fund to assist with any future unforeseen expenditure. By helping us make this happen you will all not only be supporting our cause, but also highlighting the difficulty of every organisation that is struggling to stay afloat. 

Together let’s celebrate irreverence, anti-conformism and integrity. Champion the outsider, the unfashionable, the other. Embrace the DIY, the independent, the difficult, the intuitive, the romantic and the life affirming.  

We have been inundated with amazing rewards in exchange for your donations, from rare and original artworks, to signed records, limited editions and much more, all the work has been generously contributed by artists and organizations who have worked with us over the last glorious 21 years. LOOK CAREFULLY! 

THE PROGRAM

This program will run over the course of 2016 and will celebrate work that is embedded within broader cultural narratives, work that has a profound emotional and identity-forming significance on our lives, collaborative collectives, community forming practices, work that embodies the importance of the broadest possible access to culture across a diverse range of activity and practice.

The program will include amongst many other things:

The Detroit Artist Workshop + talks

The Detroit Artists Workshop was an arts collective founded on Nov. 1st, 1964 on the campus of Wayne State University in 1964 by John Sinclair, Robin Eichele, George Tysh, and Charles Moore. The Red Door was the first avant-garde and cooperative gallery in Detroit and was closely linked to the Artists’ Workshop.

Plastique Fantastique Residency

Plastique Fantastique, a collaboration between David Burrows and Simon O’Sullivan (sometimes with others, including Alex Marzeta, Vanessa Page, Harriet Skully, Ana Benlloch, Stuart Tait, Mark Jackson, Tom Clark, Simon Davenport, Joe Murray, Lawrence Leaman, Samudradaka and Aryapala), is a mythopoetic fiction - an investigation of aesthetics, the sacred, popular culture and politics - produced through comics, performances, text, installations and shrines and assemblages.

Destroy All Monsters Film Archive + talks

Formed in 1973, the first edition of Destroy All Monsters was formed by University of Michigan art students Mike Kelley, Jim Shaw, Niagara (Lynn Rovner) and filmmaker Cary Loren.

Welcome, Space Brothers: The Films Of The Unarius Academy Of Science + exhibition and talks

The Unarius Brotherhood were on a radical mission from the late-‘70s to the mid-‘80s: to spread their “interdimensional science of life” and the principles of reincarnation to the masses via some of most wildly inventive, waaaaay outside-the-box public access TV programming in America.

Events, talks and screenings:

The Zanzibar Group, NSK, The Neo-Naturists, The Source, Athena Squatted amongst many others.

THE PERKS

There are seriously amazing rewards on offer for your donations, from rare and original artworks, to signed records, limited editions and much more, we have been inundated by work generously contributed by artists and organizations who have worked with us over the last glorious 22 years. LOOK CAREFULLY as we will be refreshing the offers every week as well as replacing works which has been claimed. 

INCLUDED ARE: BFI, Billy Chainsaw, Buried, Cathi Unsworth, Cathy Ward, Charlemagne PALESTINE & GRUMBLING FUR, Club des Femmes, Daniel O’Sullivan, Gee Vaucher, Guapo, Jem Finer, Jennet Thomas, Jeremy Reed, John Balance, John Russell, Ken Hollings, Kitty Finer, Little Annie Bandez, Marcia Farquhar, Mark Pawson, Max Decharne, Melinda Gebbie, Miron Zownir, Mothlite, Nick Abrahams, Penny Rimbaud, Pil & Galia Kollectiv, Rob Ryan, Sandow Birk, Stephen Holman, Strange Attractor, Stu Mead, Tatty Devine, Tav Falco, The Stargazer’s assistant, William Basinski, X-Ray audio and Æthenor.

ABOUT THE HORSE HOSPITAL

The Horse Hospital as an arts organization is intrinsically tied into the fabric of the building and in 2004 under the imminent threat of redevelopment, we thoroughly researched the history of this beautiful building and upon application to English Heritage it was promptly awarded a Grade 2, making The Horse Hospital a slightly less attractive prospect for property developers, we hoped..!

Built originally by James Burton in 1797 as stabling for cabby’s sick horses, The Horse Hospital is the only existing unspoilt example of a two-floor, purpose-built stable remaining for public access in London and is now an important Grade II listed building which has operated a Not For Profit policy, and provided space for underground and Avant-Garde media since 1993. It also houses and is supported by the ‘Contemporary Wardrobe Collection’, a fashion archive that specialises in post-war street fashion, sub-cultures and British design.

Genuinely inclusive, accessible, and welcoming both artistically and socially, the Horse Hospital has not only maintained a space for what might still be called the counter-culture in an ever more formalised and even corporate arts environment; it has nurtured and grown several generations, favouring the hybrid and the unclassifiable, the risk-takers and visionaries. The central stream of any culture relies on those edge dwellers for its constant renewal. With pressures on funding, public performance spaces and the time it takes to make invigorating work, the Horse Hospital is an oasis of opportunity in a city that, while vibrantly creative, remains genuinely challenging for those without significant finance behind them.

Gareth Evans – Film Curator, Whitechapel Gallery

So, however challenging it has been, the rewards of being nonpartisan keepers of culture in this magnificent and idiosyncratic building have been manifold and profound. We are incredibly proud of the fact that since 1993 we have not only been fortunate enough to have shown a vast amount of amazing work by some of the underworlds true visionaries such as Joe Coleman, Helen Chadwick, Brice Dellsperger, Dennis Cooper, Cameron Jamie, Laurie Lipton, Bruce Bickford, Gee Vaucher & Crass, School of the Damned, Vivienne Westwood & Malcolm McLaren, Franko B, Morton Bartlett, Craig Baldwin, Alejandro Jodorowsky, Lydia Lunch to name but a few, but that we have  also had the privilege to support and introduce literally hundreds of obscure artists, performers, filmmakers and writers, who may otherwise have been denied a voice by more mainstream organisations, to an ever-growing, receptive and appreciative audience.

story:
ArtouchAbout me

My name is Sze.C , I am a tattoo artist and founder of Artouch gallery in HK. I have been a tattoo artist and run my own tattoo studio for more than 13 years. In 2014, I decided to make a big change to open an art space as a platform for talented but undiscovered artists and musicians. Besides, making skin art I have created art in different media and exhibited both in HK and overseas, but for my latest art project I wanted to create something meaningful that is not just “art”.

What is the Eco-Art project?

The aim of the Eco-Art Project is to use eco-friendly products to create artwork, and through this medium bring eco awareness to the public. Also it reminds us that we have better alternatives for consumption that are more environmentally friendly.

For this project I will use eco-friendly menstrual cups to create an art piece to bring greater awareness about the environment. I have also chosen this ladies’ product as a symbol to support the " V-day” movement. V-Day is a global activist movement to end violence against women and girls. The 'V' in V-Day stands for Victory, Valentine and Vagina.

Why did I start this project?

A few years ago I discovered the menstrual cup, which offers an alternative to chemical lady products that are both harmful to our health and the environment. Since then I have been promoting this product to my female friends but was surprised to discover that not many people know about it (even though this product has been on the market for several decades) . So I started to think that art could be used to spread the word effectively … and that is how the Eco-Art project was born.

How long have I been planning this Eco-Art project?

I have been planning this Eco-Art project about 2 years. Besides thinking about what to create and how to exhibit it , I also needed to consider how to connect the art with the two important messages that I wanted to share : environment and women’s rights . Since not many women know about menstrual cups esp.in Asia, I decided last year to bring these lady products to HK and introduce them at a regular monthly Eco-lady event I organize at Artouch gallery. After that I looked for some suitable women’s organizations that fitted in with my concept. I spent a while searching and finally found V-day through watching their talks at Ted.com. Then I spent a few months communicating with Ted and the V-day people, and finally received permission from V-day so that Ted could then approve the media licence for me to use their talks in my exhibition. Thanks for the support!

When & Where will the exhibition happen?

For the first show of this Eco-Art project I have chosen a special and meaningful launch day, which will be on global V-day, 14th Feb, 2016 (no coincidence that this is also Valentine’s Day), and it will exhibit at Artouch gallery in Hong Kong.

How long will the exhibition Run?

The first show will run for a month in Hong Kong in 2016, and subsequent ones will be organized around one year later in different countries.

What we Need?

Our goal is to make this project a mobile art show, so that it can be exhibited in different countries in co-operation with different female artists. We believe that if more people get involved and share the Eco-Art project idea, then that will help awaken others’ awareness towards the environment & women's rights.

So for the first step, we need funding of around USD$5000 to cover the costs of 2-3 shows over the next 2 years. It will mainly cover buying materials and cost of venues with any surplus helping to cover costs associated with overseas exhibitions. If this project garners more attention from the public then we shall do another round of funding in the future. 

How can you help and what do you Get ?

Even if you are male it is a great gift for you to show you care and support your female friends and partner .
We have 4 perks, available for you or your friends to pick from on the right side /pane of this page ( for mobile version ), they include ladies' products, Ladycup , LadyP and LadyP case, and also a special "Thank you" card designed by artist Sze.C .

Ladycup :

LadyCup is a new menstrual cup, designed to be introduced similarly to a tampon. During menstruation, menstrual blood is collected in the menstrual cup. LadyCup is made exclusively of medical silicone. No bacteria can remain on its entirely smooth surface, it does not absorb any liquids, and thus no changes of the natural vaginal environment occur.

The material used – silicone, does not cause any known allergies. By using LadyCup, the risk of bacterial disease is reduced and the occurrence of toxic shock syndrome (TSS), a danger, e.g. in the use tampons, is prevented.

*Ladycup package comes with 100% cotton bag and multi-lingual instructions.

LadyP : 

STAND WITH LADYP

FOR THE 21ST CENTURY WOMAN, MODERN AND PRACTICAL!
PEE HYGIENICALLY! – PEE STANDING UP!

  • Ladies' hygienic device for peeing while standing up.
  • Easy to use – suitable for every woman!
  • Very portable – always ready in your handbag or backpack.
  • Hygienic – no more germs from the toilet seat!

                     

Other Ways You Can Help

As well as your financial contribution you can also help us by spreading the word through sharing this link on your social media ! Thank you !
story_txt:
ArtouchAbout me
My name is Sze.C , I am a tattoo
artist and founder of Artouch gallery in HK. I have been a tattoo artist and
run my own tattoo studio for more than 13 years. In 2014, I decided to make a big
change to open an art space as a platform for talented but undiscovered artists
and musicians. Besides, making skin art I have created art in different media and
exhibited both in HK and overseas, but for my latest art project I wanted to create
something meaningful that is not just “art”.
What is the Eco-Art project?

The
aim of the Eco-Art Project is to use eco-friendly products to create
artwork, and through this medium bring eco awareness to the public.
Also it reminds us that we have better alternatives for consumption that
are more environmentally friendly.
For this project I will use
eco-friendly menstrual cups to create an art piece to bring greater awareness
about the environment. I have also chosen this ladies’ product as a symbol to
support the " V-day” movement. V-Day is a global activist movement to end violence
against women and girls. The 'V' in V-Day stands for Victory, Valentine and
Vagina.
Why did I start this project?
A few years ago I discovered
the menstrual cup, which offers an alternative to chemical lady products that are
both harmful to our health and the environment. Since then I have been
promoting this product to my female friends but was surprised to discover that not
many people know about it (even though this product has been on the market for several decades) . So I started to think that art could be used to spread the
word effectively … and that is how the Eco-Art project was born.
How long have I been planning this Eco-Art project?
I have been planning this Eco-Art
project about 2 years. Besides thinking about
what to create and how to exhibit it , I also needed to consider how to connect
the art with the two important messages that I wanted to share : environment and women’s rights . Since
not many women know about menstrual cups esp.in Asia, I decided last year to
bring these lady products to HK and introduce them at a regular monthly

organizations that fitted in with my concept. I spent a while searching and

months communicating with Ted and the V-day people, and finally received

and it will exhibit at Artouch gallery in Hong Kong.

The first show will run for a
month in Hong Kong in 2016, and subsequent ones will be organized around one
year later in different countries.

project a mobile art show, so that it can be exhibited in different countries

share the Eco-Art project idea, then that will help awaken others’ awareness towards
the environment & women's rights.

we need funding of around USD$5000 to cover the costs of 2-3 shows over the

project garners more attention from the public then we shall do another round
of funding in the future. How can you help and what do you Get ?Even if you are male it is a great gift for you to show you care and support your female friends and partner .We have 4 perks, available for you or your friends to pick from on the right side /pane of this page ( for mobile version ), they include ladies' products, Ladycup , LadyP and LadyP case, and also a special "Thank you" card designed by artist Sze.C .Ladycup :

story:
Short story

My name is Anastasia.
Have you ever felt uncomfortable? Not in the mood so that you can’t find a place to yourself ?When tastelessness is all around there is no inspiration, and you feel depressed?

Why do we feel good in some places and bad in others? Why do we choose one or another restaurant for supper,or this or that place to have a rest?
Of course because of the coziness and the atmosphere that gives us the comfort. We want to surround ourselves with beautiful and original things. We seek to create a cozy space around ourselves in order to get an aesthetic pleasure.
But sometimes it seems to be impossible. For example, how you can take a favorite painting on a simple or a business trip? It’s really inconvenient . The usual painting is almost immovable and just hangs in one place.How to hang it in the office or the workplace? Sometimes there can be difficulties with this.
And once I thought, why not to paint on anything else but canvas. On something that easy to move, to take on a trip or to bring it to a workplace. Just imagine to have a mobile painting, a pocket masterpiece . I can make a coziness and increase my mood, get inspired and please the others at any time.
I have embodied this idea. And that's how it works. 
At first, the blank from wood is taken , then it is treated in a special way in order to obtain the sculpture of the required size, the next step is to paint patterns which create the outlines of a live figure, and down the picture is painted on this figure.
Just think, it's a masterpiece, which you can take with you wherever you want. Work, business trip, journey friend’s house , it would be appropriate for a romantic supper. It’s always easy to move. It will decorate your worktable and it’s gonna be an original gift. Just imagine a mobile painting. At any moment it can make a cosiness and bring you inspiration and joy.
Of course, I dream to open my own gallery on the collected funds.
If you can’t help my project financially, but you like the idea, tell about this video to your friends. I will be glad and grateful for any help.

What We Need & What You Get

 We need money for repair exposition's design and initial rent.

In our turn we offer part of exhibits to  you, which we can take out from the exposition. 

Moder art 

  The figure with painting «Piece» ( 5 shapes)

The blank of figure with classic painting (1 shape)

The blank of figure with classic painting (7 shapes)


The blank of figure for your painting


Other Ways You Can Help

As well as your financial contribution you can also help us by spreading the word through sharing this link on your social media ! 

Thank you !

story:
ABOUT THIS ART PROJECT

When someone mentions the word 'art'  people imagine expensive paintings hung in private galleries. Something exclusive, impersonal and, most of all, distant.

This project aims to change that and bring art back to people's lives.

Three years ago, we have embarked on an ongoing art journey around Israel introducing  various local communities to the spirit of  intuitive painting. 


WHAT IS THE PURPOSE OF THIS ART PROJECT?

The aim of this project is to help people to let go and freely express what is inside their soul. This is a traveling art-journey that takes place at sensitive and not so sensitive points of conflict, public places such as public parks,  big central avenues in the middle of a large cities and actually anywhere we feel inspired to place a canvas and paint with people.

This is real  art made by real people with no words and no hate no borders or age, gender, political background, different religions and races. Just people painting and having fun together.


WHAT IS MY MOTIVATION FOR THIS JOURNEY?

As an artist engaged in healing  therapies I fell that at this day and age we are surrounded with so much madness and violence that it poisons our souls.

I truly believe in the empowerment of creativity in each and every one of us and in the power that art holds.

I want to help allow this great creative force flow freely in the hearts of people around me in order to bring them inner peace, happiness and confidence.


WHO WILL BE SERVED BY THIS PROJECT?

Success does not play a part in intuitive art.

It is not a product it is an experience and a way of thinking. If someone opens up and starts to dream or to connect creatively I will be happy and feel I succeeded.

Art is much more fun when its done together...

I will be traveling between 8 major cities in Europe  through  the summer of 2016 , painting in public spaces connecting and creating joint art along whit different artist.

The travel blog and route of the journey will be posted on Facebook, so if you wish to participate please follow me online. 

WHAT ARE YOU SUPPORTING? 

Help me raise 5,000$ and support this journey.

This is a nonprofit project and the money I raise will help me expand this to more places and raise money to create an art exhibition.

The more funds or help I can achieve in gathering the more I can expand this project.

By supporting this project your contribution will ensure that I have enough funding for the following:

  • Travel costs: train tickets, flight tickets, renting a car if needed

  • Travel insurance

  • Cost of art supplies: paint, brushes and canvases

  • Gathering and producing an art exhibition 


HELP SPREAD THE WORD!

Connect with me if you would like to contribute or join in!

I will be happy to come to do this in your local community centers and to meet more artists.

Any donation from you will go a long way.

Whether you can contribute or not, thank you for your support.  Please also post this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or Blog pages. Spreading the word is equally as effective as donating. 

Any additional exposure is great help, Thank you.
