story:
Hi there!

We are proud and excited to introduce you to Shockerz :)

With the increased amount of use our wall sockets receive in the modern day and age, it’s strange that our wall sockets seem to be the one place in the home that we have yet to personalize!

So… what are Shockerz?

Shockerz are sets of unique laser-cut face icons that stick to your wall sockets, and will brighten up your home better than any other item available on the interwebs!



__________________________________________

What is Shockerz

Shockerz are sets of unique laser-cut face icons, designed to stick to the power outlets in your home. Shockerz will be made out of ABS plastic (the same type of plastic that wall sockets are made out of). They have a strong stick, but can be easily removed and leave no marks on the sockets themselves. Shockerz also do not act so as to prevent the regular use of the wall sockets on which they are placed. Shockerz are not only easy to apply, but also completely safe!


       


                       


To help you spice up your home décor, we have created three unique trios of stick-on faces:

Famous Musicians, Friendly Hipsters and Evil Villains, each with its own original and quirky personality.








__________________________________________

Our story

Nati and Tommy met in design school and, in their third year, were given an assignment to create something related to home décor that the average person would want enough to buy during a specifically designated lunch break.


 After some brainstorming, Nati and Tommy came up with the idea for Shockerz. It took many sketches and prototypes, but when the fateful lunch break arrived, they managed to sell their entire initial stock of Shockerz in just ten minutes!

From that point on, Tommy and Nati knew that Shockerz needed to be created on a larger scale. At this point in time, after having gained a significant amount of experience and having assembled a complete production and marketing team, Tommy and Nati finally received their blessing from spiritual master Shifu. Shockerz time has now come!


__________________________________________

We Need YOU

To cut individually laser-cut Shockerz sets is very costly, and buying a laser-cutting machine is even more expensive. We want to make use of a method called DIE CUT that will, in one go, allow us to create many Shockerz that can be sold at an affordable price. Our plan is to improve our models and conduct one big production run that will be responsible for manufacturing all types of Shockerz in all of the colorz that we have listed in this campaign. We need your backing to accomplish this! Help us win the home décor revolution, one Socket at a time!


__________________________________________

Perks

Our first set of perks are three sets of Shockerz packs, both in basic black and in another color unique to its design. We also have some cool stretch goals in mind, as well as further designs, if we reach our goal!




__________________________________________

How To Apply Your Shockerz

1. Peel off the protective backing

2. Stick on to any wall socket

3. Smile


__________________________________________

Timeline

Once we finish the campaign, we will finalize the designs and make molds for the die cutting process. This should only take a few weeks, but we are taking an extra month so that we have some buffer time to work with. Once the molds are complete, we will need only a few days to produce the different types of Shockerz. As they are not large and light weight, we expect shipping to be a fairly quick process, once the product run is complete.




__________________________________________

The Teem

Tommy (top) presented at Salon del Modile Milano. Nati (human camel) won an I.F. Design award. Together, this team assumes full responsibility to bring your Shockerz to you in time for the 2016 holiday season! Their motto? Through rain or shine, snow or sleet, we deliver your Shockerz!"


__________________________________________

Who Loves Us



__________________________________________

FAQ


Q: When will I receive my Shocekrz?

A: We plan to have all Shockerz delivered by the middle of December 2016, in time for the holidays and the New Year!

Q: What types of wall sockets can Shockerz be applied to?

A: Take a look at the picture below. If the wall sockets in your home look similar to those shown below, Shockerz will work for you. If you do not see your wall sockets, Shockerz may still be compatible with your wall sockets, so send us a picture of your wall sockets if you are not sure.


Q: Do I need to apply glue to Shockerz?

A: No, the Shockerz come complete with sticky backing. All you need to do is peel off the backing and stick your Shockerz to your wall socket to immediately infuse your home with personality and attitude!

Q: Will Shockerz fall off?

A: There is more of a chance that your wall socket will fall out of the wall, than that your Shockerz wall fall off of a functional wall socket.

Q: Will I be able to take my Shockerz off of my wall socket after it has been placed?

A: You can remove the Shockerz if you wish to do so. They make use of an adhesive that makes them easy to peel off.

Q: Will Shockerz leave a mark on my wall socket if I choose to peel them off?

A: No, the socket will be as clean as when you applied the Shockerz, if not cleaner due to the dust protection that the Shockerz provide.

Q: Can I reuse my Shockerz/move them between sockets?

A: If you peel your Shockerz off of the wall gently, they are generally reusable. Keep in mind that the sticky backing might not provide as strong an adhesive the second time round.

Q: Can Shockerz start fires?

A: No. Wall sockets are constructed from fire resistant plastic, and Shockerz are made from the same material.

Q: Is Shockerz a toy for children?

A: No! Shockerz is a decoration, and their use as a children’s toy could present a risk as a choking hazard for small children.

THANK YOU
&
 KEEP ON SMILING

story:
About: 

I am a professional artist, lecturer and practicing acupuncturist (which means I have undergone significant training in both Chinese medicine and biomedicine). Currently I am trying to complete my PhD research project that explores the metaphysics of Chinese medicine in relation to contemporary art, technology and (social) science practices. 

However, like most single parents in my position and as a postgraduate in the UK, there are no loans or adequate student funding beyond the 3 years of the studentship (and on average, only 10 percent of PhD student finish their research in this time). Unfortunately, my research project is under threat now as I have exhausted all official avenues of funding and I am struggling to make ends meet while trying to complete this project.

My research project is an important one given the current debate in national and international newspapers created by Professor Youyou Tu winning the Nobel peace prize for her research that offers an effective treatment for malaria. The controversy began because Professor Yu combined her knowledge of biomedicine with her extensive knowledge of Chinese medicine to arrive at her contribution to more effective treatment of this devastating disease. Up until now, Chinese medicine has widely been considered a pseudoscience, but Professor Yu's contribution has thrown this charge into question and is currently being debated in newspapers across the globe. 

Using the money from this campaign, I will travel to China and present my current research at the DeTao Masters Academy in Shanghai and at the same time I will assemble an important set of Chinese and international experts - artists, scientists, technologists and scholars so that together we can re-examine the debate on how the 1000 + year practice of Chinese medicine might inform not only our very understanding of what art, science and technology practices are but this project will also to contribute important new works of art and science based on what is discovered through the collated collaborative research and discussions of this project. In this way, this project will not only offer new cultural works but the exhibitions and symposia will work towards redefining what science, art and technology are and can be. 


What I Need: 

For the initial travel and accommodation to China I will need £1,400.

The cost breakdown:

1. F1 Visa to enter China: £250

2. Return flight and hotel accommodation for 10 days in Shanghai: £990

3. Travel costs to and from airports, research institutes, hotels, curators studios, etc. : £70

4. Conference registration fee: £70

5. Contingency funds: £20 


The Impact

I have already begun to establish this research (I have published my research in journals and exhibited artworks on this research across the UK and also in  Denmark, France, Germany, Hungary, Italy, Mexico, the Netherlands and the US): see: www.codephd.wordpress.com and http://www.projectanywhere.net/pulse-project-a-...

But now this project needs to extend beyond being included as part of other group shows and instead to establish its own unique field of research that generates its own symposia, exhibitions and publications. This research has the potential to significantly interest and engage an international public on a private debate that has been going on between conventional medicine and complementary medicine for decades. This project will illuminate why keeping these practices available to people really 'matters' - maintaining our physical well-being is not enough - we need to maintain a well-being that also addresses the unique emotional, spiritual, and metaphysical make-up of each human being as all the the well-being as our society at large - as an organism in itself that is open to others and is multidimensional. As a medical practice that stretches over a millennia, Chinese medicine also offers a sustainable model of medical practice.


Without your investment - whatever the amount, this important research will not be able to continue.


Risks & Challenges

Though this initial amount is realisable, the time-scale of 10 days makes it challenging to reach this goal as it will depend on how much initial funding I can secure and this can only come about from how widely it is shared in a short period of time. However, as I am part of several professional networks across art, medicine and the creative industries, I am confident this campaign should attract sufficient interest. 


If I Don't Reach My Entire Goal:

Firstly, I have priced each of the perks (see the 'Perks' section) very reasonably so that for your pledge - you will receive a unique work or treatment at a competitive rate. Additionally, any money donated to this fund will go towards supporting my research so that it can continue. As I have stated above, I am struggling to make ends meet and your contribution would help me to see my research to its completion. Also, every contributor to this project will be mentioned the dedication section of my thesis.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute:

Please could you tell your friends about this project and share my campaign on several different social platforms using the Indiegogo share tools .

Thanks for your help!!!!!!!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Claire, a founder of Barkloud, artist & designer. I have the opportunity to create a pop up gallery & store this April in Amsterdam and need your help!

I create abstract art from bark rubbings of trees around the parks of Amsterdam. From these drawings & paintings, I find very interesting characters. Animals, people and creatures from another world come to life & I use these in patterns and also in street art.

In the pop up I will show artwork, prints, cards, printed sweatshirts, accessories, furniture covered in patterns & street art. I will also showcase upcoming designers from Ireland & Netherlands. All visitors to the pop up will be able to contribute to a collective art piece, which will be sold off with all proceeds going towards the replanting of trees.


What I Need & What You Get

So far I have funded everything myself, but now I need your help to complete preparations for the pop up and to make it a success! Your contribution will go towards finishing some artwork projects such as prints, posters & mounting the art, developing products from the art such as sweatshirts etc...as well as funding the day to day running of the pop up. You will also help me to promote the pop up & share my story and passions.

Everyone that donates will receive from me a small gift & invitation to the launch event evening. Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Summary

We will be bringing together a collection of interactive animal automata to the playa. Ranging in height from 7 to 10 feet and powered by humans, these animals will represent over 2,000 years of human fascination with animated mechanisms. A barking dog, a pawing cat, a chomping dinosaur, and others yet to be determined, will make up the playful bunch that will awaken your childhood spirit!

Just like the golden spike that marks the location of Burning Man, pounded in to the ground year after year, automata show the simple nature of a ritual. With one rotation of the lever, the machine follows a predetermined sequence of operations. The dog barks as the tail circles; repeat, repeat, repeat. Nothing changes over time; the dog’s gestures remain a tradition, rooted in its wooden design. This is the basic principle behind the Free Range Animal Automata Menagerie art installation we are bringing to Burning Man 2017.

Our idea was inspired by a selection of toy automata collected by the late uncle of one of our artists. They were recently distributed among his brothers and sister, unearthed when grandpa downsized in to a new apartment. This collection continues reigniting the child-like happiness we get from operating these toys.

 As a way to remember and pay tribute to family, the dog, which is the simplest automaton of his collection, is the first to be constructed on a larger-than-life-size scale. It is in his memory, and with great joy that we bring this piece to life in BRC.

But w​hat is a menagerie without a few other animals to accompany him? We are asking you for your help to make this menagerie a reality. Help us bring the animals to life on the Playa!

Artists 

 Jon Geiger (from Seattle, WA) and Ward Crell (from Sonoma, CA) are returning to BRC for their 4th year, eager to contribute this project to the desert. In 2015, Jon created the Chariot Bar Cart, which hosted friends and wanderers to an afternoon of martinis and socializing near the trash fence on the west side of BRC. Made entirely of wood, not a single nail or screw, this chariot was sturdy enough to carry a person and be pulled behind a bike. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to construct up to six unique animals that will huddle together on the playa. We are hoping to raise $5,750 to supplement the cost of construction materials (including wood, paint, LED lighting, etc.) and animal transportation from Seattle and Sonoma. The more money we raise, the larger the menagerie!

Each artist group within the Carnivore Collective will construct separate automata, celebrating individuality and the chance to represent their unique ideas in an overall joint project. The automata will converge on the desert and be arranged so that they interact with each other when operated by a rotating lever. This menagerie will bring to life and poke fun at the radical rituals of animals, of their rivalries and playfulness, and of the circle of life.

 Automatons, or automata if there are more than one, have been around for centuries. The art of animating human or animal form has fascinated mankind since before the birth of Christ. The mechanical principles behind them go back thousands of years.  It has been a ongoing ambition of mankind to emulate living things throughout the ancient world. It is our ambition to supersize them and bring them to life on the Playa! 

Perhaps Pindar, an ancient Greek Poet from around 500 BC,  says it best in his seventh Olympic  Ode:

The animated figures stand
Adorning every public street
And seem to breathe in stone, or
move their marble feet.

Check out the great perks we'll be awarding during our campaign! All funding will go towards the construction and transportation of our animals to the Playa where they'll be free to roam, even if only partially funded, and that would be sad :( 

Risks & Challenges

We are driven towards delivering our menagerie no matter what could be thrown at us.  Despite our resolve, the Playa environment could be the source for the biggest risks.  Incredible wind and rain storms have been known to occur, and when they do, all things come to a complete stop.  However, we are veterans of the playa and know how to deal with the wind, water, and heat. If Burning Man is open for business, the playa will have a menagerie of animal automata.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like what you see here, please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! We are greatly appreciative of all your support and enthusiasm!

story:
Almost 20 years ago, I received my first camera for my Bar Mitzvah. It was love at first sight. I was so enthusiastic so I began photographing everything all the time. After a while I developed a great love for art. When I was released from the army I bought my first professional camera and a year after I opened up a photography studio and started working there. I found that my love for people and art can be a winning combination which can reflect in the photos that I make.
 

In the last 10 years I have done a lot - I have been part of so many Simchas, I have always given 100% percent of myself and got back positive feedback from all of you. Some of you even took me to photograph your moments of happiness around the world – I visited Rome, Switzerland, Colombia, France, Monaco, Panama and of countless times in New York.
Today, I want to return to my roots. Why I even began all of my photographic career. The main reason is  - Art photography.

For that reason I chose the most natural place on earth to travel to, which is- Africa!
I want to fulfill an old dream of mine and put into practice a wide photography project that will be worthy of printing as a book.
A kind of project that will give me the push I need to start branding myself as an artistic photographer.
My plan is to rent a special car, enter the depth of the safari in Tanzania with a huge set of equipment (high resolution cameras, VR360 cameras, variety of lenses which will give me all the range from 16 to 800 mm, a variety of tripods, professional drone and more), Rent a boat and sail along the crocodiles and the hippopotamus, from there I will continue to the beach and document spectacular sunsets and azure water with an infinite horizon, all in the most professional and artistic way, all ready to share with you, the people who always accompany me.
 

So, how am I going to do all of this?
Here, you enter to the picture (literally :)).
I need your help in financing this project. With your help, I will be able to use all the equipment I need in order to bring you back the most unique and  high quality photos.  
I will be able to capture the nature's masterpiece and fulfill the dreams I have always dreamt of. And of course – I would like to transform my vision and imagination with the wild nature of Africa into a photograph.
 

Your biggest help will be to purchase the photos in advance. You can choose from a wide variety of financing options and receive products thanks to your help. You will get a significant discount than the usual cost of the pictures and I will always remember you as those who were with me from the beginning and who have supported me all along the way.

Thank you and Shanah Tova,

Aviad Tevel

story:
Why We Need Your Help:

Support our efforts to interview fascinating artists, review local exhibitions, and learn about happenings around town all centering around our favorite city - Pittsburgh!

We need your help! We are a group of artists, educators, and art lovers who volunteer our time and resources to promote local art and artists. Your contribution will go directly to funding our website and all the costs that allow us to celebrate the wonderful work being produced in Pittsburgh. With your support, we will be able to continue offering reviews and podcasts, upgrade our equipment to bring you the highest quality content, and spread our mission to more people in Pittsburgh and across the nation!

Specializing in artist exposure and community accessibility, Dear Pittsburgh collects firsthand accounts from artists, promotes local artwork, and serves as a platform for critical reviews, to facilitate a larger conversation about the arts in Pittsburgh. At Dear Pittsburgh we are committed to making the arts accessible to everyone. We are a resource for artists, arts workers, students, creatives, art lovers, and collectors to come together and gain inspiration to seek new avenues to collaborate with one another and ultimately strengthen the arts communities in our city.

Visit our website dearpittsburgh.org and thanks for being artsy!

The Impact

Here is how your contribution will make a difference for our organization:

  • Promotional Marketing- Help us get the word out about all the killer things we offer to the local community!
  • Contribute to Artists- We know the importance of paying artists for their time. Help us achieve our goal of helping local artists!
  • Maintenance Fees- Help us keep our website up and running!

Check Out The Perks!

Sticker:

Example of Michelle Vecchio's Work (Small Art Print Perk!):

Example of Crystal Latimer's Paintings (Original Drawing Perk done by her!):

Meet the Team!

 

JOANNA KEMP

Executive Director, Artist Interviewer, Volunteer Manager

A Pittsburgh native, Joanna is an museum lover, a fierce advocate for art education, and a supporter of local artists. Inspired by the city’s rich history and current flourishing arts scene, she is always seeking ways to teach, enrich, and support the local arts communities that sustain today’s artists living and working in Pittsburgh.

LINZY MOGIELSKI

Director of Artist Relations and Communications

MICHELLE VECCHIO

Director Marketing and Finance

Michelle is a painter and aspiring blogger living in Pittsburgh, PA. Her work has been featured on Wigle Whiskey labels and in the 2014 Three Rivers Juried Arts Exhibition. She believes in the mission of Dear Pittsburgh to make contemporary art more accessible to all Pittsburgh residents.

CRYSTAL LATIMER

Social Media Manager
You might have seen work by local artist and educator, Crystal Latimer, on exhibit at the Pittsburgh International Airport or the Three Rivers’ Arts Festival. Ecstatic to be part of the city’s burgeoning arts scene, Crystal is particularly interested in highlighting Pittsburgh’s blue collar community spirit, and the artists and arts organizations working together to make it all happen.

 

PATRICK BAKER

Finance Assistant and Contributing Writer

Baker is always looking for new ways to connect to the constantly evolving Steel City as well as exploring its unique history. Baker's background is in international relations, foreign languages, and education, but has always had a passion for art.

EMMA VESCIO

Contributing Writer

Emma Vescio is an artist and poet currently studying English. She has been working within the art community in Pittsburgh since her Junior year in High School. Emma has passion for educating others and making art accessible. As a practicing poet and artist, her work has been showcased at Studio AM, Mixtape Cafe, and other local galleries. In her free time, she can be found reading, writing, and paying too much for Chai Tea at local coffee shops.

WE LOVE YOU AND THANK YOU!

story:
About House of Artists:

​A one-stop-shop where performing artists thrive. House of Artists features a variety of professional studios and services all under one roof; Music Recording Studio, Dance Studio, Photography Studio, Hair / Makeup Studio, Tape Audition Studio, live performances, workshops, panels, casting suite, membership packages and so much more!

​What's needed​:

​ $315,000 in capital is needed to begin operations by September 2017​. The capital will be used to secure the lease on the 19,000 sq.ft facility in Cobb County, Georgia, the buildout costs, and first year of operation expenses.
 

Why you should invest:

​House of Artists is groundbreaking and unique not only to Georgia, but a first of its kind in the United States. Housing a variety of permanent / professional studios under one roof captures an experience that many demographics and brands will benefit from. Gen Y (Youth), Millennials (Future), Baby Boomers (Parents) will all engage in a variety of activities and events at House of Artists. ​

story:
A dream to make 2017 the year that every woman finds access to support, guidance & inspiration. 

 

How are we doing this?

The 2017 Inspirational Women's Calendar, is a gateway to personal empowerment to those who buy it and for those it supports. Featuring 13 female powerhouses already reaching out across the globe in support and service of personal transformation. Sharing potent insight and inspiration, each month is an opportunity to be inspired by their work and journey with them as you are encouraged to unearth your own personal inspiration and greatness through the countless tools included. 

 

Bonus Tools that come FREE with the Calendar

To start off this year opening into motion and grace .. and ‘get ‘er done’... there is a “Get Unstuck”  Meditation. Which is amazingly transformative, and using this with the 10 Steps to a purpose-filled life, is a perfect start to the year.

How to Become the Most Attractive, Irresistible Version of Yourself eBook will help you to love yourself more!

To bring awareness of how to manifest in your reality, you need to understand that you are Living in a Holographic Universe, which is explained in this amazing eBook.

Moon and Woman: The Power of Conscious Menstruation:  his an eBook that guides to women connect with the sacred wisdom of their monthly cycle.

Did you know that your sacred parts of your body can be exercised? Well, here is a Crash course on Yoni Yoga, a powerful tantric online course that uses the yoni egg practice as the main tool for feminine sexual empowerment.  With practice, you sensitise your body. You connect deeply with your Yoni. You revitalise your entire being. You boost and harmonise your sex drive. You balance your hormones (say goodbye to PMS and menopausal symptoms). You awaken to your mystical sensuality. You start feeling your feminine power. You heal sexual trauma and you open up to a whole new dimension of orgasmic pleasure!

An online workshop to “Unleash Female Orgasms” (for men & women), because let's face it... Orgasms are more fun when they are shared! Though if you are not ready for that, you may like to start with a Sexual Healing Meditation.

And to throw in some steak knives... There are even a couple of bonus videos on:

How to dissolve threat and competition with other women

How to transform our insecurities and unworthiness in relationships as a tool for transformation and growth

 

These 13 Women have taken the inner journey, personally encountering deep challenges and courageously risen up from the ashes, expanding and transforming and now dedicated to inspiring and igniting powerful transformation in others. Beyond their surface beauty, there is a deeper radiance and strength within.

And they are at your service... (click on their names to look at their personal sites)

January -  Jodi Fedor "There's a crack in everything. That's how the light gets in". - Leonard Cohen

Feb - Layla El Khadri "Allow yourself to create the life you truly desire!"

Mar - Shelly Bullard “Become the Embodiment of Love, and Love is What You’ll Create in Your Life."

Apr - Devon Martin "Every time you sit in Silence, you come closer to home"

May - Christabel Zamor  "Stay close to anything that makes you glad you are alive."-Hafez

June - Ilona Selke "DREAM BIG - The Universe Is Listening."

July - Sofia Sundari "Expand into your natural erotic freedom as a portal to align with the divine"

Aug - Mariah Freya “Make Love With Everything and Everyone Around You”

Sep - Kirsty Ka "Here on this earth, I see so much beauty. My Mother she shows it to me."

Oct - Helena Hentz  "Birth with Love, Change the World"

Nov - Maanee Chrystal Joy  "Show me the parts of you that you don't love, so I know where to begin"

Dec - Amara Samata " Awakening the Wisdom Within

Bonus - Rosie Rees   "Vulnerability is your super power"

 

 

Not just a Calendar – a Dynamic Transformation Tool

 

What’s included?

Each month features an empowered woman shining her light and sharing her personal wisdom, work and tools in service and support. With added bonuses included with this calendar from:

  • ebooks on relationships
  • ecourses on self empowerment
  • group calls with Inspirational Women 
  • training video's
  • A community of inspired people sharing their tip and tools for making the most of Life!

This is a gateway into a deeper understanding of your Self.

Are you ready to make the most of 2017?

Each month on the Calendar has room for you to share Inspirations with your Self:

  • what is important to you
  • how have you been treating yourself
  • are you making ground on your goals
  • are you supporting yourself and those around you

 

SUPPORTING WOMEN WORLD WIDE

We want the impact of empowered women to spread across the globe!! So we are working in collaboration with onebillionrising.org and supporting their efforts through generous contributions and co-collaboration. We believe in their cause – we are one in the same and so, we work together, uniting to elevate and empower women to rise, to heal and to heal the world. 1 in 3 women across the planet will be beaten or raped during her lifetime. That’s ONE BILLION WOMEN AND GIRLS. Every February, we rise in hundreds of countries across the world – to show our local communities and the world what one billion looks like and shine a light on the rampant impunity and injustice that survivors most often face.  We rise through dance to express joy and community and celebrate the fact that we have not been defeated by this violence. We rise to show we are determined to create a new kind of consciousness – one where violence will be resisted until it is unthinkable.

 

WE NEED YOU!

The new year is fast approaching and with your support, this Calendar and Transformational Tool will be on shelves and online BY JANUARY. 

 

**We are all set to go… WE JUST NEED YOU!**

 

There are many ways you can support us and the countless women that will rise thanks to this collective work. 

 

We are thrilled to have you here and would love your support – get ready for the revolution!

 

Please share with your family, tribe and anyone who is inspiring to you!

story:
Laura Salazar, also known as Mujer Muralista, is a mixed heritage indigenous artist, muralist and educator heavily inspired by her multicultural roots to be a bridge to communities all over the world.  As a native of Oakland, she has created murals as well as taught mural art to all ages and skill sets in the greater San Francisco Bay Area for over ten years. Her goal as a muralist is sustainable community empowerment, community involvement and she believes public art has a responsibility to uplift the community.

The Do You See Me movement will grow with each community, each cause, and each mural. Created in August 2015 by Mujer Muralista, the Do You See Me movement highlights people who are the most disenfranchised with an emphasis on empowering girls and women of color. The Do You See Me movement provides a platform for participants to be featured in murals worldwide as well as contribute in the creation of the murals themselves. Mujer Muralista offers free touring mural workshops to girls and women of color where there are group dialogues and art activities around the concepts of identity, mural activism and resilience. The importance of these workshops is matched with the power of first person perspective sharing of stories and images on our social media platforms.  Participants hold multi-lingual signs that ask “Do you see me?” as a means to feature their experience and provoke the audience to think. These images are featured in the community murals themselves.

The Do you see me movement will be teaming with the Peruvian-based organization, Saphichay, whose vision is to empower Indigenous communities to reclaim their cultures via language, agriculture and art. Mujer Muralista will be featured in the Saphichay art festival for women artist warriors where she will facilitate a mural workshop in Huancayo.

During this trip she will also visit her ancestral home of Chile, South America, to create public art installations for the Do You See Me movement. She will paint large scale community member portraits holding “do you see me?” signage in Valparaiso’s former prison turned community center as well as heavily document her visits on social media.

The Do You See Me movement requests $20,000 USD for the 2017-2018 expenses which include art supplies for the touring mural workshops, volunteer painting days, permits, scaffolding and transportation in Peru, Chile, Canada and the United States.  This request includes $100-$500 stipends for our community partners in these locations such as Saphichay.  Mujer Muralista will be in Peru and Chile August 2017 and Montreal Canada by June 2018 to work with school communities of higher indigenous populations as well as participate in the Montreal mural festival. From 2017-2018 Mujer Muralista will travel within the United States to work on Do you see me movement community mural projects in New York, South Carolina, North Dakota, Nevada, New Mexico and  Arizona.  Long-term goals include documenting this ongoing project in a book compilation as well as continuing to provide large-scale public art projects throughout the Americas and the world.  By 2020 Mujer Muralista will travel to South Africa and Indonesia to work with community artists and schools to create Do you see me movement murals.

Ways you can help the Do You See Me movement:

In addition to monetary donations we accept BLICK art gift cards, airline mileage point donations, connecting us with galleries, community centers and potential mural sites in your hometown. Sharing this project with your communities is highly encouraged!

Please spread the word about our project on your social media and in your communities.  You may share using the Indiegogo share tools as well.  We are on Facebook and Instagram. Thank you for your time. “We see you!” @doyouseememovement

story:
We, at Out on Film, take great pride in our ability to connect artists and audiences and tell the stories of our lives.

Atlanta's Out On Film turns 30 and to celebrate, we are adding 3 more days, a second venue, more films and more artists to showcase the very best that the LGBT filmmaking community has to offer.  We are one of the nation's oldest, largest LGBT film festivals and this year we run from September 28 through October 8 at the Landmark Midtown Art Cinema and Out Front Theatre. Our passion is programming great films, showcasing the talent of veteran filmmakers and providing a forum for emerging voices and first-time filmmakers.  The stories these filmmakers tell come from the heart and soul, creating a window to our culture and reflecting the struggles, triumphs and joys of the LGBT experience.  Meeting these filmmakers and artists who labor sometimes for years to tell their stories allows our audience a chance to connect with them on a very personal level.   So many filmmakers want to come to the festival and we simply can't bring everyone in.   They are terrific storytellers and bring life to the LGBT experience as only we can.  It is going to  be a fabulous festival and, with your support, it will be pretty spectacular.

 

WHAT WE NEED

We are adding days, films and an additional venue.  Through the generosity of our donors and sponsors such as Turner, we have those additional costs covered.  We have a terrific host hotel in the W Atlanta Midtown and some flight vouchers from Orbitz which covers a lot.  This year, we want to bring in at least 28 artists and we’re asking you to help us raise $20,000 in the next 31 days to create a little magic.  Your donation will pay for

 

Travel for filmmakers and artists

Additional accommodations

Ground transportation

Flights are more expensive this year particularly from the west coast and average just over $500.  We want to show some southern hospitality to our international community by inviting terrific filmmakers from England, Ireland and Finland.   It is a lofty goal, but you only turn 30 once.  All of the funds raised in this campaign will be used for their travel.

Why?

Out on Film creates a safe space for the LGBT community and allies to come together and experience work created by, for, and about our community.  There are many ways to view entertainment these days, but nothing comes close to experiencing our lives together on a big screen and embracing the artists who bare their souls to us.   As a contributor, this is your opportunity to make an impact.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!  Tell your friends why Out on Film important and why everyone should support it.

Follow us on Facebook and Twitter for updates and announcements.  Visit us at www.outonfilm.org.

story:
My name is Rose Ripley, I am a special effects and beauty make-up artist in New York City. I graduated from the Master's program at Make-up Designory NYC. I absolutely adore doing special effects makeup and I hope to build a big career around it. 

Ever since I was a little kid I loved watching movies. My father showed me the movie Alien when I was six and while most kids would be scared I just wanted to see more of the creature. This sparked my passion for creature and character design as I grew up watching more films like that one.

Recently I was selected to be one of the competitors in a student make-up competition called Battle Of The Brushes at IMATS. Being a part of this (and hopefully winning) will be a big career booster for me. The location for this is Sydney, Australia which is a place I have wanted to visit my entire life but unfortunately it is very expensive. That is where I need your help. Any donation will help me a lot to get me and my model to this competition.

story:
Pre-Order Now!

Yes, it's true that we didn't hit our goal, BUT  I received a generous contribution from family that covered the production costs, so this book is in production right now!

You can pre-order at http://wendycards.com and your book will ship at the end of the month!

Current backers will get the early print run which I will receive within the next week or so.

What Will You Get?

You will get a nice, spiral-bound bound book, 8.5" x 11" (US Letter Sized) with a color gloss cover and 30 pages of 80# cover stock - printed on one side only so you can take finished pieces out for framing or putting on the fridge.

Original art, prints, and cards!

I have been painting the original bristol board drawings with watercolors. I will be offering them for sale and also perhaps limited-edition prints and/or greeting cards. Stay tuned!

story:
Hey folks,

We are Amalie Gabel and Lena Mai Merle, currently studying fine arts in Hamburg and absolutely excited to tell you about our newest project: exhibition rooms cum laboratory - TONENTON.

When Amalie first found out that her old "home" and art space was up for rent again, she could not hold back her excitement and pulled Lena right into her dream to use the beautiful architecture for something magnetically appealing like an off space.

Thus, in search of an experimental, hybrid and risky conglomerate, the concept began to develop.

We are now at the point where we can say that many different people, artists, writers, musicians, art spaces, performers and surprises are craving to use the old tower and connect between each other and with us.  Let us make TONENTON the headquaters for our contemporaries.

Both of us have been involved in big projects like the annually returning exhibition “We take no responsibility” or “Duesseldorf ist ARTig”. 

Now, what can you do to help? 

Donate to make the space ours!

Share to get more people involved and visiting!

Come by to participate and support the artists!

We are looking forward to seeing you there and hang out.

 

What We Need & What You Get

All in all we will need about 5400 Euros for the full rent for 6 months. 

An edition of 60 magazines for 6 months will cost 360 Euros.

 

So what we are actually campaigning here for is around 

80% rent, 10% magazine print and 10% material costs (nails, paint, seats etc.)

The financial rest we will be innovative about: 

We have applied for more than 30 funds and will continue doing that, have acquired financial support from the HFBK Hamburg for transport costs, as well as some kind support from private people, thus have the first 2 months of rent together already and Lena is really thrifty when it comes to haggling for great second hand treasures.

Also, we are being supported by lots of artists, who have donated some of their works to be given away as perks to our donators. 

Thus, as a thank you to your kind donation you can receive everything from a thank-you mention in our magazine, over an original sketch up to an artwork, one magazine up to a subscription, 5 exclusive and one of a kind photos documenting TONENTON, as well as a thank you dinner with a tour through the space and meet and talk with the artists. 

We promise to make this happen- we are nomadic and can adjust! 

If we do not meet the goal for our rent, your money will not go to waste. Creating a space for our contemporaries is our goal and we will host the full programme!

 

The Impact 

TONENTON combines the wish to claim a historical building and keep it in valuable use and intact with the possibility to give people from different countries and backgrounds a stage and meeting place to experiment and explode with opportunities to do and discuss! 

We believe that opportunities to exhibit in such magical places are rare- especially under young and art-market-outsider artists. The tower will be like a waterhole for them and our magazine a voice. 

Exhibitions to be hosted will be among others a curatorial experiment, where the invited curators will work with a fundus from artists to create a new exhibition every second day for two weeks. One focusing on painting today, another focusing on borders and politics today.
Besides that we will host many concerts, readings, symposiums etc.

So, feel free to check out our facebook page for our future events!

www.facebook.com/tonentontower

You can also find us at http://www.tonenton.com

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are also two broke students, but we are ingenious:

Letˋs discuss some art and ideas!

SHARE, SHARE, SHARE, spread the word!

Help us out and take over a shift to guard our exhibitions! 

Or just come by and drink a cuppa coffee or good ol´beer with us!
story_txt:
Hey folks,
We are Amalie Gabel and Lena Mai Merle, currently studying fine arts in Hamburg and absolutely excited to tell you about our newest project: exhibition rooms cum laboratory - TONENTON.
When Amalie first found out that her old "home" and art space was up for rent again, she could not hold back her excitement and pulled Lena right into her dream to use the beautiful architecture for something magnetically appealing like an off space.
Thus, in search of an experimental, hybrid and risky conglomerate, the concept began to develop.
We are now at the point where we can say that many different people, artists, writers, musicians, art spaces, performers and surprises are craving to use the old tower and connect between each other and with us.  Let us make TONENTON the headquaters for our contemporaries.
Both of us have been involved in big projects like the annually returning exhibition “We take no responsibility” or “Duesseldorf ist ARTig”. 
Now, what can you do to help? 
Donate to make the space ours!
Share to get more people involved and visiting!
Come by to participate and support the artists!
We are looking forward to seeing you there and hang out.
 

What We Need & What You Get
All in all we will need about 5400 Euros for the full rent for 6 months. 
An edition of 60 magazines for 6 months will cost 360 Euros.
 
So what we are actually campaigning here for is around 
80% rent, 10% magazine print and 10% material costs (nails, paint, seats etc.)
The financial rest we will be innovative about: 
We have applied for more than 30 funds and will continue doing that, have acquired financial support from the HFBK Hamburg for transport costs, as well as some kind support from private people, thus have the first 2 months of rent together already and Lena is really thrifty when it comes to haggling for great second hand treasures.
Also, we are being supported by lots of artists, who have donated some of their works to be given away as perks to our donators. 
Thus, as a thank you to your kind donation you can receive everything from a thank-you mention in our magazine, over an original sketch up to an artwork, one magazine up to a subscription, 5 exclusive and one of a kind photos documenting TONENTON, as well as a thank you dinner with a tour through the space and meet and talk with the artists. 
We promise to make this happen- we are nomadic and can adjust! 
If we do not meet the goal for our rent, your money will not go to waste. Creating a space for our contemporaries is our goal and we will host the full programme!
 

The Impact 
TONENTON combines the wish to claim a historical building and keep it in valuable use and intact with the possibility to give people from different countries and backgrounds a stage and meeting place to experiment and explode with opportunities to do and discuss! 
We believe that opportunities to exhibit in such magical places are rare- especially under young and art-market-outsider artists. The tower will be like a waterhole for them and our magazine a voice. 
Exhibitions to be hosted will be among others a curatorial experiment, where the invited curators will work with a fundus from artists to create a new exhibition every second day for two weeks. One focusing on painting today, another focusing on borders and politics today.Besides that we will host many concerts, readings, symposiums etc.
So, feel free to check out our facebook page for our future events!
www.facebook.com/tonentontower
You can also find us at http://www.tonenton.com
 

Other Ways You Can Help
We are also two broke students, but we are ingenious:
Letˋs discuss some art and ideas!
SHARE, SHARE, SHARE, spread the word!
Help us out and take over a shift to guard our exhibitions! 
Or just come by and drink a cuppa coffee or good ol´beer with us!

story:
The birth of Razor

We all have folders specially for all kinds of social networkings, right? Communication has never been more convenient, but we are not feeling closer to each other at all. 

Massages can be sent easily in all kind of methods, but we still feel that only writing expresses our feelings the best. A fountain pen is one of those rare objects which connects our hearts and souls.

Here we want to proudly introduce Razor, a CNC machined titanium fountain pen to you!

As our designer Jane said, from the lines we draw, we see souls. Each line has its soul. Razor is something alive.

"I like the Razor Titanium fountain pen because it has a cool industrial look to it that appeals to me."- the-gadgeteer.com 

The sketch design of Razor.

From material, machining process, packaging, etc, we want everything about Razor to be perfect. It took about 2 years to finally have the finished Razor on hand. We are every close to the final step, and now we need your support. Every support from you will pay off.

We don't love Razor for no reason.

About Titanium

In case you are not familiar with Titanium, it’s an incredible metal. Due to its light weight, strength and toughness, it’s used to build spaceships and the most advanced fighter jets.

  • Light weight
  • Strong & tough
  • Rustproof
  • Corrosion resistant
  • Beautiful metallic luster
  • Vibrant and beautiful colours after heated

​We choose the Grade 5 titanium to give you the super high quality one and only fountain pen, made from a real space age material, that you can enjoy and use every day.

Sleek, silky, sturdy, Razor is the expression of ourselves, what we think is the perfect combination of art, utility and permanency.

The nib is the soul of a pen. To ensure the great writing experience, we used the BOCK 250 Nib, F point. Made by Peter Bock AG, one of the best nib system factory in Germany.

  • Industrial style clip with DLC coating on titanium.

  • Unique CNC machined serial number inside the clip. Just like you, every Razor is the one and only.

Titanium clip + ceramic bead, the clips can easily put in a pen pouch or your pocket.

Perspective view of the body.

The barrel is also designed for those of you who like the one-off ink bag. The room is enough for 2 ink bags. Carrying a backup ink bag eliminates worries of running out of ink any time.

Comfortable grip for even long time writing.

 

Not all CNC machining maintains the super high precision standard, but we do. Every circle of the thread, every inch of the body, you can only see the colourful light on products made by Titaner.

  • Ultra hard cemented tungsten carbide glass breaker.
  • It’s like the iron hand in the velvet glove and saves lives in emergency.

Note: Make sure you hit in the corner of the windows.

We hope you never have to use it, but should there be an emergency, Razor will be there to help you out.

Converter & nib

Meet our team

Shawn Zhang – Product Design

Jessica Chan – Marketing

Leo Zhang – CEO & Pacemaker

Jane Zhang - Content and Social Media

Jeff Wong - Production

Follow us on Facebook & Instagram

       

The stage where we are now

We've now finished the samples and everything is satisfying. The design is finalised after closed tests over and over again. Now your support is very important to us. With your support, we can contact BOCK to import the nibs at the best price. Also, We'll have better idea of the most proper output quantity, to ensure the luxury quality and the reasonable price at the same time.

We've been producing EDC products for over ten years and we are intending to offering chance of enjoying CNC machined products to more people. 

 

After the campaign

After the campaign succeed, we'll order the nib system right away, as they need to be reserved ahead of time. Then we'll start the whole production process and prepare for all the packaging stuffs.

All parts of your pen will be by Titaner workshop in Shaanxi, China.

We know that some of you will say, oh no! Not China~ But we are here to redefine the concept of Made in China.

Each single pen is produced by the experienced and ingenuity master of CNC diligently. We believe the product speaks itself.

 

Risks & Challenges

After about 2 years of preparation, we are finally one step to make it happen. We are so excited and confidence. All the time, efforts and sleepless nights bring us here. We’ve produced dozens of samples and had them tested by some pen addicts and strangers alike. The campaign starts only after all details are perfect. Still, there might be some problem we didn't foresee, so we’re committed to fixing any challenges that may arise during the whole process. We’ll share photos and videos of each step in the process of making your pens and make sure everything on track. 

Now it’s your chance to have the super high quality and unique minimalism fountain pen, made from the extraordinary titanium , that you and your love can enjoy and use every day from then on.

We look forward to working with you to make this project happen. Your support really means a lot to us.

Also, our designers have come up with many super cool fresh ideas that we hope can share more with you after this project succeeded.
 

Shipping

All pens will be shipped within 2 months after the project succeeded. Although this is the first crowdfunding project for us on Indiegogo, our rich experience in production, packing and shipping worldwide make us well-prepared for the project.

Your pen will come beautifully packaged, so they are really great to give as quality gifts. Now we have everything in place, just click that little button to back us and share this project with your friends! 

Looking forward to enjoying this exciting journey with you great people!

story:
Short Summary

ArtBNC is a platform where emerging and independent visual artists can feature and sell their fine art products and build their careers through leveraging cutting edge technology tools. ArtBNC is in pre-launch and we are working to get to launch in 2 to 3 months. 

The Team is committed to a strategy to onboard artists on the platform and go live summer of 2018. ArtBNC is passionate about the success of the emerging and independent artist.

What We Need & What You Get

  • ArtBNC is seeking small contributions, up to $250; no amount is too small
  • We will offer an original work of art by Charlotte collage artist John Robert Miles, III
  • $100 contribution to our fundraising will get you two launch party tickets for Charlotte, NY or Miami launch events and 2 art prints (Pinkston's Art Gallery)
  • $50 contribution will give you 2 art prints (Pinkston's Art Gallery)
  • All funds will be used to get the startup and web platform ready for launch, including business activities required to go live

The Impact

  • ArtBNC is a new startup that has not yet received any funding; we are well positioned to receive funding in the future, but we need seed funds right now
  • Your contributions will help us get to launch by July or August of 2018.
  • Artists are the story tellers of the world; we need you to help us launch this platform to the artists of the world

Risks & Challenges

  • Launching a startup is no easy task; it requires funds to make every move and step forward, and it is very difficult to raise seed money
  • We have already invested significant sums of money and put funds into building our platform, conducting research and developing strategies for over two years
  • Our challenge now is to get to launch and with your help we can do so
  • We are working diligently to win micro-funding with some great options in our headquarter city of Charlotte; we are confident that we will be successful

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We hope that we can get some artists to help us; artists can also ask other artists to contribute
  • We also hope that if you love art you will contribute; let other art lovers know about our campaign

story:
Demo Videos

Carving Wolf Tattoo: Using V-parting

Carving Dragon Tattoo:  90 minutes, Using V-parting and Small gauge

 

 

The Next-Generation Carving Art

 

Create your own "Shining Figure" by using Carving Knives

Skull tattoo, 120 minutes, used V-parting and Small Gauge

 

 

SofViCK Starter Kit

*Basic carving knives include: x1 V-parting knife, x1 Small gauge knife.

 

 

Woodcarving is one of the oldest and most popular hobbies in the world. But while many people attempt to take up woodcarving as a hobby, they often give up soon after they begin.

One of the reasons for this is that they feel woodcarving requires too much time and too many tools in order to create works of art they can be proud of. Sadly, many people do not have enough spare time to put aside to enjoy the creative satisfaction that comes from creating their own wood carvings.

Fortunately, there is now a new way to carve that takes only a couple of hours, requires far less work, but provides great creative satisfaction.

 

 

SofViCK stands for "Soft Vinyl Carving & Knives". The product comprises a soft vinyl alien head that can be carved with complete freedom by the owner using specialist carving knives made by us.

Dragons tattoo, 90 minutes, used V-parting and Small Gauge

 

 

Wolf tattoo, 45 minutes, used V-parting

 

 

Unlike woodcarving, all you need to enjoy SofViCK is a soft vinyl toy figure and a set of specialist carving knives. By simply carving the surface of the figure into unique patterns, you will create a beautiful and brightly colored design in no time at all.

 

Just carve the surface, you can immediately create beautiful furrows.

 It’s quick and easy so anyone can do it. There is no need to prepare any sandpaper, chisels, paints, or coating wax. Simply create your pattern and enjoy immediate results.

This is easy to do, and no previous carving experience is necessary. Even if you've never done anything like this before, you can still create an amazing design that is uniquely yours.

Left: Swirl Alien, 150 minutes, used V-parting and Small gauge　Right: Gear Alien, 60 minutes, used V-parting and Small gauge

 This is the easy way to create a unique work of art for your home, and the only limit is your imagination.

 The difference between standard woodcarving and SofViCK is that while woodcarving uses plain solid woods, SofViCK uses transparent soft-vinyl toy figures covered with black paint. This is easier to carve than wood, and you can create stunning patterns in minutes.

Simply hold the alien figure and carve your own pattern using the carving knives. You can use two different shapes of blades to create different patterns, just like you can with traditional woodcarving. What’s more, optimized LEDs are also included inside the figures. When you turn on the LED, the light shines through the colored mold to reveal the intricate detail of the carvings, and it looks amazing in a dark room.

 

 

We have over 100 years of history creating knives, and we have long been known in Japan as the No.1 carving knife manufacturer. Each knife in the set has a slightly different design, and you can use each one to create a different pattern.  

Blade #1 V-Parting

Blade #2 Small gauge

 

How to utilize them?

 

Scorpion tattoo, 60 minutes, used V-parting and Small gauge

 

1. Easy and Comfortable to Carve

From the first moment you carve into SofViCK using a specialist blade, you will be surprised by how comfortable and easy it is.

The soft vinyl feels great in your hand, and slowly carving the paint provides enormous satisfaction. Carving SofViCK is also much easier than carving wood, so you won’t feel exhausted after carving.

2. Create Intricate Furrows

As soon as you start carving, you will instantly see the beautiful carved furrows appear on the figure. The furrows, carved with our high-quality carving knives, shine out and create a stunning effect without any need for further work. 

With standard woodcarving, on the other hand, you cannot create a furrow like this without a lot of effort polishing the carving with sandpaper. SofViCK becomes a finished carving with a simple cut of the knife and no extra work.

Left: Leaf & Flowers, 90 minutes, used V-parting　Right: Inner Fire, 75 minutes, used V-parting and Small gauge

3. Simple Steps that Anyone Can Enjoy

Enjoying woodcarving requires a lot of work. First you have to prepare a large selection of tools including saws, chisels, sandpaper, paints, coating wax, and carving knives. Then once you start carving, it may take many days, or even weeks or months, before you can enjoy the final result.

While we love the craft of woodcarving and the satisfaction you can get from spending time and effort creating a carving, it’s also true that you might not have much time to spare. With SofViCK, you can enjoy the creativity and satisfaction of carving without the time and effort required to carve wood. All you need is the carving knives and the toy figure, and you can create something amazing. No colors, no sandpaper, and no surface coating need.

 

 

Top Japanese carving knife maker located in Seki City. 

At Yoshiharu Cutlery Co. Ltd. we have been making cutlery in Seki City, Japan, for over 100 years. For many years now we have been known as the No.1 knife manufacturer in Japan.  

Our craftsmen have honed their skills over many years, and every one of the SofViCK blades has been hand-finished by our artisans with impeccable care and attention to detail.  

 

The refined skill of finishing blades still lives on in the performances of our craftsmen of today. The blades of SofViCK have been hand finished by our artisans one-by-one, with impeccable care.

Ltd. we have been making cutlery in Seki City, Japan, for over 100 years. For many years now we have been known as the No.1 knife manufacturer in Japan.  Our craftsmen have honed their skills over many years, and every one of the SofViCK blades has been hand-finished by our artisans with impeccable care and attention to detail.   The refined skill of finishing blades still lives on in the performances of our craftsmen of today. story:
I am Paul Barile. I am a writer. My goal has been to explore every facet of the craft. I am very excited to introduce you to an band new comic book called "The Summit of Justice." This comic blends youthful mythology with traditional superhero action.

I am trying to raise $1,000.00 to print the first run. It is currently at the colorist and from there the letterer. If I e close to my goal - the next stop would be your mailbox.

The impact for the reader is to be part of the genesis of a new project. The impact for me is that the book will end up in your hands. The impact for the community - is to build a wider fan base - maybe people who know about my plays or my novel or my audio-book who will now know about this  project.

Please consider a little something something - and if things are tight - just take a minute to share this with your friends. It is always difficult to innovate. Please share the idea and help me to bring Justice into your home.

story:
Short Description

Two months ago, I decided to take the chance of applying to The Other Art Fair in New York City, a fair where only non-represented artists are allowed to show. To my delight, I was selected to have a booth at the show, which takes place May 3-6 of this year in Brooklyn. This campaign is to help raise funds to cover the numerous expenses involved with the exhibition including registration, shipping of artwork, air tickets and food and accommodation in NYC for approximately ten days. 

 

A bit about myself

I am an architect by trade but left it in 1999 to pursue my career as a visual artist and photographer. I have concentrated on photography for the majority of my time, as it's easier to engage with an audience, but my gut instinct was pointing me to paintings and abstraction. I have exhibited off and on in various galleries and pop-up in Hong Kong, but haven't had the right opportunity to show my work outside, that is, until now, at The Other Art Fair. 

Most people will know me by my male nude photography of Asian men. I'm really proud of the work that I did there and I still am working on that project, but to a lesser degree than before. As such, I have included some of those works in the Perks. They will be limited editions prints. 

 

How will the money be used? 

I have broken it down as follows:
Registration Fee: $2,300
Air Tickets: $1,800
Accommodation for 10 nights: $2.600
Shipping of Artwork: $1,700
Food & Beverage (exhibition and staff): $1200
Transporation/Travel:  $600
Staff Help: $500
Total: $10,700
Add 15% Miscellaneous: $1,600
Total: $12,300

 

The Journey, The Inspiration

When I left my trade profession of architecture, I was immediately compelled to create artwork, things which I thought was beautiful. My first artworks were monochromatic graphite artworks, but I soon became interested in painting. Since 1999, I have been painting off and on with small exhibitions, both group and solo in Hong Kong. More importantly though is that during the course of the years, I have been looking for a language of painting that speaks to me, that reflects authenticity or my own 'style'. Instead of going to an art school, I scoured Youtube and found all the inspiration and guidance I needed in the works of Cy Twombly, Basquiat, Cecily Brown and abstract expressionists Jackson Pollack, Willem de Kooning and Robert Motherwell.  I am pleased to say that the series of paintings that I plan to have on show in The Other Art Fair is something I feel very much in tune with me. 

 

The PERKS

The Perks are listed on the right-hand side. Below, are links to the various Perks where you can select your desired artwork.

NOTE ON ORIGINAL ARTWORKS: 

Once an original artwork is selected, meaning it was purchased, I will place word SOLD in the description. So the earlier you buy, the more selection you have.

- MISHSMASH A5 Doodle Drawings

- Hard:Rewired artworks in Series A, B, and C. 

 

MISHMASH A5 Drawing Doodles

Quirky and fun quick A5 doodles. Let it go! I have selected 20 drawings from my MISHMASH collection. These are one-off drawings, so if you choose this Perk, the first-comers will get their choice first. Click on the image below and come back here to purchase. 

(Link)

 

Hard:Rewired (Series A, B, C)

The artworks offered here were created shortly after a dog bite. The incident came as a negative setback on what I was working on, but also pushed me to further pursue my artwork with more fervour, releasing or revealing a part of my self that surfaced in the artworks that I have created. They can be seen as art therapy, to which I transferred the pain into what I was working on. See the selection of artwork by clicking on the link below. 

(Link)

 

Art Prints (Signed Limited Editions)

I have selected the most recent paintings to be printed as fine art prints. These will be signed limited edition prints of 99, accompanied with a Certificate of Authenticity. 

The following print sizes are offered:

a) 13 x 17" (Edition of 10)

b)  16 x 24" (Edition of 10)

c)  20 x 30" (Edition of 10)

(Link)

 

AM Photo Prints (from the Asian Male Series)

The photographs in the link below have been carefully selected to appear on the Indiegogo campaign, whereby the Asian male has been interpreted as fine art images. The following paper sizes are offered:

a) 13 x 17" (Edition of 10)

b)  16 x 24" (Edition of 10)

c)  20 x 30" (Edition of 10)

These are limited edition prints and are accompanied with a Certificate of Authenticity. The images are shown here with a bordered frame to give you a sense of how it may look like when framed. 

(Link)

 

Patrons

All Contributors will be mentioned in the Project Catalogue, with the following allocation for members reaching the following levels of Patronage: 

Gold Patron: USD$750 

Silver Patron: USD$1500

Platinum Patron: USD$2500 and above.

 

The Impact

In putting together this campaign, I really wondered what good art did for the community. For several days, I pondered on what artists gave to people and questioned whether creating art was a purely selfish endeavour, but I soon realised that this would only be true if I didn't share the artwork with others and only kept it to myself. My inward journey of investigation and internal exploration is only worthwhile if it goes 'out there'. I love to talk about my artwork and how it came to be -- from the mind, from consciousness itself. It could only be expressed in the artwork that I do. Your contribution helps me continue that journey.

story:
Summary

Architect Dan Brunn's 'Bridge House,' currently under construction in Los Angeles, is an innovative new residence that ties together breakthrough advancements in construction and sustainability technologies to exemplify the future of home building. The result: a modular, net-zero energy, and visually striking home that exists in harmony with the natural brook it literally bridges.

Inspired by the minimalist aesthetic, dynamic spatial choreography, and trailblazing techniques of Brunn's design, we—the LEGO artists at Cornerstone Brick Designs—have decided to embark on a project of similar magnitude to Bridge House.

Our goal: a 17.5-foot-long, 102,439 piece model of Bridge House, meticulously designed to fully replicate the architecture of the eventual, finished house. Everything from the panoramic windows to the solar panels on the roof will be captured in brick form. 

Our ambition has not gone unnoticed. Already, our LEGO model is set to be displayed at the Dwell on Design expo in Los Angeles from April 5-7. We've also reached out to Dan Brunn Architecture, which is tremendously excited by the replica project, and has given us access to the designs and agreed to let us construct the model inside the real Bridge House! 

This is where you come in. Donate, and you can make your mark on what will become a monumental replica. Find out more below.

What We Need

We must raise at least $25,000 to get this enormous replica ready for its big debut in less than a month!

Money you contribute goes primarily towards buying LEGO bricks. While bricks are usually sold for around $0.10 per piece, more than 100,000 of them (plus shipping) cost a lot of money! Other costs include:

  • Engraving on bricks
  • Plexiglass for the huge windows
  • Manufacturing & shipping our reward items
  • Hourly wages for additional builders.

What You Get

If you donate to our campaign, you're helping our model become a reality... and you also stand to get a variety of exclusive perks!

For our contributors, we've assembled special Cornerstone Brick Designs materials, discounts, and services including:

  • Free 3-day passes to Dwell on Design (April 5-7) at L.A. Convention Center to ALL our contributors.
  • Having your name engraved on the finished LEGO Bridge House.
  • A book about the making of the model.
  • A mini-model of Bridge House, the first-ever Cornerstone Brick Designs building kit.
  • A 20% discount on a new Cornerstone Brick Designs commission.
  • A personalized LEGO model of your home.

Top-tier supporters will even receive invitations to the exclusive opening reception for the real Bridge House!

Your Impact

Here's the difference your contribution will make:

  • Every dollar contributes to a concrete (or rather, plastic) goal! We have a clear end result and a clear deadline, so the money you give has tangible effect on our ability to make the model happen.
  • Our ultimate goal is for LEGO Bridge House to steal the show at Dwell on Design. Making a splash there would provide Cornerstone Brick Designs with tremendous publicity, expanding our business opportunities in the future.
  • By helping us on this immense, highly visible project, you keep our dream—the dream of being professional LEGO model makers—alive. We'd sure appreciate that!

Challenges We Face

We have an incredibly tight turnaround on this project— 100,000+ parts must be assembled by April 5th. Even though the labor is gonna be intense and we'll be racing the clock, we believe we can do it. Why?

  • We are master builders. Bruce, Aaron, and all the people we're bringing in to help are  experienced and talented LEGO Artists.
  • We have a dedicated work space—inside Bridge House itself!—open to us 24/7.
  • We have a majority of the design already finished as a digital model.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help us. Here's what you can do:

  • Get the word out! The more eyes land on our page, the more likely we are to hit our goal.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to show this campaign to your friends and family.

We can't wait for you to join us on this project!
